As a Babban Gona member, Abubakar will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Abubakar is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thus eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Nakali

texts.en:
Nakali is 48 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Many years ago, She established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 6 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 6 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers. In the future, She plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Flor De Jerico Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Flor de Jericó está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras de Éxito, coordinado por doña Miriam de 60 años de edad, casada, es una mujer trabajadora, que se dedica a la venta de ropa, prendas de acero y zapatos, desde hace dieciocho años. El crédito lo solicita por primera vez para la compra de anillos, aretes, pulseras, camisas, pantalones y zapatos. La tercer socia es Yadira de 64 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y fritanga, el tercer socia es Martha de 36 años, propietaria de una pulpería.
texts.en: The "Flor de Jericó" communal bank is made up of three enterprising and successful women. It is coordinated by 60 year old Miriam. She is married and is a hard-working woman who has worked selling clothing, stainless steel jewellery and shoes for 18 years. She is requesting her first loan to buy rings, earrings, bracelets, dresses. pants and shoes. The second member is Yadira who is 64 and works selling clothing and fried food. The third member is Martha who is 36 and owns a small grocery store.

loans.use: to buy rings, earrings, bracelets, dresses. pants and shoes.

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is a 46-year-old married mother of nine children, four still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur

Noralyn has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Noralyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her local market.

Noralyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her local market.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 50-year-old married mother of five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Gemma has a weaving business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abacca, silk and other materials for her business.

Gemma has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy abacca, silk and other materials for her business

loans.name: Kristine Joy

texts.en:
Kristine Joy is 28 years old, married and has two children, one still in school.

Kristine Joy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Kristine Joy requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Kristine Joy has been pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Kristine Joy would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Doris Mercedes

texts.es: Doris tiene 29 años, es muy dedicada y responsable, esde estado civil casada, su esposo es agricultor, tiene una hija de 12 años de edad Pamela, está estudiando en una institución de la localidad, Doris hace 10 años atrás se dedica a la compra de ganado lechero. Ella necesita el dinero para poder comprar una vaca para ir aumentando así sus ganancias con el fin de ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Doris, 29, is hard-working and responsible.  Her husband is a farmer and her daughter, Pamela, 12, studies at a local school.  Doris has operated a milk business for 10 years.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy a cow.  The investment will increase her earnings and, in turn, help to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her milk business.

loans.name: Nasiru

texts.en:
Nasiru is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Nasiru has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Nasiru would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Nasiru can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Nasiru will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Nasiru is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thus eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Munkaila

texts.en:
Munkaila is a maize farmer from Damarivillage. As a Babban Gona member, Munkaila is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Munkaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Munkaila will use this loan to store the maize he harvests,enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Munkailano longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Munkaila hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Alhaji has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Alhaji can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Alhaji is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thus eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Ummar

texts.en:
Ummar is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Ummar has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ummar would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Ummar can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Ummar will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Ummar is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, thus eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Maya

texts.en:
Maya is 37 years-old. She is married and has three children aged 21, 15 and 14. Many years ago, she established her cow farming business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and she used her most recent loan to buy hay and medication for the animals. In the future, She plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and as fuel for fires, and it can also be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy hay and medication

loans.name: Sonu

texts.en:
Sonu is 41 years-old. She is married and has 2 children aged 20 and 17. In 2002, she established her poultry farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy small chickens for her business. In the future, Sonu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chicks

loans.name: Nhuche Maya

texts.en:
Nhuche Maya is 50 years-old, married and has one children. A few years ago, she established her electronics business. Working seven days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy electronics goods. In the future, She plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In Nepal, large supermarkets are rare. Instead, most items can be found in the small, densely packed pasals that line the streets of every city and village. Piled high with utensils, paper goods, and anything else one would need, these stores are your one-stop shop in Nepal. Although usually packed into a space no larger than 100 square feet, these stores carry a sizeable and diverse inventory. With the help of a Kiva loan, pasal owners are able to keep inventory up and their customers happy. Competition is fierce, but with extra capital and a bit of creativity, the opportunity for profit is there.

loans.use: to buy electronics goods

loans.name: Sanju

texts.en:
Sanju is 43 years old. She is married and has two children. In 2000, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five previous loans from Kiva partner Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buys grocery goods for her shop. In the future, Sanju plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasal, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati is 40 years-old. She is married and has two children, ages 20 and 18. Many years ago, she established her tailoring business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received, and successfully repaid, three loans from Patan BPW; and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, Parbati plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell materials and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children, as well as traditional women's (kurta surwal) and men's (daura surwal) clothing. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Estefani Group

texts.es: Estefani es un grupo conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras, coordinado por Doña Clemencia de 63 años de edad, acompañada y madre de un joven de quince años, ella es una mujer laboriosa con muchos deseos de superación, se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado desde hace tres años, el crédito lo solicita por séptima vez en la institución, para la compra de pantalones, blusas, chores, sandalias y zapatos, con el crédito anterior logro comprar una máquina de coser, un televisor y una refrigeradora, la segunda socia Tania de 24 años de edad, quien se dedica a la venta de tortilla, la tercer socia es Jessenia de 20 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
The three members of the Estefani community bank are hard-working and enterprising businesswomen.  

The group's coordinator, Doña Clemencia, 63, is married and has a 15-year old son.  She operates a clothing & footwear sales business and works hard because she wants to get ahead in the world.  She has operated the business for three years and is applying for her seventh loan.  She will use the loan to stock her business with trousers, blouses, shoes and other merchandise that she will resell.  She was able to use her last loan to buy a sewing machine, a television and a refrigerator.  

The other members of the group are Tania, 24, who has a tortillas sales business and Jessenia, 20, who has a clothing & footwear sales business.

loans.use: to stock her clothing & footwear sales business.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita is a resident of Calape, Bohol. She is married and has five children; three adult and two-school-aged children.  Amelita has always been dreaming of a better life for her children. She wants to give them good education for them to have better lives in the future. Therefore, she works hard to provide their needs. For eight years, she is engaged in buying and selling “tuba” (a Filipino word which refers to a coconut wine). This is the reason why she is asking for a loan, she needs an additional capital (to buy "tuba") to run her business continuously. Aside from this, she plans to buy piglets and feed as well. Perhaps, she is thinking of raising pigs. This definitely helps her augment their livelihood and give her the chance to reach her dreams.

loans.use: for additional capital to buy "tuba" , piglets and feed

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita works hard to support her family. Pacita is married and has a bamboo strips weaving business in the Philippines.

Pacita requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bamboo for her mat weaving business.

Pacita has been in this business for 6 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Pacita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bamboo for her mat weaving business.

loans.name: Tukur

texts.en:
Tukur is a maize farmer from Damari village.As a member of Babban Gona, Tukuris is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Tukur would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Tukur can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Tukur is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Mustafa is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Mustafa would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mustafa will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Mustafa now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Tasiu

texts.en:
Tasiu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Tasiu is thankful that the days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Tasiu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Tasiu will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Tasiu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Khusbu

texts.en:
Khusbu is 27 years-old. She is married and has one child. A few years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid one loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, She plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margans. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita and her family live a simple life in a town of Clarin, Bohol. She is married and has nine children. Anita helps her husband financially by raising pigs. Thus, she needs an amount to buy additional piglets and feed as well. That is why she is asking for a loan. Anita’s only wish is to improve their livelihood and have enough money to send her children to school. She wants them to finish a degree to have better lives in the future. With our help, we can possibly help this woman in reaching her goal of sending her children to school by giving her the amount she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle is 36 years old. She is married and a mother of five children. Annabelle helps her husband in running their rice farm to earn a living. They have been doing this for more than 17 years. They need an amount to buy seedling, fertilizer, rice farm sprayer and pesticides as well in order to enhance the growth of their plants and have a bountiful harvest. Annabelle aims to have a good harvest for her children. Definitely, she will use their profit from their farm for her children’s education and to provide for the basic needs of their family because this business is their main source of income. As of now, her main goal is how to improve their livelihood for her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy seedling, fertilizer, rice farm sprayer and pesticides

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is a 56-year-old woman from Clarin, Bohol. She is married and has three children. Out of these three children, she still has one-school-aged child; aged 20 years old. Delia needs an amount of PHP8, 000 for additional capital to her sari-sari store business which runs for almost five years. She will buy commodities such as drinks, canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, sugar, chips, biscuits, candies, powdered juice and powdered milk from the amount she is requesting. In addition, Delia’s husband is a farmer and works hard for their family. They aim to improve their livelihood and have better means of living.

loans.use: to buy rinks, canned goods, noodles, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, sugar, chips, biscuits, candies, powdered juice and powdered milk

loans.name: Elita

texts.en: Elita has lived her life relying mostly on farming to keep both ends meet. At 55, even with her children already grown, she works hard in her rice farm in San Miguel, Bohol. She is asking a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay for labor of other farmers to keep her farm. Elita wish to have an abundant harvest so she can save for the next planting season, keep enough rice for consumption and make her business sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and pay for labor of other farmers

loans.name: Marcel

texts.en:
Marcel is a single woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 31 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Marcel has a buy-and-sell pottery business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Marcel requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more pottery products to sell on her stall.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more pottery products to sell on her stall.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 40 years old and has one child. She is married and has one child still in school.

Mary Ann is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig. Mary Ann has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 54 years old and has three children. She is married and one of her children is still in school.

Mely is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. Mely has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mely would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is 37 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur.

Carmelina has a raising livestock business in the Philippines. Carmelina requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Carmelina has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Carmelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is a 57-year-old married man with three children, all of them married. Thy resides in a rural area of Bakan District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. Being a farmer on the rice fields he can only make $9 USD per day to support his family. He has been involved in this career for nearly 30 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, he decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for his house. He is very happy with this loan, since it will promote his health, the environment, and his living standards.

He would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Abd-Alnasser

texts.en:
Abd-Alnasser is a 35-year-old married man from Dier El Balah city, located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. However, he wants to improve his family standard of living help them live more comfortably.
 
Abd-Alnasser took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Abd-Alnasser will be able heat water more efficiently, enable the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing the electricity expenses.
 
Abd-Alnasser appears in the photo

loans.use: order to buy a solar system for heating water for the family house

loans.name: El Gigante Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad muy tranquila del Estado de México se integró un grupo que lleva el nombre de El Gigante ya que los integrantes tienen grandes sueños y esperanzas para que sus negocios se vuelvan enormes. Todos ellos son originarios de una comunidad de tradición mazahua aunque desgraciadamente pocos son los que hablan su lengua materna. 
   María del Carmen es una de las integrantes más entusiasta y siempre está de muy buen humor mismo que transmite a sus demás compañeros cuando tiene oportunidad. Desde hace  más de 18 años abrió una tienda de abarrotes ya que necesitaba una fuente de ingresos para cuidar de sus hijos ya que lo hacía sin apoyo de nadie más. Actualmente ofrece una gran variedad de productos a precios accesibles y con una excelente atención para que sus clientes regresen. Todos los días abre su negocio a partir de las 7 de la mañana y cierra hasta las 8:00 de la noche brindando así un servicio extendido que opaca a cualquiera de su competencia. "Muchas veces en la misma comunidad tengo otros vecinos que también tienen su tienda de abarrotes, por eso mismo yo debo esforzarme más para que las personas regresen" comentó.
   En esta ocasión, con la ayuda del préstamo, compraría refrescos, jugos, artículos de cremería, etc. Ella se encuentra muy agradecida con los apoyos ofrecidos en VF México los cuales ha aprovechado al máximo para reinvertir en su negocio. Uno de sus más grandes sueños es poder ampliar su negocio para después abrir otra tienda dentro de su municipio o en otro aledaño.
   Los otros integrantes del grupo son Joaquín quien invertirá en un taxi; Jaime, en su panadería; Ma. Guadalupe, en ganado bovino; Susana y Amalia, en ropa; Celinda, en una tienda de ropa; Carmen, en verdura; Agustina, en una tortillería y María Regina hará lo propio con una pollería. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de María del Carmen quien viste el suéter color negro.
texts.en:
The members of our community bank meet in a quiet town in Mexico state.  The members call their group El Gigante because they hope to grow their small enterprises from small businesses to large ones.  All of the members are Mazahua, though none speak the Mazahuan language.  

María del Carmen is one of the group's most enthusiastic members and the other members tell us that they value her enthusiasm and good humor.  She has operated a corner grocery for more than 18 years, a business that she started because she needed the income and had no one to rely on but herself.  She sells lots of different products now, at reasonable prices and her customers come back again and again because she provides an excellent service.  She normally opens the shop at 7:00am and stays open until 8:00pm, long hours that give her an advantage over other local groceries.  "Many other groceries have opened in the neighborhood over the years", she says, "so I have had to work harder to make sure that my customers continue to shop at my store".  María del Carmen is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with soft drinks, juices, toiletries and other merchandise.  She is very happy with VF Mexico, she says, because she has been able to make the most of the loans she's received to build her business.  For the future, she hopes to open a second store in the town or one of the surrounding towns.  

The other members of the group are: Joaquín, who has a taxi business; Jaime, who operates a bakery; Ma. Guadalupe, who raises cattle; Susana and Amalia, who have a clothing business; Celinda, who owns a clothing store; Carmen, who sells vegetables; Agustina, who makes and sells tortillas; and María Regina, who has a poultry sales business.  

* The photo was taken in the store that María del Carmen owns and she is pictured in the photo wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to stock her corner shop.

loans.name: Hương's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hương is 43 years old and she is married. She has had a service business tailoring clothes for more than 10 years.Hương lives in Yen Dinh district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in her village.

The main hardship that Hương faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth for expanding her tailoring business.

In 2013, Hương joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of three-member group.

In the future, Hương hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth for expanding her tailoring business.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 58 years old, married with five children.

Carmencita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Carmencita has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Carmencita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ubadat

texts.ru: Убадат, 54 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как об ответственной, честной женщине. Убадат в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи 22 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 22 овцы. Дополнительно у Убадат есть земельный надел мерою 3,0 ГА, где она выращивает фасоль, табак и кукурузу для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду Убадат, ее деятельность приносит около 39,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров и овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Убадат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, в будущем она хочет улучшить жилищные условия ее семьи.
texts.en: Ubadat is 54 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. She has a secondary education and very good references from her neighbors. They consider her to be a responsible and honest woman. To provide the primary income for her family, Ubadat has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 22 years. Her farm contains 4 cows and 22 sheep. Additionally, Ubadat has 3.0 hectares of land, where she grows beans, tobacco and corn for sale. Thanks to Ubadat's hard work, her business yields about 39,000 som (KGS) per month, which provides for the family's food and basic needs expenses. To continue developing her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy 3 cows and sheep for fattening up and resale. Ubadat plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business and improving her family's living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy 3 cows and sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Loricar

texts.en:
Loricar is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Loricar is 36 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Loricar has a weaving business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy abaca, silk and other materials for her business.

Loricar has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy abaca, silk and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Naiem

texts.en:
Naiem is a 24-year-old married man from Rafah city, located in the Gaza Strip. He works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. However, he wants to improve his family standard of living help them live more comfortably.
 
Naiem took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy water  solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Naiem will be able heat water more efficiently, enable the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing the electricity expenses.
 
Naiem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy water  solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Darcy

texts.en:
Darcy is 22 years old and a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

Darcy has a baking business in the Philippines. Darcy requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her baking business.

Darcy has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Darcy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her baking business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 36 years old and has three children. Jocelyn is married and has three children who are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jocelyn has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Kathryn

texts.en:
Kathryn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Kathryn is 37 years old and has three children who are in school.

Kathryn has a raising livestock business in the Philippines. Kathryn requested a PHP 26000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Kathryn has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Kathryn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. Lilia is married and has a raising pigs business in the Philippines.

Lilia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Lilia has been in this business for 2 years now.

Lilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria works hard to support her family. Maria Victoria is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Maria Victoria requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Maria Victoria has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Maria Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina works hard to support her family. Marina is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Marina requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy piglet, feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

Marina has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Marina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglet, feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Reap's Group

texts.en:
Reap’s Group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Reap works as fisherman and he also does extra work as a seller to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses as well as save time needed to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for his family.

loans.name: Zulhumor

texts.ru: Зулхумор, 51 год, замужем, мать 3 детей. В качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, Зулхумор на протяжении многих лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Зулхумор имеется 2 коровы, 20 овец. На 0,21 Га земли выращивает картофель. Бизнес приносит около 33,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зулхумор обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для дальнейшего развития бизнеса. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства, что улучшит благосостояние семьи и позволит накопить на покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en: Zulhumor is 51 years old, married and a mother of 3 children. To provide a source of income for her family, Zulhumor has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for many years. Today, Zulhumor has 2 cows and 20 sheep. She also grows potatoes on 0.21 hectares of land. The business yields about 33,000 som (KGS) per months. To continue developing her business, Zulhumor requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy livestock. She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business, which will improve her family's welfare and allow her to save money and buy furniture for home.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Atobek

texts.ru:
Любитель автомашин, Атобек. Он любить водить автомашину. Атобек около 4 года занимается таксистом. У Атобек есть автомашина марки «NEXIA DEWOO». Его машина является источником дохода. Путем автомашин Атобек зарабатывает, кормить, и одевает семью. Атобек житель района Бохтар. Он там родился, вырос и проживает. Атобек женат и отец 3 дочерей. 
У Атобек сломался автомашина, он данный момент без работы. Ему надо обеспечить семье, но его автомашина находится, а мастерком. Атобеку хочет восстановить двигатель автомашины, чтобы скорее начать зарабатывать. К сожалению, у него нет денег для купли запчасти и на оплаты за услуги мастера. Поэтому Атобек обратился за кредитом. Он очень нуждается на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Atobek is a car enthusiast and loves to drive cars. Atobek has been working as a taxi driver for about 4 years. He has a Nexia Daewoo car, which serves as his source of income. Atobek earns a living, feeds and clothes his family through the use of his car. Atobek is a resident of the Bohtar district, where he was born, raised and currently lives. He is married and a father of 3 daughters.

Atobek's car has broken down and is currently left without work. He must provide for his family, but his car is in at a repair shop. Atobek wants to repair the car engine in order to resume his work as soon as possible. Unfortunately, he does not have money to buy the parts and pay for the repair. This is why Atobek requested this loan. He really needs Your support.

loans.use: to buy parts for his car and pay for the car repairs

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, who is a 19-year-old single woman, resides in a rural area of Bakan District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. Being a garment worker, Pov can only make $7 USD per day to support her family. She has been involved in this career for nearly three years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, Pov decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, the environment and her living standards. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Las Mariposas De Mayorazgo Group

texts.es:
Mariposas de Mayorazgo es el nombre elegido por las integrantes de un grupo del Estado de México debido a que les gusta mucho este pequeño y colorido animal. Todas viven en una comunidad pequeña llena de riqueza natural por ejemplo los arboles de distintos tamaños y de los cuales se obtienen diversos frutos. Su comunidad tiene orígenes en la cultura mazahua y muchos pobladores conservan su lengua materna, además de su carácter trabajador y amigable.
   Remedios es una persona seria pero muy trabajadora que mantiene un gran espíritu emprendedor. Su esposo y sus dos hijos son lo que la motivan a entregar día con día lo mejor de sí misma en sus labores y metas. Reme, como le dicen de cariño, se dedica a la cría de animales, sobre todo ganado bovino, e  inicio cuando al mismo tiempo de haber formado su propia familia; su suegra la instó a iniciar con dicha actividad pues por experiencia propia asegura que es un muy buen negocio. Actualmente adquiere los ejemplares en su comunidad y durante tres meses los cuida hasta que alcancen un desarrollo óptimo y después los ofrece con comerciantes locales. "Afortunadamente durante mis 8 años de trabajo me ha ido muy bien y mis ganancias han sido favorables, de alguna manera he podido  hacer crecer el negocio y solventar ciertos gastos de mis hijos" comentó Reme satisfecha. 
   Hoy en día no necesita salir al campo para cuidar de sus animales pues construyó un corral donde obtienen todos los beneficios necesarios. Una de sus metas es hacer aumentar la producción de ganado para tener un movimiento eficaz de compras y ventas.  Ahora, con su oportunidad de préstamo, comprará un animal más en orden de alcanzar sus objetivos.
   Las demás integrantes del grupo son Catalina, Rosio y Nayeli quienes de igual manera invertirán en la compra de ganado bovino.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el centro municipal, Reme es quien viste el suéter rosa y carga a un bebé con su reboso.
texts.en:
The members of our community bank call their group Mariposas de Mayorazgo [Butterflies of Mayorazgo] because they very much like that small and colorful insect. Their small town is surrounded by natural beauty and they cite the many different fruit trees of all sizes as an example.  Most of the people of the town are Mazahua and the indigenous language is still spoken by some locals here.  

Our member, Remedios, has an entrepreneurial spirit.  She is married and has two children and says her family is her motivation for working towards her goals.  Reme, as she is known, started a cattle business after she married.  Her mother-in-law urged her to start the business because she knew from experience that it would bring a good income.  She buys calves from local sellers and keeps them for three months until they have grown enough to sell on to buyers.  "I have operated the business for 8 years", she says, "and, happily, it's a success . . . I have used my earnings to better provide for my son".  She built a pen for keeping and caring for the cattle, so she no longer has to keep them in the country as before.  For the future, she wants to keep more cattle so that she can better balance what she buys and sells.  She will use this loan to buy a head of cattle, an investment that will help her to meet that goal.

The other members of the group, Catalina, Rosio and Nayeli also have businesses buying and selling cattle.  

* The photo was taken in the town's main square and Reme is pictured wearing a pink sweater and reboso.

loans.use: to buy three calves and feed.

loans.name: Domingo Guzman

texts.es:
Domingo con 55 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, casado,vive junto a su cónyuge, en el distrito de Nueva Arica,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú,en una zona rural.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, crianza y venta de animales.

Domingo se dedica a brindar los servicios agrícolas de jornalería; con más de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio. Solicita préstamo para arreglos de vivienda y para mantenimiento de equipos y herramientas, dicha inversión le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus equipos y herramientas, con gran influencia en el negocio.Domingo piensa mejorar productividad de sus servicios y así poder atender las diversas necesidades de los habitantes de la zona.

Domingo es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa. Domingo a tenido 5 créditos de 600,00; 1000,00; 1500,00; 1500,00 y 3000,00 los cuáles los a cancelado de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Domingo is 55 years old and in a common law marriage.  He lives with his partner in the district of Nueva Arica, province of Chiclayo, in the department of Lambayeque, Peru, in a rural area.  The residents of the place make a living mostly in agriculture, raising and selling animals.

Domingo makes his living offering his services in agriculture as a day labourer.  He has more than five years experience in this business.  He is requesting this loan to make some home repairs and to do maintenance on equipment and tools.  This investment will help him to keep his equipment and tools in better condition, which will have a great influence on his business.  Domingo intends to improve the productivity of his services and in that way to attend to the diverse needs of the residents of the area.

Domingo is a recurring partner for Edpyume Alternativa.  Domingo has had five loans, of 600,00; 1000,00; 1500,00; 1500,00 and 3000,00, all of which he has paid off in a timely manner.

loans.use: to make home repairs and maintain equipment and tools.

loans.name: Ashour

texts.en:
Ashour is a 18-year-old single man from Rafah city, located in the Gaza Strip. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. However, Ashour wants to improve his family standard of living help them live more comfortably.
 
Ashour took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy water  solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Ashour will be able heat water more efficiently, enable the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing the electricity expenses.
 
Ashour appears in the photo.

loans.use: order to buy water  solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is the owner of Balloons Extraordinare. He is originally from Medillin, Colombia. He started his business because he wanted to provide people with quality balloon decorations. His business is dedicated to making customers smile, one business at a time.

He has lived in the United States for 38 years. Through owning his own business, John has been able to support his family and employ two family members. John's greatest success has been being contracted to host balloon-twisting events at his local children's hospital.

He is currently seeking a loan that will help him set up changes in utility use for his business. His vision for the future is to see his business grow and become more stable over time.

loans.use: to pay for changes in utility use.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Being a farmer on the rice field, Phan, who is a 45-year-old married woman with four children, can only make $5 per day to support her family. Phan resides in a rural area of Bakan District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in this career for nearly 15 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, the environment, and her living standards. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita works hard to support her family. Pedrita is married and has a raising livestock business in the Philippines.

Pedrita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Pedrita has been in this business for 7 years now.

Pedrita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 36 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Roselyn works very hard to provide for them.

Roselyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like bread, canned goods, dried fish, candies, detergent soap, coffee, etc. to sell.

Roselyn has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, canned goods, dried fish, candies, detergent soap, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Roselyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like bread, canned goods, dried fish, candies, detergent soap, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family. Thelma is married and has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Thelma requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Thelma has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 51 years old and married with three children. 

Anastacia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Anastacia requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Anastacia has been in pig fattening for 6 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Anastacia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Jermilin

texts.en:
Jermilin is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her dried fish vending business.

Jermilin has been in this business for 21 years. Jermilin earns more income from general store.

Jermilin has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Dulcisima

texts.en:
Dulcisima is 66 years old, married with six children.

Dulcisima works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Dulcisima has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from selling dried fish.

Dulcisima aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Liberata

texts.en:
Liberata is 54 years old, widowed with six children.

Liberata works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection.

Liberata has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Liberata aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Imelda is 48 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Imelda has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials like fabric, threads, etc. for her business.

Imelda has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like fabric, threads, etc. for her business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 52 years old and has four children. Gina is married and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Gina has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 57 years old, married and has four children.

Veronica is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Veronica requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Veronica has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Veronica would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living her general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.  Sonia is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to  buy additional groceries to sell for her pig fattening business farming rice and tailoring businesses.

Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Armi

texts.en:
Armi is 58 years old and has six children.  

Armi is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Armi requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Armi has been in this business for 9 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Armi would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Medarda

texts.en:
Medarda is 52 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Medarda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as bread, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Medarda has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Medarda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as bread, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry works hard to support her family. Cherry is single with two children and has a buy and sell slippers and bag business in the Philippines.

Cherry requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of slippers and bags to sell to her store.

Cherry has been in this business for 6 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

In the future, Cherry would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of slippers and bags to sell to her store

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 51-year-old married woman with four children, one attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rosalina has had a fish vending business for 26 years and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a 57 year-old married mother of three children who works hard to support her family. She is a teacher and her husband works in agriculture. Although the family works very hard, it can be not enough for them to afford the cost of their son’s education.

This loan of $ 1000 will allow Beatriz to help her son study at University. She will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies. Beatriz loves her son very much and hopes that further education will help them to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies for her son at university

loans.name: Kimanga Group

texts.en:
Fidelina is in her early 20s and is married with one small child. She has been selling cosmetics for three years now. She works from 8am to 9pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be FIidelina's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase on the cosmetics stock and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to take care of her child and family, to repay loan and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the best selling cosmetics to meet her customers' request. She dreams of selling new and second hand clothes.

Fidelina will share this loan with her loan group KIMANGA which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the best selling  cosmetics  to meet her customers' request.

loans.name: Hiek

texts.en:
Hiek, 42 years old, is married and has five children, three of them married. She resides in a rural area of Bakan District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. For nearly twenty years, Hiek has been farming rice, and she only makes $5 US per day to support her family.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, Hiek decided to apply for a Kiva loan, through HKL, to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, the environment, and her living standards. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Hean

texts.en:
Being a farmer on the rice field, Hean, who is a 43-year-old married woman with four children, one of them married, can only make $5 USD per day to support her family. Hean resides in a rural area of Bakan District, Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in this career for nearly 20 years now.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, the environment, and her living standards. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Los Vecinos Del Rincón Group

texts.es:
Cierta comunidad mexiquense parece un pequeño escondite entre los cerros repletos de árboles frondosos en donde habitan personas muy trabajadoras y amigables. Gran parte de la población se dedica a la cría de animales como además de realizar una actividad que se ha mantenido por siglos; el cultivo de maíz. El lugar, además, cuenta con bellos paisajes, casitas típicas y coloridas y una gran variedad de especies naturales. Los burros son indispensables allí pues ayuda  los lugareños a transportar leña, agua, ropa, comida, etc.
   Doña Juana es una persona muy alegre, trabajadora y ante todo, entusiasta; su única motivación siempre ha sido sus seis hijos de los cuales dos continúan estudiando en la comunidad. Desde hace más de 20 años inicio con la cría de ovejas, pollos y pavos con el propósito de ayudar a su esposo Félix con los gastos del hogar. "Decidí iniciar con este negocio para ayudar con los gastos y la educación de nuestras hijas, aparte puedo cuidar de ellos sin salir de casa" comentó Juanita, como le dicen de cariño.
   El proceso de cría dura algunos meses, mismos que utiliza para crear las condiciones necesarias para que los ejemplares alcancen un desarrollo óptimo. Entre más grandes y mejor alimentados estén, sus ganancias son mejores; de igual modo para apoyar la economía local, adquiere sus animales dentro de su misma comunidad. 
   Por otro lado, está muy contenta y agradecida con VFMéxico porque ha visto avances y beneficios después de conseguir la ayuda. Actualmente no tiene problemas para reinvertir en sus negocios ni en los gastos de su hogar. Con este nuevo apoyo compraría  más alimento y animales suficientes para cubrir las solicitudes para el fin de año. Doña Juanita tiene mucha fe en su negocio y espera que aumente su producción para seguir apoyando a su hija quien quiere ser un médico destacado. 
   Los otros integrantes del grupo son José Juan quien invertirá en su negocio de comida mientras que Faustino, Delfina, Eulalia, Guillermo y María del Carmen, en ganado ovino.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el quiosco del municipio, Doña Juanita es quien viste la falda gris y el suéter morado.
texts.en:
Certain Mexican towns seem lost in leafy mountain forests, but there are friendly and hard-working people there. Many of them make their living from the land as their ancestors have for centuries.  The beautiful landscapes, the colorful traditional houses and the many natural riches make our area special.  

Our member, Doña Juana, is a happy and enthusiastic woman.  She has worked hard to support her six children, two of whom are still in school.  She started a business raising sheep and poultry more than 20 years ago to help her husband, Félix, with the family's expenses. "I decided to start a business to help with expenses and our daughters' educations", she says, "and this business allowed me to earn an extra income and still be at home to care for my family".  She keeps the animals for several months until they have grown enough to sell on.  The bigger and better-fed the animals are, the more she can sell them for.  She supports the local economy by buying the animals from local buyers.  She is grateful to VF Mexico, she says, because she has benefited from the loans she has received.  She is applying for a new loan that she will use to buy more animals and feed.  The investment will cover her expenses until the end of the year.  Doña Juanita is confident in her plans for her business and expects to go on growing it.  She hopes to continue supporting her daughter who wants to be a doctor.

The other members of the group are José, who will invest his share of the loan in his food business and Faustino, Delfina, Eulalia, Guillermo and María del Carmen, who all have businesses raising and selling cattle.  

* The photograph was taken at a kiosk in the town and Doña Juanita is pictured wearing a gray skirt and purple sweater.

loans.use: to buy sheep and grass for her animal sales business.

loans.name: Firma

texts.en:
Firma is a 60-year old married woman with eight children, two attend school. She earns a living selling snack foods to nearby schools. She lives in Maribojoc, Bohol. She also sells tuba (coconut) wine.

She is unable to expand her source of income and joined CEVI to access loans and improve her business. She wants to buy ingredients and more tuba (coconut wine) and set aside some of the profit to renovate her house.

She wants to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy  ingredients  and tuba (coconut wine).

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 36 years old and married with four children. With her four children in school, Perlita works very hard to provide for them.

Perlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Perlita has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Perlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 50 years old and married.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

Lourdes has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 22 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell such as canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Analiza is 35 years old.

Analiza has a buy-and-sell beverage business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more drinks to sell.

Analiza has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married woman, 72 years old with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Betty has a buy and sell recycled materials business in the Philippines. Betty requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of recycled materials to sell.

Betty has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Luzmila Esther

texts.es: Luzmila de 49 años es una comerciante residente en un barrio de Malambo, un municipio del Atlántico en donde inició su negocio de venta de mercancías varias en el año 2000, promoviendo una oportunidad de ingresos adicionales a los que su cónyuge aportaba para el beneficio de su grupo familiar. Luzmila siempre deseó dedicarse a esta profesión puesto que le apasionan las ventas y con el apoyo de su cónyuge pudo llevar a cabo su sueño de prosperidad.  Ella consideró que entre sus vecinos y amigos existían potenciales compradores de prendas de vestir, calzado y accesorios, así que maneja una variada oferta de productos. Lo que más le agrada a Luzmila de su labor es que puede compartir más tiempo con sus hijos y encargarse de las labores del hogar puesto que no cuenta con horario laboral rígido y simplemente busca momentos propicios para compartir con sus amistades y vecinos e inmediatamente oferta sus productos.   En la actualidad desea mejorar los inventarios y para ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en prendas de vestir y calzado para aprovechar la temporada navideña. Su meta a futuro es continuar en su negocio y que este le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ludmila is 49 years old and a resident merchant of the neighborhood  Malambo, a municipality in the Atlantic where she began her business selling various goods in the year 2000.  Thus,  providing additional income opportunities to the ones already contributed by her spouse, for the benefit of their family group. 

Luzmila always wanted to work in this profession because she is passionate about sales and with the support of her spouse she could carry out his dream of prosperity. 

She felt that among their neighbors and friends there was potential buyers of clothing, footwear and accessories, so she handles a wide range of products. 

What most pleases Luzmila of her work is that she can spend more time with her children and take care of household chores because she does not have rigid working hours and she just looks for opportune moments to share with friends and neighbors and immediately offer her products. 

Currently, she would like to improve her inventory, and as such, she is requesting her first credikiva through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she will invest in clothing and footwear to take advantage of the holiday season. 

Her future goal is to continue with her business which would enhance the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to invest in clothing and footwear to take advantage of the holiday season

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Johnnah is 20 years old and is the youngest of five children. Her mother, Rosita, supports the family through a general store business.

Johnnah is studying Hotel Restaurant Management and is currently on her last year of this 2-year course.

Rosita will use the load to pay the tuition fees of her child's 1st semester in 2015-2016.

Johnnah plans to graduate and be gainfully employed

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Lorliny

texts.en:
Lorliny is 50 years old, married with one child.

Lorliny works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection.

Lorliny has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lorliny aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection

loans.name: Eli

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Eli, who is a 38-year-old married woman with two sons and one daughter.

Eli has been selling clothes and her husband has been a driver for three years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build improved sanitation at their home and improved access to clean water for their family.

Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and access to water sources, but Eli will be able to repay the loan received.

Eli and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: this loan will be used to build improved sanitation at their home and improved access to clean water for their family.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 30-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession.

For a long time, he has wanted to replace his old rickshaw's body. Because of this, he is unable to attract passengers due to the ugly looking vehicle and to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of the new rickshaw body.
Therefore, she has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of the rickshaw body. This will help him to continue his business.

Parveen is so very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy new rickshaw body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 50-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband is the guardian of the family and responsible to fulfill the need of all family members. Shamim has been running her own beauty salon for the past 10 years. She also contributes her income with her husband to manage the household.

She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hairbrushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not able to buy these items for her business purposes.

Therefore Shamim has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purposes so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn a more profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family. For this financial assistance, Shamim is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Liman

texts.en:
Liman is one of Ruma's agents and lives in West Bandung, a suburb located in West Java, a 3-hour drive from Jakarta the capital of Indonesia. He lives there with his wife and his daughter.

He and his wife own a small stall to sell consumer products and mobile airtime credits. He knew about Ruma from a Ruma’s sales executive that came to his house; he decided to join Ruma because he wants to learn to start up a business through technology.

As the business grows, Liman wishes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to process more mobile airtime credits. Liman’s goal is to provide an e-commerce business for his customers via a Ruma product known as Mapan.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community

loans.name: Hermanto

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! This is Hermanto, one of Ruma agents. Hermanto lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He owns a stall that sells small snacks, drinks and mobile airtime credits for his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard that Ruma has the best service and system and he wants to expand his business with Ruma. Hermanto is a friendly person and his community sees him as an informative mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Hermanto needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan  from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to his community. As seen in the photo, Hermanto is the one who is sitting in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
Bimala is 50 years-old. She is married and has two children, aged 26 and 24. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, She plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called a pasal, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margans. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Belmaya

texts.en:
