Belmaya is 60 years old, married and has one children, aged 26. Many years ago, she established her milk sales business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy young cow. In the future, She plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.

In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young cow

loans.name: Sare

texts.en:
Sare is a 42-year-old married woman with two children, one of them is married. She has grown rice for 18 years and earns $5 USD per day to support her family. Sare resides in a rural area of Pea Reang District, Prey Veng Province, Cambodia.

She decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, the environment, and her living standards.

She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Nirmala

texts.en:
Nirmala is 40 years-old. She is married and has three children. Many years ago, she established her tailoring business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received, and successfully repaid, six loans from Patan BPW; and used her most recent to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, She plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell materials and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children, as well as traditional women's (kurta surwal) and men's (daura surwal) clothing. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Sanu Maiya

texts.en:
Sanu Maiya is 37 years old. She is married and has three children aged 18, 13, and 6. Many years ago, she established her meat shop business. Working seven days a week and five hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy chickens and buffalo meat. In the future, Sanu Maiya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In Nepal, the meat is always fresh. In small stalls along busy roads, open-air butcher shops sell chicken, goat, and water buffalo by the kilo. The stalls are piled high with product and sales are brisk. With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices. This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: to buy chicken for her shop

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a 42-year-old married woman with five children, all attend school. Margie works very hard to provide for them.

Margie runs a general store and requests 8,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, personal care products, noodles, spices, drinks, coffee, juice, and snack foods.

In the future, Margie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda has run her ready-to-wear clothes business for many years now. She was able to provide for her family and successfully repaid her previous loan used to buy additional bundles of clothing items she sells. Linda wants to improve her business, for she wants to ensure a better life for her family. She would like to apply for a new loan, this time in the amount of PHP 21,000, to purchase additional stocks of t-shirts, shorts, pants and other ready-to-wear selections.

In the next few years, Linda wants to see her clothing business thrive, for she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family. She hopes also to find a bigger space for her shop so she can house more stock.

She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back their micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more up-to-date clothes like t-shirts, shorts, pants for her inventory.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma  is 47 years old and has four children. Guillerma  is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Guillerma  is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Guillerma  requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Guillerma  has been farming vegetables for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Guillerma  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josephine is 40 years old and has four children who are in school.

Josephine has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Josephine has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 33 years old and has four children. Emily is married and has four children who are in school.

Emily is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Emily requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Emily has been farming vegetables for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emily would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Jessa

texts.en:
Ma. Jessa is a 29-year-old married woman with two children.

She has raised pigs for 5 years and requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies.

She has previously borrowed 12 times to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Jessa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 48 years old and married with two children. Cecilia works very hard to provide for them.

Cecilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection.

Cecilia has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future Cecilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection

loans.name: Ma. Laline

texts.en:
Ma. Laline is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending.

Ma. Laline dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 23 years old and married. 

Jovelyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Jovelyn requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Jovelyn has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Jovelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
Samina is 33 years old and belongs to a poor family, living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a blacksmith; he manufactures the iron accessories for doors and windows which are used in houses. He has been providing door-to-door services to weld the broken accessories. A few days ago his welding plant became unusable due to overheating and needs to be replaced. He wants to buy a new welding plant, but he does not have money due to lot of household expenses. Therefore, Samina requested a loan from BRAC, an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy welding plant for manufacturing.

Samina thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a welding plant for manufacturing iron accessories.

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
Roxanne is a 29-year-old married woman with three children, two attend school.

Roxanne has raised pigs for 2 years and requests 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has previously borrowed 7 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Roxanne would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies.

loans.name: Muázu

texts.en:
Member ID: R15-IK002621-01

Muázu is a Babban Gona farmer. He is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Muázu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan, Muázu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Muázu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000/hectare. Muázu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to increase his farmland and looks forward to using his additional earnings to become a better farmer.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lin

texts.en:
Lin is a 20-year-old single freshman who is from the Kampot Province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Accounting at a university in the city. Her father is a construction worker and her mother is a rice farmer.

Lin does not have the finances to pay her tuition fees from the first year and would like to request a loan. She will use the loan to cover her university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree.

She hopes to find a proper job with a decent salary and help her parents.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees from the first year

loans.name: Gopini

texts.en:
Gopini is 40 years old. She is married and has four children aged 24, 23, 22 and 16. In 2005, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys grocery goods for her business. In the future, Gopini plans to improve her family's economic conditions. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Parbati

texts.en:
Parbati is 35 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 8. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Parbati plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called “pasal”, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Sylvester Rambo

texts.en:
Sylvester Rambo is 30 years old and single. He work hard for his parents.

Sylvester Rambo runs a candy store. He requested a loan amount of 7,000 to buy additional candies to sell.

Sylvester Rambo dreams that one day he will be able to save enough money to expand his business and repair his parent's home.

loans.use: to buy additional candies to sell

location.town: Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City, Miss. Occ

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is the mother of her two children. She has been running her piggery business for many years. She's working hard to earn more profit and to be able to provide the needs of her children in sending them in school. From her generated revenue, she was able to pay her previous loan used for her business. She wants to expand her business and engage to other businesses. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase fertilizer for her pigs in order to produce plenty of meat for sale in the market.
She wants to save more money for the financial needs of her children so they can go to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en: Ernesto is a man with determination. In spite of the obstacles that he encountered in his life, he was still able to get up and continue dreaming for his family. He is a 55-year-old man and the father of two children ages 25 and 11 years old. He sells commodities to the community of Clarin, Bohol, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, toiletries, chips, candies, biscuits, chocolate bars, eggs, cooking oil, coffee, sugar and drinks. Thus, he is asking a loan to buy these commodities,  hoping it would increase their earnings. Definitely, Ernesto aims to improve his livelihood for his family. He wants to give them better lives.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, toiletries, chips, candies, biscuits, chocolate bars, eggs, cooking oil, coffee, sugar and drinks.

loans.name: Bustanul

texts.en:
Bustanul is one of Ruma's agents and lives in Indramayu, West Java; a four-hour drive from Jakarta. He is happily married with one cute child.

Bustanul owns a stall that sells stationery and mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because Ruma has the best service and system, and he wants to expand his business. Bustanul is a friendly person and his community sees him as an informative mobile provider.

Bustanul needs additional capital and seeks a loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and bill payment services to his community.

He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits for his community

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 51 years old and has one child still in school.

Rosemarie has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her business. Rosemarie has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, gasoline and maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Elizabeth has been in pig fattening for 6 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Chinyere

texts.en:
Chinyere is 40 years old and a mother to 6 children presently leaving with her husband at their family compound, her husband is a brick layer by profession. Chinyere is very hard working, annually she handles processing of palm oil for clients who do not have the time and skill to process palm oil, and most of her customers are teachers and rural health workers who also do palm oil storage business to increase their income. Her clients pay her with kernel and not cash. Her major challenge is storage containers.

She is requesting for this loan to enable her purchase plastic drums to store clients products during the peak season and also part of it will be used to process her stored kernels which she got as her pay from her annual work. In the future, Chinyere hopes to have her own palm kernel cracker machine, considering that she spends a lot annually renting machine for this purpose and this affects her income. She appreciates all Kiva lenders that support her loan.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil storage containers and also store palm kernel.

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Adeline does domestic work for a living. She raises hogs to cater to the needs of her family. She lives in her own home with her four children, which gives her strength and inspiration to continue to work hard.

Her husband's job in a private company also helps her defray the family's expenses.

Adeline decided to joined CEVI to avail herself of a loan. She would like to improve her income and start to expand.

Adeline wants to buy two piglets, pig feed and hogs. With these resources, she could increase the number of livestock she is about to raise. Thus, her livelihood will progress and she could finance the schooling of her children and provide them with proper nutrition.

In the future, Adeline is determined to continue to improve her hog raising business for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy two piglets, pig feed and hogs

loans.name: Diocelyn

texts.en: Diocelyn is a 46 year-old woman from Catigbian, Bohol. She is married and has five children, two of whom are in school. Her husband works hard as an electrician, while Diocelyn is running a sari-sari (general store) business to help her husband financially. She has been doing this for seven years and hoping to increase their livelihood. In addition to sari-sari store business, Diocelyn is also engaged in raising pigs. And this is the reason why is asking for a loan. She wants to buy piglets and feed as well as a variety of goods for her store such as sugar, spices, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, candies, biscuits, chips, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and milk.  In the future Diocelyn wishes for her business to improve for their sustainability.

loans.use: to buy sugar, spices, canned goods, noodles, toiletries, candies, biscuits, chips, coffee, powdered chocolate drink, milk for her store and piglets and feed for her pig raising business.

loans.name: Petra Cl Group

texts.es:
Los pequeños y bellos paisajes hacen de una comunidad mazahua un importante centro para personas que quieran relajarse y convivir en familia. Sus habitantes son personas muy trabajadoras, alegres y muy dedicadas a su familia; lo que más les agrada es la tranquilidad de las calles y la fertilidad de la tierra en donde cultivan maíz. Estos últimos meses del año se dedican a cosechar su producto mientras que el resto del mismo realizan la cría de ganado.
     Doña Petra es una persona de un carácter muy amigable quien ha formado una familia a lado de su esposo Tomas y cinco hijos de los cuales cuatro estudian distintos niveles de educación. Para aportar ingresos a su hogar, se ha dedicado a la cría de animales desde hace más de tres años lo que le ha dado buenos resultados y una amplia experiencia. "Aunque comen más alimento, crecen más rápido y por ello se obtienen mejores ganancias cuando llega el tiempo de venderlos" comentó refiriéndose al ganado bovino.
     Los ejemplares son comprados desde pequeños con personas de su misma comunidad; después los cuida hasta que alcanzan un peso ideal, este proceso puede durar varios meses de atención. Actualmente tiene ocho vacas y con la ayuda del préstamo podría comprar 200 pacas de avena que sirven como alimento para todos sus animales. "Realmente estoy muy agradecida con VF México porque siempre me ayuda a reunir las cantidades necesarias para la inversión" refirió. Si bien ahora sólo cuenta con un pequeño corral que, en tiempos de lluvia, hace que sus animales se suelan enfermar, ahora  piensa comprar material para construir un espacio más adecuado a sus necesidades. "Pero lo que más anhelo es seguir apoyando a mis hijos en sus estudios para que terminen una carrera universitaria" comentó entusiasmada. 
   Los demás integrantes del grupo son Francisca y Fernando quienes invertirán en ovejas; María, en pollos y Teresa, en pavos y bordados.
*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del quiosco municipal, Doña Petra es quien usa los aretes.
texts.en:
Lovely small landscapes make the Mazahua community an attractive center for people who want to relax and enjoy time with their families. The people who live here are hardworking, cheerful, and very devoted to their families. What pleases them most are the peaceful streets and the fertile ground where they grow their corn. These last months of the year are for harvesting their produce while the rest of the year they raise livestock.

Doña Petra is a very friendly person who has made a family beside her husband Tomas and five children, four of whom are in school in different grades. To bring income into the home, she has been raising animals for over three years, with good results and with her broad experience.
"Although they eat more feed, they grow faster and therefore generate better earnings when the time comes to sell them," she observes, referring to cattle.

The specimens are purchased when they are very small, from people in her community. Then she cares for them until they reach an ideal weight. This process can take several months of attention. She currently has eight cows, and with the help of the loan she could buy 200 bundles of oats which would be used to feed all of her animals. "I am truly grateful to VF México because they always help me to gather the needed amount to invest," she points out.

While at present she only has a small corral where her animals tend to get sick during rainy times, she intends to buy the supplies to build a space that better suits her needs.

"What I most dream of is to continue to support my children in their studies so that they can complete university degrees," she says with enthusiasm .

The other members of the group are Francisca and Fernando who invest in sheep, María who invests in chickens, and Teresa, in turkeys and embroidery.

*The photograph was taken on the steps of the municipal kiosk. Doña Petra is the one with earrings.

loans.use: to buy 200 bundles of oats.

loans.name: Pritse

texts.en:
Pritse is a 34-year-old woman with one child.

Pritse works hard to provide for her family and has run a general store for 4 years. She requests 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Pritse has previously borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF. She earns additional income sell ready-to-wear clothing.

Pritse aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy  canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is 37 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. Haydee works very hard to provide for them.

Haydee runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home care products, and other items.

Haydee has been in this business for 2 years.

In the future Haydee would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home care products, and other items.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is 29 years old and married with one child in school. Michelle works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of canned goods, milk, spices, bread, chips, etc. Michelle has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, milk, spices, bread, chips, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 43 years old and married. Susana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other items.

Susana has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Susana aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other items.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a rice business for 35 years.

She is borrowing 19,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell .

Rodelyn earns aadditional income from food vending.

She has sustained her business through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Taw Ku Shae Village Group

texts.en:
The Kiva community’s previous loan helped 16 villagers from Taw Ku Shae (East) Village expand their livestock business and increase their incomes.

The increased income from affordable credit allowed group members to cover their monthly expenses, and even save extra money to support their children’s education. Like other members, featured borrower U Soe used the funds to purchase more ducks, which then yielded him significantly more income from duck eggs and the sale of several grown ducks.

The relisted loan will support Taw Ku Shae group members to better their family’s financial stability by purchasing more ducks, ducklings and duck feed. Pictured above are Kyaw, Kyaw T, Zae, Soe and Sadar. For a few members, they plan to use the additional income for their pig livestock business and planting betel. The group is so grateful for all the help from Kiva lenders, and they are excited to continue to grow their business with Kiva’s loan.

loans.use: to buy ducks as well as high-quality feed.

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
ZUBAIDA is a 38 year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store for the past five years.

Zubaida's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities, e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milk and other consumer items for his business, but due to financial constraints her husband is not in suitable position to buy these products. Therefore, Zubaida has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and earn more profits in order to better manage his household and business expenses.
Zubaida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, tea bags, milk, etc for her husband's general store business.

loans.name: Daria

texts.en:
Daria is an 18-year-old freshman in the Software Engineering Program at AUCA. She takes offense when people think that there are no good female software engineers and this field is not for females. Nevertheless, she wants to prove to everyone that she will be one of girls who becomes known for her high achievements in the field of software engineering.

She needs a loan to pay for her university tuition.

Daria considers AUCA as the world-class university and she is convinced that it is the only university that will give the best education, achieve skills, and become competitive in the future.

Her hobbies include dancing and playing the piano. She plans to be an active student in extracurricular activities and share her ideas with other talented students.

Daria’s mother is an interior designer and her father is temporarily unemployed. They have difficulties paying tuition and ask for lenders’ help.

loans.use: to pay for her university degree in the SFW Program

loans.name: Romdhoni

texts.en:
Romdhoni is a Ruma agent who lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married. He owns a small stall that sells consumer products and mobile airtime credits for his community. He decided to join Ruma because Ruma has the best service and system and he wants to expand his business.

Romdhoni is a friendly person and his community sees him as an informative mobile provider.

Romdhoni needs additional capital and seeks a loan from Kiva to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community.

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Sometimes it’s the husband andwife partnership that makes a business successful. Thirty-three year old Arlene of Polomolok, South Cotabato finds it true. She and her husband, Joselito, run two enterprises: a variety store and wholesaling of soft drinks. As a soft drinks wholesaler, Arlene buys loads of soft drinks at wholesale prices and distributes these to sari-sari stores and other retailers. They have been doing this for almost five years and they are earning approximately PHP 23,000 a month. They toil hard to supply their family’s daily needs and prepare for their young child’s education. They also dream of renovating their house someday.

Just like other businesses they also experience certain difficulties such as malfunction of their delivery vehicle, long overdue debts, and lack of capital. If their delivery vehicle encounters mechanical problem, their customers have no choice but to order from another dealer. It greatly affects their income and everyday sustenance.

To cope up with these problems, she is requesting for PHP 50,000 additional capital for vehicle maintenance and truckloads of soft drinks to resell. Arlene aspires to build their own outlet or stock room someday. She hopes you can extend your heartfelt generosity to her so she can gradually reach her dream. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for truckloads of softdrinks and for delivery vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Jessel

texts.en:
Jessel is a resident of Tubigon, Bohol. She is 32 years old and a mother of three children, ages five, four and one-year-old. Her partner works hard as a welder operator, thus they own a welding shop while Jessel is engaged in vegetable farming. Her harvested vegetables from their farm become a big help in their daily consumption. With this, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizer. She will also need the amount to buy a welding machine.

In the future, Jessel wants to improve their businesses to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a welding machine.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is a hardworking 58-year-old woman who earns a living selling Avon products. She uses her profits to manage the economy of her house. She sells items like lotion, talcum powder, body spray and whitening products. She is married woman and has eight children, two of whom are still attending school.

She wants to continue improving her quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan with CEVI to invest in Avon products such as accessories, beauty enhancers and apparel to continue to boost her business. In that way, she will be able to purchase the orders of her customers and generally improve her purchasing power.

With the profits, she will be able to continue send her children to school and provide proper nutrition. Alberta hopes that will she will become successful in her livelihood.

loans.use: to invest in Avon products such as accessories, beauty enhancers and apparel.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 28 years old and single with two children.

She agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Cherry is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cherry has been in this business for 6 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell recycled materials.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine has 3 children and works hard to support her family.

She has a mineral water business and earns additional income from a general store. Catherine is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more containers of mineral water.

Catherine has sustained her business activities through 4 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of mineral water to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 45 years old and married with eleven children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 6 years and also earns additional income from handicrafts.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 34 years old, married and works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell dry goods business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Fely is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell for her buy and sell dry goods business.

Fely has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Chona works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling fruit in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods. Chona is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a variety of fruit to sell for her business.

Chona has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruit to sell.

loans.name: Rukia's Group

texts.en:
Rukia is a 42-year-old married woman. She is living with her husband and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is doing embroidery work by hand at home and financially supporting her family. Rukia belongs to a poor family; her husband’s income is very poor so she decided to start embroidery work at home. She has been learning these arts from childhood, now she adopted it for her occupation. This has enabled her to be independet and to earn sufficient income.

She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, to purchase stocks of threads, silk, fancy sequins, and pearls of various colors. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and her family. Rukia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy stocks of threads, silk, fancy sequins, etc. for embroidery work.

loans.name: Cherry Ann

texts.en:
Cherry Ann is 27 years old and married, with one child in school. Cherry Ann works very hard to provide for her family.

Cherry Ann runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, eggs, and other groceries.

Cherry Ann has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, eggs, and other groceries.

loans.name: Janeth Angelie

texts.en:
Janeth Angelie is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Tubigon, Bohol with her family. She is a mother of a nine-month-old baby girl. A few a months ago, Janeth Angelie successfully started a rice retailing business. Aside from this, she also helps her partner in fishing.

She dreams of a better and more comfortable means of living. That is why she wants to improve their income. To do this, she needs our help by lending her an amount that will help increase her sales. She will buy sacks of rice to sell and a new engine for their fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell and a new engine for the fishing boat.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 54 years old and married with twelve children, four of whom are in school. Tessie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like soap, chips, spices, coffee, eggs, etc. Tessie has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Tessie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household goods to sell like soap, chips, spices, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Dorothea

texts.en:
Dorothea is a 54-year-old woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Dorothea has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She requested a 25,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like pants, shirts, underwear, etc.. Dorothea has been in this business for 18 years.

In the future, Dorothea would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like pants, shirts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Alexandra Katiuska

texts.es:
Katiuska es una señora de 27 años, vive junto a sus hijos en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, un sector comercial del país y reconocido por ser el puente terrestre que une a las regiones de la sierra y costa.
Katiuska es una madre muy trabajadora, mientras sus hijos estudian ella aprovecha saliendo a recorrer visitando a su clientela para vender su mercadería, lleva más de un año con el negocio donde vende blusas, licras, interiores y ternos de niños; gracias a estos ingresos ella ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y poder seguir con el negocio.
Katiuska vino referida por un cliente muy satisfecho por los servicios que presta la institución, ahora ella solicitó un crédito para fortalecer el negocio, con el que comprará más ropa para surtir el negocio y seguir creciendo como microempresaria, agradece a Kiva por permitir que personas con negocios pequeños tengan la oportunidad de seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Katiuska is a 27-year-old woman. She lives with her children in the city of Santo Domingo, a commercial area of the country known for being the part of land that unites the mountains and the coast.

Katiuska is a very hard-working mother. While her children study, she takes advantage of it by going around to visit her customers to sell her merchandise. She has had the business for more than one year and sells shirts, spandex items, underwear, and children's outfits. Thanks to this income, she has been able to move her children forward and continue with the business. Katiuska was referred by a customer who was very satisfied with the services the institution provides. Now she is asking for a loan to strengthen her business, with which she will buy more clothing to stock her business and continue growing as a microbusinesswoman. She thanks Kiva to allowing people with small businesses to have the opportunity to move forward.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise to supply her business, and to continue with the goal of moving forward with her children

loans.name: Mertha Sedana Group

texts.en:
Through several loans cycles, the Mertha Sedana Group has repaid their loans on time. Still with pig-fattening and barbeque programs, they enjoy taking loans from MUK. This is because they can form into a group, get trained and the loan needs no collateral from the borrower. They are very responsible for the loan. In their last payment, two members couldn't reach their targets because most of their pigs died as a result of illness. They felt very sad and decided to stop borrowing while they sanitize the cages. They will need loans again in the next period.

Ni Ketut, as the head of the group, sold her three pigs after managing them for five months. Ni Ketut is really happy with the result. The profit was used to make payments and savings.

Ni Ketut and the members of Mertha Sedana Group are really thankful because they still have the trust to receive loans. They get the loan with eight members. The loan is used to increase the pig business.

Now Ni Ketut has a sow. The loan she received was used to purchase superior feed and renovate the cage. She hopes the piglets grow fast and she plans to sell them after two months.

loans.use: to purchase superior feed and renovate the cage.

loans.name: Witress

texts.en:
Witress, who is in her mid 30's, is married with three kids who are still at school. She has been running several businesses such as a beauty salon, selling water, selling chips, and selling broiler chickens for nine years now. She works from 4 a.m. to 4 p.m. daily and is able to earn a very good profit each month.

This will be Witress's 22nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to expand her business activities by starting to sell chips and broiler chickens. She also increased her range of salon products, and the salon is now very popular. She has paid back all her loans successfully and appreciates the lenders for their support.

She used the profit to build her own house, take care of her family, repay loan, pay school fees for her kids, and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to start a new business of selling rice. She dreams of building a house for renting.

Witress will be accountable for paying back her loan.

loans.use: to start a new a business of selling rice

loans.name: Mujeres Al Progreso Group

texts.es: Gloria tiene 59 años de edad es soltera con hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y lencería a través de catálogos. Años atrás de dedicaba a su hogar. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mas productos de belleza perfumes aretes collares esmaltes y demás accesorios que estén en oferta para poder expenderlos a un precio que le genere ganancias. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Gloria es la que se encuentra adherida en la parte superior izquierda. Ella no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en:
Gloria is 59 years old, she is single and has independent children. She makes a living selling beauty products and underwear from catalogues. She worked as a housewife years ago.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of more beauty products, perfumes, bracelets, necklaces, nail polish and other accessories that are on sale so that she can sell them at a price that will generate a profit. 

The group thanks KIVA lenders for the loan offered. Gloria is the one whose picture is attached in the upper left hand side. She could not be present at the meeting for working reasons.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Roberto De Jesus

texts.es: Roberto es un hombre trabajador de 30 años de edad cuenta con vivienda propia en la que vive desde hace 7 años con sus esposa y sus hijos una niña de 12 años y un varón de 16 años de edad. Él se dedica a prestar sus servicios de mecánico automotriz, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, pero hace 5 presta sus servicios en un taller cercano. Roberto desea construir el cuarto de ladrillo, ya que como se observa en la fotografía este es de lámina deteriorada, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto de ladrillo en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Roberto is a 30 year-old working man. He has his own that he has lived in for seven years with his wife and children (a 12 year-old girl and a 16 year-old boy). He makes a living offering his services as a car mechanic, a job that he has been doing for several years. For five years he has worked at a garage located nearby. 

Roberto would like to build a brick room. As seen in the picture, his house is made of deteriorated iron sheets. That is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI, to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel and iron to build a brick room in his house.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel and iron to build a brick room in his house.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a 43-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in Tubigon, Bohol. She is married and has five children, ages 19, 18, 12, 9 and a months-old child.

She makes a living by selling food (snacks) to the community. She has been doing this for 10 years and is hoping to have more successful years to come to enhance their livelihood. In addition to this, she and her husband own a motorcycle that gives them an extra income. Her husband does this business.

Loreta uses her profit to sustain their daily expenses such as food, children’s school payments and other basic needs. She is now asking for a loan amount to buy food ingredients such as flour, sugar and cooking oil. Loreta aims to improve her business for her children. She wants to have enough money to support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as flour, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is a 53-year-old woman and lives in the municipality of Clarin, Bohol. She has three children, ages 28, 18 and 12 years old whom she wanted to raise well. She wants to give them good educations. Previously, this woman had a financial problem so she has decided to start her own business to help her husband financially. Her husband is a farmer but since climate change brought bad weather conditions, they only harvested a small amount. In short, their harvest is not enough.

Romana is good in cooking so she managed to start her small restaurant business, known as a “carinderia” in the Philippines, herself. With this, she is asking for a loan for additional capital to buy food ingredients such as meat, vegetables, spices and cooking oil. In the future, Romana dreams of improving her business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients such as meat, vegetables, spices and cooking oil.

loans.name: G.s La Bondad  1 Group

texts.en:
Felipa is the coordinator of her group, GS. La Bondad (The Goodness) 1. This solidarity group is located in San Pedro de Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugar cane industry, where these businesswomen run their activities in their community and others nearby.

Felipa makes her home there in a simple structure with her long term partner. She is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, where she is a dressmaker and makes clothes and other merchandise to survive. With this loan she will invest in her business by buying supplies like fabric, thread, trimmings, and other stuff she will need to increase her sales.

The other members, also women, run different businesses like sales of used clothing and household products. Felipa will use her profits to improve her home and invest in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, etc.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi lives a simple life with her family in a town of Tubigon, Bohol. She is 34 years old and earns a living through selling a variety of goods in her sari-sari store (general store) for eight years. In addition to this, she also sells meat.

Naomi wants to improve her business for sustainability. That is why she is asking for a loan. She needs an additional amount to buy meat and basic groceries to sell, such as spices, eggs, cooking oil, toiletries, candies, biscuits, chips, sugar, canned goods, noodles and drinks.

loans.use: to buy meat and basic groceries to sell, such as spices, eggs, cooking oil, toiletries, candies, biscuits, chips, sugar, canned goods, noodles and drinks.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 51-year-old woman who lives a simple life with her family in the town of Tubigon, Bohol. She is married and the mother of three children, ages 28, 20 and 12 years old. Her husband is a laborer while Susan runs a sari-sari store (general store) business. She has been doing this for 12 years. Susan has become proficient in this business and she eagerly wants to continue this business.

The problem is there are times that her capital is used for other emergency needs such as school fees and bills. With this, she needs a loan amount to buy commodities needed for her store. She will purchase grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, chips, bread, sugar, salt, coffee, drinks and powdered juice. Thus, Susan wants in the future to enhance her store business for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, eggs, cooking oil, biscuits, chips, bread, sugar, salt, coffee, drinks and powdered juice

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 57 years old and single with four children.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies.

Teresita has been in this business for 15 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, vegetable seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 48 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Vicenta works very hard to provide for them.

Vicenta runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Vicenta has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, noddles, rice, and more.

In the future, Vicenta would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a retail ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like shorts, pants, t-shirts, slippers, and similar goods to sell through her clothing business.

Susana has been in this business for 10 years. Susana earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like shorts, pants, t-shirts, and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
As a farmer from Santuk District, Kampong Thom Province, Sreng, 37 years old, is working very hard on the rice field near his house. He is a hard-working father of six children and can earn approximately 4 USD a day. Being a farmer is the main work that he has done for more than seven years.
In this farming season, he is lacking money to buy some farm supplies. To continue his farming, Sreng is borrowing some money from Kiva to buy farm supplies like fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, and other related materials.
He thanks lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides him with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Sovanndom

texts.en: Sovanndom is 19 years old. He is a single freshman who is from Kampot Province of Cambodia. Sovanndom is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Information Technology at a university in the city. Currently, he is lacking the finances to cover his university fees for the first year, so he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances to cover his university fees. For his future dreams, he wants to run his own business, so he will be able to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to cover his university fees for the first year, for a BSc. in Information Technology

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Being a construction worker, SOKHON, who is a 26-year-old married man with two children, can only make $4 USD per day to support his family. SOKHON resides in a rural area of Baribour District, Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been involved in this career for nearly 8 years now. 

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, He decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for his house. He is very happy with this loan, since it will promote his health, the environment, and his living standards. He would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 64 years old, married, and has five children, one of whom is still in school. Tita works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like coffee, detergent soap, noodles, biscuits, sugar, vinegar, etc. to sell.

Tita has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, detergent soap, noodles, biscuits, sugar, vinegar, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Tita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like coffee, detergent soap, noodles, biscuits, sugar, vinegar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Angelica works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling jewelry in the Philippines.

Angelica requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more jewelry to sell to her customers.

Angelica has been in this business for three years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Angelica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a married woman, 66 years old with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lorna has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Lorna has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Shuaibu

texts.en:
Shuaibu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Shuaibu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Shuaibu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Shuaibu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Shuaibu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to 2,000 USD/hectare.

Shuaibu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Yolanda works hard to support her family. She has a rice "buy-and-sell" business in the Philippines and also earns income from farming sugarcane.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell via her rice business.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to realize her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is the age of 46 and the mother of four children. Her husband owns a shop in which he has a few compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic accessories and he appointed employees over molding machines on a daily wages. For the manufacturing of different plastic accessories he needs different category and quality raw materials. This time he has taken a huge contract than earlier but does not have enough amounts to buy additional molding machine and crushing raw material to continue his manufacturing.

Therefore, Farzana requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy crushed plastic raw materials for the molding machine.
She has to look after a huge family, she has to take care of each kid, their school fees, their diet and about their health. For these purposes she has need of huge income and she is responsible to bear household expenses.

She is very happy after taking this loan and says thank you to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy raw material for manufacturing plastic accessories for her husband's business.

loans.name: Ratana

texts.en:
Ratana is 22 years old, a single credit officer at a micro finance institution who is from the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. He has worked in the city for more than ten months, earning approximately $7.33 per day.

Currently, Ratana is pursuing a bachelor’s degree majoring in Finance and Banking at a university in the city. Due to the fact that he is short of the finances to pay his fourth-year tuition fees, he would like to apply for a loan. With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances to cover his university fees and go through the fourth year successfully. For his dreams, he wants to work in a bank with a reasonable salary so he will be able to save money to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay his fourth-year tuition fees for a degree in Finance and Banking

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is a 46-year-old woman who lives in the rural town of Loon, Bohol. She raises hogs to earn for a living. She has three children ages 11, 15 and 16 years old respectively. Her partner in life has an income that could help support the needs of her family.

Bernadette needs the loan to purchase feeds and hogs to make some profits. With these, she will be able to raise quality hogs and slowly improve her financial income. Due to high demands, she would like to expand her piggery business to become more sustainable. In that way, she could continue support the needs of her family, including quality education.

She has successfully repaid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting a new loan to continue improve her business.

Bernadette thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and hogs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Grace is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Grace has a food vending business in the Philippines. Grace requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, fruits, spices, etc..

Grace has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, fruits, spices, etc.

loans.name: Romelyn

texts.en:
Romelyn is 35 years old and married with four children.

Romelyn works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store and clothing retail businesses in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Romelyn has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Romelyn aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Glaiza

texts.en:
Glaiza is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Glaiza is 27 years old and has one child in school.

Glaiza has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Glaiza requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell such as, blanket, pants, etc..

Glaiza  has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Glaiza would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as, blanket, pants, etc.

loans.name: Recel

texts.en:
Recel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Recel is 34 years old and has one child in school.

Recel has a fishing business in the Philippines. Recel requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

Recel has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Recel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like farming sugarcane.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lourdes dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is 31 years old and has two children. Venus is married and has two children who are in school.

Venus is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Venus requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Venus has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Venus would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is the age of 50 and living with her spouse in the area of Multan, Pakistan.She is a tailor by profession. She engages in a cloth sewing centre to earn an income. She started her cloth sewing centre 3 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses. Now a day she wants to increase her business.

Asia is requesting a loan amount 40000 PKR from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. The loan will be used to buy a sewing machine, which she needs to be able to fulfill the requests of her customers.
Asia be thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for herself.

loans.name: Ora Et Labora Group

texts.en:
The Ora Et Labora group is composed of 5 hard working women and is chaired by Noflyan, a 27 year old married woman (who is standing in the middle) with 2 toddlers, their ages are 1 and 3 years old. Noflyan owns a humble kiosk business of selling daily needs. She runs this business aims to help her husband – Deny, 28 years old in generating more income for their living. She operates this business at home and has been involved in the business for the 3 last years.


Due to lack of capital, she has limited product to be sold while the demand of customers for more stocks increased such as sugar, rice, noodles, cooking oil, snacks, etc. This situation leads her thinking to enhance the products in her business.

She then decided to seek a loan. One day she got information from an Account Officer that the TLM has been providing the loan for years to those who want to improve their businesses. This is a good chance for her to do the best effort for her business. Along with 4 women who live close by, she formed the Ora Et Labora group and requested a loan totaling of IDR 12,500,000.
Noflyan has planned to complete the product as sugar, rice, noodles, cooking oil, snacks, etc. The same as Noflyan, other members also want to invest their part for business and other interest. They believe the loan provided by Kiva through TLM will encourage them to improve their business ahead.

loans.use: to buy more stocks and supplies such as; sugar, rice, noodles, cooking oil, snacks, etc

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha has been a fish vendor for almost 10 years now. Her work is done through the streets of her town. She is 50 years of age. She has four children, two of whom are still attending school. Her partner is a carpenter.

Editha wants to continue improving her quality of life, which is why she is requesting a loan to purchase more fish, foam (for fish storage), and ice. These will enable her to have a variety of fish to sell to her customers. This will help her to save money and continue to invest other possible sources of income in order to become more productive.

She hopes that she can sustain and continue to improve her family's living condition and also allow her children to finish their schooling for a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, foam (for fish storage), and ice.

loans.name: Norman

texts.en:
As a dedicated member of the Baptist Church, Norman wants to serve as model to church members and the whole community in terms of his faith and integrity. Honesty is expected of him when he operates any business or endeavor. He reminds himself about this always and he keeps up his faith to be a good example. He is married to a fellow Baptist member with whom he is blessed with children. They live in Fatima, General Santos City where Norman runs a bakery combined with a variety store. 

Norman himself does the baking while his wife watches over their store. His products can supply his neighbors, but he plans to expand further. He aims to supply bread to the whole community and nearby areas. If his plan will pursue, he will need to hire some helper-bakers. It’s his heart’s desire to help others by giving employment to them. 

To help him take a step forward in reaching this dream, you may extend your kind generosity in the amount of PHP 25,000. He will use it to buy stocks of baking ingredients such as flour, sugar, yeast, oil, margarine, and others. He will also add volume of supplies for his store inventory. Your help will surely serve as a great blessing to his family and his future helper-bakers. 
   
Norman gains inspiration from his co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories about their lives and businesses. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy stocks of baking ingredients such as flour, sugar, yeast, oil, margarine, and others; also buy volume of supplies for his variety store

loans.name: Nilisita

texts.en:
Nilisita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nilisita is 46 years old and has one child in school.

Nilisita has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Nilisita requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fruit to sell.

Nilisita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Nilisita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of fruit to sell

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 45 years old, married with six children.

Shirly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

Shirly has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Shirly aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snack foods and other personal care products

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 40 years old and has three children.  Zenaida is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business pig fattening in the Philippines. Zenaida requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Zenaida has been pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell mud crabs business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase additional mud crabs to sell for her buy and sell mud crabs business.

Gina has been in this business for 30 years. Gina earns more income from food vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional mud crabs to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helen is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Helen has a food vending business in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending such as, meat, spices, fish, etc..

Helen has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending such as, meat, spices, fish, etc.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is the age of 41 and a mother of three children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan.She engages in embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business 3 years ago because she wanted to help her husband support the family and meet the household expenses.

Parveen buys raw materials such as Hand- Embroidery kit, ribbon, needles and embroidery machine from the market.She sells her embroidery items directly in the market, so that she can earn better profit for her family. She has become an expert in embroidery business. So Parveen demanded a loan so she will be able to buy raw materials from the market.

Parveen will be thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy embroidery raw materials for herself	.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 37 years old and has two children, one of whom is in school. Aida is married.

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Aida requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Aida has been farming vegetables for eight years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sedana Ayu Group

texts.en:
Sedana Ayu group repaid the loan on time. Ni Nengah, head of the group, tells her success in raising pigs. From the first loan she got from MUK, Ni Nengah had 1 pig. But now she has 5 pigs. Ni Nengah sell the pigs after keeping them for 6 months. She’s also has a sow with 6 piglets. All profits she saved and will be used for working capital so that she can be independent in terms of capital. Ni Nengah very grateful for the help she had received so far. Ni Nengah still expect the assistance from MUK, both in terms of capital or training, so that she and all members of the group can be a successful pig farmer.

After obtaining satisfactory results in previous loan period, the Sedana Ayu group continue lending. Current loan used to purchase piglets, feed and repair the pigpens.

Ni Nengah has 2 children and they are still in school. Ni Nengah has 2 businesses, pigs and as a chips maker. She used the loan to buy 3 superior piglets, feed, repair cages and purchase bananas or cassava for her chips business. She hopes the welfare of her family would be better and if all goes well, she will stop borrowing and continue the business with her own money.

loans.use: to buy 3 superior piglets, feed, repair cages and purchase bananas or casavas for her chips business

loans.name: Jona Mae

texts.en:
Jona Mae is 21 years old and single  with one child. Jona Mae works very hard to provide for them.

Jona Mae runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection.

Jona Mae has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Jona Mae would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a single parent of two children, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Alma is borrowing PHP 4000 through NWTF to  buy more fish to sell to her local market for her fish vending business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her local market

loans.name: Beberly

texts.en:
Beberly is 23 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Beberly works very hard to provide for them.

Beberly  runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Beberly has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Beberly would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Mellisa Mae

texts.en:
Mellisa Mae works hard to support her family. Mellisa Mae is married with one child and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Mellisa Mae requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to buy fish net, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her fishing business.

Mellisa Mae has been in this business for 2 years now, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

In the future, Mellisa Mae would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish net, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her fishing business

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 44 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom are in school. Nida works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Nida has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Nida would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 60 years old, married, and has four children.
