Lucia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Lucia has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lucia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae is 40 years old, married with four children who are all enrolled in school.  

Ana Mae is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Ana Mae requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her vegetable garden.

Ana Mae has been farming vegetables for 15 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ana Mae would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia is 50 years old and married with five children, two children are currently in school, Olivia works very hard to provide for them.

Olivia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection.

Olivia has been in this business for 1 year. 

In the future Olivia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 18 years old and single.

Florence runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 3000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection.

Florence has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Florence would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Julieta works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Julieta is borrowing PHP 4000 through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat for her fishing business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo and gasoline for her boat

loans.name: Elvin Flor

texts.en:
Elvin Flor is 24 years old and married with one kid. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elvin Flor has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack food, canned good and other personal care products. 

In the future Elvin Flor would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Reimis

texts.en:
Reimis continues with his auto service activity and most preciously he changes car tires.The city of Korca where he operates his activity is covered by snow almost 5 months a year and as such, the change of the tires is more frequent here and this makes his services more in demand.  
Reimis will use this money to prepare for the winter times by stocking up on tires, new or used ones.

loans.use: to stock up on new and used tires; his profession is changing vehicle tires

loans.name: Zawadi Group

texts.fr: Zawadi est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Zawadi», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 35 ans, mère de 7 enfants dont 4 scolarisés et 3 n’étudient pas. Elle est vendeuse d’arachides dans la rue de la ville depuis 14 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en deux sacs d’arachides. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et construire une maison. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler que certaines clientes portent leur bébés en mains.
texts.en:
Zawadi is a merchant, a member of the group Zawadi, and a client of the Hekima MFI. Age 35, she is married with 7 children, 4 of whom go to school. She has been a street vendor of groundnuts for 14 years. She started this business with funding from her husband. She plans to buy 2 sacks of groundnuts. Her long-term goals are to buy some land and build a house.

Zawadi wishes to thank Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs who don't have access to the traditional banking system.

Please note that some of the group members are holding their child in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of groundnuts.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Les 11 femmes qui forment ce groupe sont  très solidaires entre elles et ont su par le travail d’ensemble développer une solidarité et un esprit de groupe salué par les notables du village. Elles font comme activité principale le  petit commerce.

Madame Awa (debout à extrême gauche avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle s’active dans l’embouche. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans  ce domaine d’activité.

Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter des bœufs 02 bœufs de 70000fet des aliments pour les nourrir d’un montant de 60000f et les revendre en détails au bout de 04 mois.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer à la prise en charges de certains besoins familiaux (soins médicaux et scolarités des enfants) et aussi de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
The eleven women who make up this group are very united and have managed, by working together, to build up a solidarity and group spirit which is hailed by persons of note in the village. Their main activity is running small trading businesses.

Awa (who is standing on the far right of the photo with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and mother to eight children. She fattens annimals and has good experience in this field. This new loan will enable her to buy two bulls for 70,000 francs and food for them to a value of 60,000 francs; she will resell them on a retail basis after four months.

The profits she makes will allow her to contribute to expenses for certain of the family's needs (health costs and the children's school fees) as well to build up her business.

loans.use: to buy two bulls for  70,000 francs and food for them to a value of 60,000 francs, with the aim of reselling them after four months.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 32 years old and married with two children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marissa has been in this business for one year and also earns additional income from vegetable vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 64 years old and widowed with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Milagros runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection items.

Milagros has been in this business for 20 years.

In the future Milagros would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection items.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 36 years old and married with four children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection items.

She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

Teresita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection items.

loans.name: Tone

texts.en:
Tone is in the photograph with her husband, Gjovalin, and they are parents of four children with the oldest one being 23 years old and the youngest in the early 13. For the past ten years, their focus has been on agricultural/livestock. To help in the activity with the transportation of products taking them to the farmer's market and transporting other things, they need a trailer and this is why they're applying for the loan.

They own about 9 dynym agricultural land where they basically plant corn and fodder for the cow and calf that they always manage to have, and also plant seasonal veggies. In addition to this, they have grapevines and sell grapes. Gjovalin works as a driver with a travel agency for a pay of 150 euros/month.

loans.use: to invest in a trailer with which he does the transportation of agricultural items.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 63 years old and widowed with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, where she sells a variety of items. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Genara has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Kymbat

texts.en:
Kymbat had a wish to study at the AUCA from her 9th grade. She knew that it is hard to be admitted to the AUCA and it cost a lot. She set a plan to solve the first problem and was successful to gain it, now she is in the process of solving the second one, that’s why she is addressing the Kiva lenders and asking a loan to cover her tuition fee.

Kymbat is a gifted child. During her school years she has gone to dancing classes, she plays the “komuz”, (national musical instrument of Kyrgyz people), and goes to taekwondo. She says that all these activities taught her to be honest, courteous, and patient and have an unwavering spirit and self-control.

Kymbat has a mother and two elder sisters. One of them is married and lives separately. Her mother is a housewife due to her health problems, is not allowed to work. Kymbat’s second sibling is the only person to provide for her family. They had hard times while she had to study and work at the same time to survive, but now she is a full-time worker and able to earn more. Kymbat says that her sister’s salary is not enough to cover her tuition and her family is in need of a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fee

loans.name: Atika

texts.en:
Atika is a 29-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two sons. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, which means that her husband is unable to generate any income.

Her husband wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Atika has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Atika is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is an active member of Paglaum MPC for almost 10 years, making the co-operative as her financial partner on her business venture.

She has managed her account with the co-op well, and the evidence is that she doesn't have default payments. She successfully ascended to the pinnacle of success in that she expanded her business and built a new house for her family.

At this time, she needs to restock her store with canned goods, detergent, soaps, beauty soaps, drinking soda, noodles, confectioneries and condiments, so she asks for a loan from the coop.

loans.use: to restock her store with canned goods, detergent, soaps, beauty soaps, drinking soda, noodles, confectioneries and condiments.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abubakar has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abubakar would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Abubakar can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Abubakar will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha.

Abubakar is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem is 39 years old and widowed with three children in her care. She resides in the Takeo Province of Cambodia. With a motorcycle and a trailer, she has operated the business of selling soup, porridge and noodles in the city since 2011, earning around $7 per day.

One of her children attends school and another two are workers. Khem’s motorcycle and the trailer are old, so she is now requesting a loan because she needs financing to purchase a newer motorcycle with a trailer to transport her soup, porridge and noodles to sell.

With this loan, she will be able to afford a new motorcycle and a trailer to transport her soup, porridge and noodles to sell in order to earn income to support her family. In the future, she is going to build a new proper house.

loans.use: to purchase a newer motorcycle with a trailer to transport soup, porridge and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru: Абдурасул второй сын в семье. Ему 30 лет. Он семейный человек. Абдурасул живет вместе с отцом, матерью, братом, сестренкой, снохой, женой и племянником. Ему отцу 65 лет. Маме 56 лет. Брату 35, а снохе 30 лет. Сестренке и жене по 19 лет. Отец Абдурасул работает охранником в больнице. Его брат занимается мастером по ремонту домов. Жена и сноха занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Абдурасул самостоятельный и воспитанный парень. Он 3 года занимается таксистом. Абдурасул имеет автомашину марки «Opel». Его отец раньше тоже был водителем, и он научил Абдурасулу как правильно водить автомашину. Абдурасул нуждается в деньгах, по причине его машина в аварийном состоянии. Надо починить автомобиль и продвигать работу.
texts.en:
Abdurasul is the second son in his family. He is 30 years old. He is a family man. Abdurasul lives with his father, mother, brother, sister, sister-in-law, wife and nephew. His father is 65 and his mother is 56. His brother is 35 and his sister-in-law is 30. His sister and wife are both 19 years old. Abdurasul's father works as a hospital security guard. His brother renovates houses. His wife and sister-in-law farm.

Abdurasul is an independent and well-raised young man. He has been working as a taxi driver for three years. Abdurasul has an "Opel" brand car. His father was previously also a driver, and he taught Abdurasul how to drive a car properly. Abdurasul needs money because his car is in poor condition. He needs to repair the car and continue his work.

loans.use: to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Maisel

texts.en:
Maisel is a hardworking mother who pushes her abilities just to provide for the needs of her family. At 42, married, and from Unidos, Plaridel, Maisel experienced lots of hardship and difficulties before she finally found the perfect business for her.

She signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC and accessed her initial capitalization and ventured into the hog raising business. Recently she realized that she needs to purchase bags of animal feeds, so she asks for a loan from the co-op.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feeds

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a widow from Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental and operates a fishing business. She's doing well with her business that has lasted for almost 30 years and provides for the needs of her family. She is assisted by the programs of Paglaum MPC and she manages her membership well.

Recently, she avails a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy new fishing nets.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana, 51 years of age, owns a sari-sari (variety) store, selling commodities ranging from eggs, edible oil, sugar, coffee, energy drinks, powdered milk, soap, shampoo and toothpaste.

She owns her home and has three grown children, who are her greatest joy. She hails from the rural town of Dauis, Bohol.

For the past three years, Marciana has been running a sari-sari (variety) store, serving locals in her place.

She wants to buy stock like groceries, drinks, feed and hogs. In this way, she could boost her business and continue to serve her customers well. She could also start to raise hogs, and hopefully improve her income.

In the future, Marciana would like to expand her business to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy stock like groceries, drinks, feed and hogs.

loans.name: Garba

texts.en:
Garba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Garba has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Garba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Garba can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Garba will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Garba is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sultana

texts.en:
Sultana is a 48-year-old woman; she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five children. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of family. Sultana is also providing sewing services and earn income to contribute with her husband to manage the household.

She is needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc... for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories.

Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase the above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Sultana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a retailer in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Her business existed up to this time due to her hardwork and dedication. She perseveres to provides for the needs of her family, fueled by her ardent passion of providing a bright future for her children.

She is financed by Paglaum MPC and in return she managed her accounts without defaults.

Recently, she asked the coop for a loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 to restock the store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, drinking soda, confectioneries, condiments and other things.

loans.use: to restock the store with consumable goods such as canned goods, noodles, drinking soda, confectioneries, condiments and other things.

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 50 years old and married and hails from Alegria, Misamis Occidental, where she operates her rice field. She is doing well and yields good harvest from it.

She is assisted by Paglaum MPC through its loan program intended for farmers like her. Recently, she avails herself of a loan to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, es un joven de 21 años, que se dedica a la venta de productos farmacéuticos puerta a puerta en los distintos departamentos del país.
El préstamo que Francisco solicita, lo necesita para comprar una moto que le permita movilizarse con mayor rapidez, ya que, no cuenta con un vehículo para viajar a los departamentos, la moto sería de mucha ayuda, ya que, de esta forma Francisco podría abastecer a más farmacias a lo largo del país, lo que le permitirá aumentar sus ganancias y de esta forma cumplir sus metas de, tener su propia farmacia y una casa.
texts.en: Francisco, a 21 year old young man, sells pharmaceutical products door-to-door in the country’s different departments.  Francisco is requesting the loan because he needs to purchase a motorbike, which will allow him to get around faster.  Since he doesn’t have a vehicle for traveling to the departments, the motorbike would be a great help.  In this way, Francisco could supply more pharmacies throughout the country, and this would allow him to increase his earnings, and achieve his goals of having his own pharmacy and a house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: El Arbol Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario El árbol está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, coordinado por Mirna de 37 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa desde hace ocho años, solicitan el financiamiento numero 17 a los socios de kiva, para invertir en la compra de cremas, perfumes, maquillaje y labiales. Su principal meta es crecer económicamente, con el crédito anterior logro la compre de un televisor plasma y un mueble, la segunda socia es Eugenia de 25 años, quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y frijoles cocidos, la tercer socia del grupo es Margot de 64 años, su negocio es la venta de ropa usada.
texts.en:
The solidarity group El árbol (The tree) is made up of three enterprising women, coordinated by 37 year old Mirna. She is married and has one child, and has earned a living selling cosmetics and clothing for 8 years. 

They are asking for loan number 17 from Kiva members, to invest in buying creams, perfumes, make-up and lipsticks. Their main goal in to grow economically, with the previous loan they managed to buy a plasma television and furniture.

The second member is 25 year old Eugeina, who earns a living selling clothes and cooked beans. The third member is Margot, she is 64 years old and has a business selling used clothes.

loans.use: to buy creams, perfumes, make-up and lipsticks.

loans.name: Davita

texts.en:
Davita is a married mother of five and she needs your financial help to make some basic repairs to the home and replace the leaking roof of it. 
Davita has been practicing agriculture in the three dynym land that her family owns."it's not that much the land that we own so that we could make some money. We only plant for the family and have some tangerine orchards selling the fruits and that is great too. We can't have animals because my husband and I work; me at some fish factory for a monthly pay of $117 and my husband as a prison guardian for a pay of $345/month. The roofing of our house is almost collapsing and needs some serious work otherwise will become a danger to our lives, " said Davita during the interview with the branch assistant.

loans.use: to repair the roofing that is currently leaking and also make some other repairs inside the home

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 47 years old lady, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of three children and her husband has been a butcher for past 25 years.

Shamim's husband wants to purchase animals for his business purpose but due to financial constraints her husband is unable to purchase these cattle.

Therefore Shamim has requested for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy these cattle to fulfill the needs of his business. This will also good for him to earn maximum profitable income derived from his business.
On this financial assistance Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cattle her husband for butcher business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Doña María tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene solo una hija, mayor de edad e independiente económicamente. Ella es una lideresa de la comunidad de Peralta y conocida como persona trabajadora y de excelentes principios. Su espíritu emprendedor la ha llevado a desarrollar diferentes actividades productivas como la venta por catálogo y cría de animales, que le permitan generar ingresos y ayudar a su familia. En una comunidad rural con escasas fuentes de trabajo, Doña María se la ingenia para colocar sus productos y abrir nuevos mercados. Actualmente el negocio que quiere fortalecer es la ganadería, además de seguir trabajando en la avicultura, negocio que ha logrado consolidar, y ocasionalmente la porcicultura.  Ella es una persona que ha mantenido siempre una buena moral de pago en los 3 créditos solicitados anteriormente.
Inicia su negocio hace siete años con un monto de cien mil colones, su patrimonio de más de 4 millones de colones está concentrado en el terreno utilizado para realizar las actividades pecuarias.Su plan de invesión es la compra de terneros y todos los insumos necesarios para la cria y el desarrollo, alimentos, vitaminas, desparasitantes y otros.
Por la ruralidad y las particularidades de la comunidad donde vive, existe un mercado que es la población económicamente activa, clientes potenciales que no pueden desplazarse a otros lugares para comprar pollos, huevos y más adelante leche carne, a los que le puede vender sus productos. Ella  misma entrega los pedidos que le realizan, incluso de otras comunidades que le solicitan. Doña María tiene claridad que competencia si existe, sin embargo asegura que el cuido que le da a los animales, es la garantía que puede ofrecer de su producto. 
Acostumbran separar los desechos orgánicos para ser convertidos en abono, ya que en su propiedad tiene algunos cultivos para consumo familiar.
texts.en:
María is 46 years old. She is married and has only one daughter, who is of age and economically independent. María is a leader in the community of Peralta, and known as a hardworking person with excellent principles. Her entrepreneurial spirit has led her to develop different productive jobs, such as catalog sales and the breeding of animals, that allow her to generate income and help her family. In a rural community with a scarcity of jobs, María engineers things to place her products and open new markets.

Currently the business she wants to strengthen is cattle raising, while she continues to work in aviculture, a business she has managed to consolidate, and occasionally in pig farming. She is a person who has always maintained good payment practices with the 3 loans she previously sought. She began her business seven years ago, with 100,000 colones. Her assets of more than 4 million colones are concentrated in the land she uses for pig farming. Her investment plan is to buy calves and all the supplies necessary for raising and breeding them, such as food, vitamins, and deworming medicines, among others.

Due to the rural nature and the particularities of the community she lives in, there is a market consisting of the economically active population: potential customers who cannot travel to other places to buy chickens, eggs, and soon, milk and beef, to whom she will be able to sell her products. She herself delivers the orders she gets, including those made from other communities. María is certain that competition exists, nevertheless, she asserts that the care she gives the animals is the guarantee she can offer for her product. She is accustomed to separating the organic waste to be converted into fertilizer, as some of the crops on her property are for the family's consumption.

loans.use: to buy calves and all the supplies necessary for raising and breeding them, such as food, vitamins, and deworming medicines, among others.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 38 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. She has been in the business of chicken farming for three years. She earns a monthly income of 40,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is Miriam's first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy chickens and chicken feed. She will use the profits from her expanded business to improve her family's standard of living.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a better business and a good standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Carlyn

texts.en:
Carlyn works hard to support her family. Carlyn is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Carlyn requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, oil, etc. for her business.

Carlyn has been in this business for 3 years now.

Carlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, sugar, oil, etc. for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
0Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines.

Teresita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 2 years now.

Teresita would like to save money to provide a good future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Soeurt's Group

texts.en: Soeurt’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Soeurt makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these men and woman to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 50 years old. She is married and blessed with four children. Her business is chicken farming and she has been in this business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy chickens and chicken feed. She will use the profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a better business and a good standard of living.

loans.use: to buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Ana Mae

texts.en:
Ana Mae is 28 years old and has three children. Ana Mae is married and has two children are still in school.

Ana Mae is in the agricultural business, raising chicken in the Philippines. Ana Mae requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chicken.

Ana Mae has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ana Mae would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chicken

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: Ramon, de 48 años de edad, de estado civil casado, tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos de 16años, viven en un lugar muy apartado de la ciudad es muy humilde,responsable y muy trabajador desde las 4 y 30 de la mañana se levanta a dejar ordeñando sus vacas, sale a trabajar al jornal,Ramon necesita el dinero para comprar una vaca aumentar su producción de leche y asi poder seguir alimentando a sus hijos, él quiere que ellos tengan mejores oportunidades, a futuro desea adquirir un terreno propio para construir su propia casa ya que en la que viven es prestada.
texts.en: Ramon is 48 years old. He is married and has two children, one of whom is 16 years old. They live in an area far from the city. He is very humble, responsible and hard-working. He gets up at 4:30 in the morning to milk his cows, and then goes out to work for the day. Ramon needs the money to buy a cow to increase his milk production, and thereby continue feeding his children. He wants them to have better opportunities. In future he would like to buy his own land and build a house on it, as he currently lives in a borrowed house.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita works hard to support five children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Anita requested a PHP 6750 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Anita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase solar lamp

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 46 years old and married with three children, three children are still in school, Annabelle works very hard to provide for them.

Annabelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection.

Annabelle has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future Annabelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection

loans.name: Jose Saul

texts.es:
El  Joven José: Vive en la aldea la victoria con su esposa e hijo, se dedica al cultivo de café y maíz, el solicita el crédito para poder dar asistencia al cultivo de café y además quiere iniciar con el negocio de cría de cerdos ya que el cuenta con una cerda parendera y 5 cerditos pequeños el joven es una persona trabajadora con mucho entusiasmo de el apoyo que Prisma le puede brindar y así poder seguir luchando día con día para una mejor vida.

 El joven José  es una persona de mucho entusiasmo y está convencido que con el crédito va poder salir adelante con sus planes, tiene la seguridad de tener una mejor posición en sus proyectos para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Su sueño es poder crecer atreves de esto y de poder  seguir luchando para poder tener una mejor vida.



Santa Cruz de Yojoa,  Honduras – Septiembre 2015
texts.en:
José lives in a town called La Victoria along with his wife and son. José earns a living growing coffee and corn. He is requesting this loan in order to help his coffee crops as well as to begin raising pigs since he has a female pig for breeding and 5 small pigs. José is a hardworking person with a lot of enthusiasm and support from Prisma. He fights every day to obtain a better life.

José is a very enthusiastic person who is convinced that this loan will help him move forward with his plans. He is sure that he will be in a better position to offer his family a better quality of life. José's dream is to be able to grow through this experience and to keep fighting to be able to have a better life.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – September 2015

loans.use: to raise animals and farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy thread, wool, needles and raffia.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 28 years old. She is married and blessed with one child. She sells clothes to earn a living and she has been in this business for five years. She earns a monthly income of 25,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy clothes to sell. She will use the profits from her expanded business to increase her clothing stock. Her hopes and dreams are to have a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Joenabeth

texts.en:
Joenabeth is 31 years old and married with one child, one child still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Joenabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection.

She has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Joenabeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal collection.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 46 years old, married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sardines, oil, soap, etc. to sell.

Marilou has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sardines, oil, soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Washington Gregorio

texts.es:
Washington es un señor de 54 años vive en casa de familiares en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, sector perteneciente a la región costa del país. 
Washington cuenta con su propio negocio, hace muchos años el recorre vendiendo productos naturales, visita a sus clientes en su moto distribuyendo al por mayor y menor. Además de estos ingresos hace poco se puso una tienda donde vende víveres en general, le ha ido muy bien ya que es la única tiendita del sector, poco a poco ha ido surtiéndola.
Washington es cliente nuevo para l institución, con este crédito podrá comprar toda la mercadería necesaria para seguir recorriendo en la venta de sus productos, va a comprar todo en medicina para ampliarse a nuevas zonas y seguir creciendo como microempresario, ya que tiene planificado en un futuro comprarse su propia casa y para ello necesita trabajar duro.
texts.en:
Washington, a 54 year old man, lives with his family in Santo Domingo, a sector that belongs to the country’s coastal region.

Washington has his own business, and has been traveling around selling natural products for many years. He visits his customers on his motorbike, distributing wholesale and retail. In addition, with this income, he recently started a store where he sells groceries. The business has been going very well because it is the only shop in the area, and he has been gradually stocking it.

Washington is a new client at the institution, and this loan will enable him to purchase all the merchandise he needs to continue traveling around to sell his products. He is going to purchase medicine so that he can expand to new areas, and continue growing as a small business owner. He plans to purchase his own home in the future, and for this, he needs to work hard.

loans.use: to acquire new merchandise, and expand his customer area, which will enable him to save and purchase a house in the future.

loans.name: Elham

texts.en:
Elham runs a quilt and blanket sales business. With her loan, she plans to purchase bed linens and stock her business to ‎be ready for the winter season.‎

Elham is the young and caring mother of four kids. She is 28 years old ‎and lives in Deir Alla. She dreamed of finishing her education but ‎she could not achieve her dream because of the financial hardship that ‎her family has faced.‎

Because of that hardhship, Elham began helping her husband provide for their children by selling ‎blankets and clothes in her home. Now, her business is working ‎well and she is very happy to feel that she is a productive and helpful ‎woman.‎

Elham needs your help to increase her income and to improve her family's standard of living.‎

loans.use: to purchase bed linens and stock her business to ‎be ready for the winter season.‎

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Josie works hard to support her family.

She has an Internet cafe business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Josie is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for her computer and maintenance for her business.

Josie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her computer and maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Mercedes Estebana

texts.es: Mercedes de 48 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se despierta desde muy temprano para comprar mariscos por mayor, ya que se gana la vida vendiendo pescado y mariscos desde hace varios años, lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Mercedes vive en casa de su propiedad desde hace varios años, luego de la pérdida de su esposo Mercedes puso todo su empeño en sacar adelante a sus hijos que ya son mayores de edad y tienen sus propias familias. Mercedes desea continuar con su venta de mariscos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pescado, camarones, punches, cangrejos, entre otros productos para continuar surtiendo su negocio, como ya lo hizo con el crédito anterior.
texts.en: Mercedes is 48 years old. She is a hardworking woman who wakes up very early to buy shellfish wholesale, as she has earned a living by selling fish and shellfish for many years. This has allowed her to get her family ahead. Mercedes lives in a house she has owned for various years. After losing her husband, Mercedes put all of her effort into getting her children ahead; they're already adults and have their own families. Mercedes wants to continue selling shellfish, so she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in fish, shrimp, and crabs, among other products, to continue stocking her business, as she did with the previous loan.

loans.use: to invest in fish, shrimp, and crab, among other products, to continue stocking her business.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es: Don Carmelo es un microempresario exitoso, soltero de 60 años de edad, ejemplo de vida para personas que quieren superarse y prosperar económicamente en sus negocios, él se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos desde hace cinco años, en el negocio le ayuda a atender a los clientes un trabajador, solicita por onceava vez el financiamiento de los socios de kiva para invertir en la compra de abanicos, planchas, licuadoras y hornos pequeños. Una de sus metas es seguir creciendo y diversificar el negocio con la oferta de otros productos, con el crédito anterior logro cubrir los gastos de su vehículo.
texts.en:
Carmelo is a successful small business owner. He is single, 60 years old, and an example for anyone who wants to improve themselves and prosper financially in their business. Carmelo makes a living selling household appliances and has done so for the last 5 years. He employs one man who helps him to serve customers.

Carmelo is requesting a Kiva loan for the 11th time in order to invest in fans, irons, blenders, and small ovens. One of his goals is to keep growing and diversify his business to offer other products. With his last loan, Carmelo was able to cover the expenses for his vehicle.

loans.use: to buy fans, irons, blenders, and small ovens.

loans.name: Lucerito De Villa Progreso Group

texts.es: “LUCERITO DE VILLA PROGRESO” es un nuevo grupo conformada por 06 mujeres trabajadoras. Maria es soltera con hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de bocaditos comida para diversos eventos bautizos cumpleaños matrimonios quinceañeras. Dicha  actividad viene realizando hace muchos años. el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de un nuevo artículo samovar. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Maria es la primera del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: Lucerito de Villa Progreso" is a new group made up of 6 hard-working women.  Maria is single with independent children.  She works making food snacks for a variety of events such as baptisms, birthdays, weddings and "quinceaneras" [a gala held to celebrate a girl's 15th birthday].  She has done this for many years.  She will invest the loan in the purchase of a new samovar.  The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan provided.  Maria is the first person on the left.

loans.use: to purchase a new samovar.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife earns a living selling dried fish. She has sold dried fish for a year now, catering mostly to locals and settlers in her town. Due to high demand, she has find ways to become productive. She is a 34-year-old married woman and has six children who range from ages 1-15 years old. Her husband also earns an income which helps with the family expenses.

Marife has requested a loan to buy more supplies of fish, salt, and cellophane. With increased supply, she would be able to do bulk orders and continue to operate her business. If she increases her earnings, she can set some aside for future use.

She is determined to work hard to improve the family's living conditions. In the future, Marife is looking forward to slowly building greater prosperity so she can stay productive and continue to support the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of  fish, salt and cellophane

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: María es una mujer laboriosa de 63 años de edad, casada. Ella es propietaria de un salón de belleza desde hace seis años, uno de sus proyectos es hacer crecer el negocio, por lo que solicita por cuarta vez el financiamiento en ADIM, para la compra de champo, acondicionador, cremas, tintes y pinturas de uñas. Con el crédito anterior logro abrir una venta de zapatos nuevos.
texts.en: María is a hardworking woman who is 63 years old and married. She has owned a beauty salon for six years. One of her projects is to grow her business. This is why she is requesting a loan for the fourth time from ADIM to buy shampoo, conditioner, lotions, dyes, and nail polishes. With her previous loan she was able to open a shop selling new shoes.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioner, lotions, dyes, and nail polishes.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is 32 years old. She is married and blessed with five children. Her business is rearing chickens for both broiling and and laying eggs. She has been in this business for five years.

She earns a monthly income of 70,000 Kenya shillings. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy chicks and chicken feed.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hope and dream is to become a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Manuela Petrona

texts.es: Manuela es una mujer laboriosa de 55 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo de quince años, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de acero, ropa y zapatos desde hace doce años y solicita por octava vez el financiamiento en ADIM, para la compra de anillos, cadenas, pulseras y pantalones. una de sus metas es superarse y con créditos anteriores logro comprar materiales de construcción, para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Manuela is a hardworking, 55-year-old woman who is married and has a 15-year-old son. She makes a living selling metal jewelry, clothing, and shoes. She has run this business for 12 years. Manuela is requesting her eighth loan from ADIM in order to buy rings, chains, bracelets, and pants. One of her goals is to excel. With her previous loans, she was able to buy construction materials to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rings, chains, bracelets, and pants.

loans.name: Glenda Del Socorro

texts.es: Glenda es una mujer laboriosa de 29 años de edad, madre solera de un niño de ocho años, quien es su mayor motivación. Ella se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y refrescos desde hace tres años y esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de carne, papa, tocino, maíz, leña y hojas. Una de sus metas es abrir un negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en: Glenda is a hard-working woman. She is 29-years-old and a single mother of an 8-year-old boy, who is her biggest motivation. She earns a living selling nacatamales (corn meal, meat and rice wrapped in banana leaf) and soft drinks for three years. Glenda is requesting this loan in order to buy meat, potatoes, bacon, corn, wood, and banana leaves. One of her goals is to open a business selling clothing.

loans.use: to buy meat, potatoes, bacon, corn, wood, and banana leaves.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary, 39, is a married woman who lives in a small community in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has three children who are currently in school. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small plot of land near her house. On her farmland, she grows rice and sells her agricultural products to the local dealers. On average, she can generate earnings of $5 USD per day.

Currently, the farmland that she owns is small and it can only provide a small benefit to her. Sary wants to enlarge her farmland area but she cannot afford to. Therefore, she would like to get a Kiva loan to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice. She hopes this additional farmland will help to improve her living conditions. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland for growing rice.

loans.name: Olinda Chica

texts.es:
La Sr.  Olinda : Vive con su hijo en la aldea de picachito  de santa cruz de yojoa,  cuenta con media manzana de malanga y  con  cultivo de piña generando buenas ganancia es una persona muy luchadora  con deseos de salir adelante y seguir enfrentando la vida día con día.

 La  Sr. Olinda es una persona luchadora y con mucho entusiasmo y sobre todo responsable cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo Walter que le ayuda en sus cultivos nos expresa  que su Hijo Walter es una bendición junto a su familia ya que cuenta con el asesoramiento de  ellos está  muy contenta de el apoyo que Prisma les pueda brindar

El sueño  es llegar a tener sembrada una manzana de piña logrando llegar a un mejor nivel de agricultura y así poder tener una mejor vida junto a su familia.



Santa Cruz de Yojoa  Honduras –Septiembre 2015
texts.en:
Olinda lives with her son in the village of Picachito in Santa Cruz de Yojoa. She has half of block where she grows taro and pineapples which generate a good profit. She is a tenacious person with hopes to be successful and continue to face life day-by-day.

Olinda is a tenacious woman with a lot of enthusiasm and above all, responsible. She has the support of her son Walter who helps her with her crops. She says that her son Walter and her family are a blessing because she relies on their advice.

She is very happy with the support that Prisma provides. Her dream is to have a block of pineapple planted so that she can reach a better level of agriculture so that she can have a better life with her family.

loans.use: with her pineapple crop and to expand her farming.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 53 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. Her business is embroidery. She has been in this business for 25 years. She earns a monthly income of 33,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy material for embroidery. She will use the profits from her expanded business to increase her savings and take care of her family's needs.

Her hope and dream is to open a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy material for embroidery.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 30 years old. She is married and blessed with four children. Her business is selling used clothes and she has been in this business for seven years. She earns a monthly income of 35,000 Kenyan shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy clothes to sell. She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hope and dream is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 43 years old and married with five children, two of whom in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like noodles, sugar, can goods, sardines, oil, etc. to sell.

Gina has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like noodles, sugar, can goods, sardines, oil, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is a married woman, 57 years old with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Elina requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her local market.

Elina has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her local market

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia works hard to support two children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Emelia requested a PHP 6750 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Emelia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Ma. Chiny

texts.en: Ma. Chiny is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Ma. Chiny is 35 years old and has three children, who are still in school. Ma. Chiny has a food production business in the Philippines. Ma. Chiny requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Ma. Chiny has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Yensi

texts.es:
Yensi tiene 25 años de edad, un hijo de 3 años y vive en unión libre hace 5 años. Ella es una joven con muchos planes y deseos de superarse. Es comerciante desde hace 4 años y en este lapso de tiempo ella se ha capacitado en otras actividades productivas, como pintura en piezas de cerámica, técnicas de manicure y pedicure, así como de gestión empresarial. Todos estos conocimientos le han permitido desarrollarse en diferentes áreas, generar ingresos adicionales a su hogar y lograr su autonomía económica. Su principal negocio es la comercialización de diferentes productos como ropa, lencería, sandalias, perfumes y artículos para el hogar de forma ambulante, además como actividad paralela está trabajando en la pintura de piezas en cerámica, habilidad que ha perfeccionado con los diversos cursos y es en lo que va a invertir el crédito, comprando cerámica en crudo, pinturas, tisas, abrillantador, pinceles y otros. Como si fuera poco Yensy da los primeros pasos en la atención a clientes que le solicitan los servicios de esmaltado de uñas, uñas artificiales y otros, gracias a un curso que está por concluir. Su primer crédito lo solicito siendo parte de un Banco Mujer y está en la segunda solicitud de forma individual, los créditos anteriores han sido pagados de forma puntual. 
La realización de las diferentes actividades, le han permitido costearse los cursos técnicos y que actualmente representa una fuente de ingresos. Los ingresos que generan dichos emprendimientos están destinados en la mayoría para la reinversión.
Sus clientes son vecinos de la misma comunidad donde vive, así como de otros barrios aledaños, también le compran productos compañeras de los mismos cursos a los que asiste. Las ventas son de forma ambulante, al igual que la entrega de las piezas de cerámica, los servicios de manicure y pedicure son a domicilio. Gracias a las diversas actividades que realiza le permite, tener ingresos fijos, que aunque no son muy elevados representa una ayuda muy importante para ella. En cuanto a competencia, no existe otra persona el mismo barrio que se dedique al comercio, sin embargo en los servicios que brinda si, por lo que se esmera en dar una buena atención al  cliente, con precios accesibles. 
Yensi acostumbra recolectar todos las botellas, cajas y otros desechos reutilizables para la elaboración de manualidades, algo que le gusta mucho y lo considera como pasatiempo.
texts.en:
Yensi is 25 years old. She has a three year old child and has lived in a common-law relationship for five years. She is a youth with many plans and the desire to excel. She has been a businesswoman for four years and during this time has taken training in other productive activities such as painting ceramic pieces, manicure and pedicure techniques as well as business management. All this knowledge has allowed her to develop different fields, generating additional income for her household and achieving her financial independence.

Her main business is selling different products like clothing, lingerie, sandals, perfume and household items itinerantly. Also as a part time business she is painting ceramic pieces, a skill she has perfected in various courses. This is where she is going to invest the loan buying raw ceramic pieces, paint, chalk, enamel, brushes and others.

As if this is not enough Yensy is starting to provide service to clients who want their nails painted, false nails and others, thanks to a course that is now finishing. The first loan she requested was as part of a communal bank and this is her second loan as an individual. The previous loans have been paid punctually.

Carrying out these different activities has allowed her to pay for her technical courses which now represent a source of income. The majority of the income that these enterprises generate is destined to be re-invested.

Her clients are neighbours of the same community where she lives as well as neighbouring villages. Her classmates in her courses also buy her products. She does her selling itinerantly as well as delivering ceramic pieces. Her manicure and pedicure services are out of her house. Thanks to her diverse activities she has regular income and though it is very high it represents an important support for her. As to competition there is no other person in her neighborhood in commerce. However there is competition for her services, so she does her best to provide good service and accessible prices for her clients.

Yensi normally collects all the bottles, boxes and other reusable waste to make crafts, something she enjoys and considers a hobby.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like: raw ceramic pieces, paint, chalk, enamel, brushes and others.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur with three children. She earns a living from a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from farming sugarcane. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. 

Marlyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Murktar

texts.en:
Murktar is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Murktar has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Murktar would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Murktar can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Murktar will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Murktar is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es:
José, de 45 años de edad, es muy trabajador y luchador, está acompañado y sus hijos y su esposa le apoyan en la alimentación de los cerdos y del cuidado de los mismos; este tipo de negocio lo ha realizado desde hace mucho tiempo y ha significado mucho para él y para generar ingresos para su familia.

José, trabaja en la crianza y destazo de cerdos desde que su padre le enseño este oficio y desde entonces le gusto y pudo generar ingresos para su familia; la crianza y engorde de cerdos está en un pequeño chiquero que tiene en su casa.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar más cerdos para engorde, concentrado y para reparar la porqueriza, porque es artesanal y requiere unos cambios para ser más adecuada para los cerdos.

José, desea en el futuro mejorar más su porqueriza y tener más cerdos.
texts.en:
José, 45, is a hard worker and a fighter. He is in a common-law relationship, and his children and his wife help him feed and take care of the pigs. He has been engaged in this type of work for long time, and it has meant a lot to him because it generates income for his family.

José has worked in the raising and butchering of pigs since his father taught him this trade, and since then he has enjoyed it, and been able to generate income for his family. He raises and fattens the pigs in a small pigpen in his home.

José needs the loan to buy more pigs for fattening and concentrated feed, as well as to repair the pigpen because it is handmade and requires some changes to be more suitable for the pigs.
In the future, José wishes to further improve his pigpen, and have more pigs.

loans.use: to buy more pigs for fattening and concentrated feed, as well as to repair the pigpen.

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Yakubu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Yakubu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Yakubu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Lean

texts.en:
Being a chef, Lean, who is a 60-year-old married woman with four children, all of them married, can only make $5 USD per day to support her family. She resides in a rural area of Prasat Bakong District, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia and has been involved in this career for nearly 6 years.

Because it is hard to find a place to go to the toilet, she decided to apply for a Kiva loan through HKL to build a hygienic latrine for her house. She is very happy with this loan, since it will promote her health, the environment, and her living standards. She would like to thank all the lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Jery Ignacio

texts.es:
Jery es un hombre de 37 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es el servicio de fotocopiado.
Él es independiente, constante y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por agrupar a la mayor parte de la población y por la producción manufacturera en todas las áreas.
Jery es de piel morena, baja estatura y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español para el comercio, su vida la realiza cuidado a sus padres que son ancianos y no trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el servicio de fotocopias, él recibe libros, guías, cuadernillos, tareas y todo tipo de información para fotocopiarla, sus mayores clientes son estudiantes de una universidad cercana que dejan textos y otros materiales, “la temporada estudiantil es de trabajo continuo, la temporada de vacaciones es casi nula…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la temporada estudiantil dura casi todo el año, la desventaja es el mal funcionamiento del equipo por falta de mantenimiento. Su sueño es tener su negocio en su propia casa, él desea comprar material de escritorio como, hojas, cartulinas, papel de todo tamaño, y también realizar el mantenimiento a su fotocopiadora. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Jery solicita un préstamo para comprar material de escritorio y realizar el mantenimiento a su fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Jery is 37 years old. He is single and doesn't have any children. He makes a living making copies. He is independent, driven, and very hardworking. He runs his business in the southern area of the city, which is where most of the population is concentrated, as well as manufacturing businesses of all kinds.

Jery is short and has a robust build and dark skin. His first language is Guaraní, but he also speaks Spanish for work. He lives with his parents, who are elderly and don't work. They live in a brick house, which they own. It has potable water, electricity and sewer.

He provides photocopying services. He receives books, guides, notebooks, homework, and all kinds of documents that need to be copied. Most of his customers are college students from a nearby University, who leave texts and other materials with him. "I have constant work during the school year, but during school breaks there is hardly any work at all," he says. The advantage is that kids are in school most of the year. The disadvantage is his equipment malfunctioning, which it does due to lack of proper maintenance. His dream is to run his business from home.

In the four years he has been in business, this is his first loan through Emprender. He will use it to buy office supplies like paper of all sizes and cardstock, and also to do maintenance on his copy machine.

loans.use: to buy office supplies and do maintenance on his copy machine.

loans.name: C20108 Ibakwe Group

texts.en:
Consolee is a 43-year-old married mother with four children. She has operated a beans business for the past eight years. She works everyday from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. While the work is tough and the hours are long, Consolee is committed to her business so that her children may prosper.

Consolee has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy a large quantity of beans and resale. With this loan, she will earn more profits which will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability, as well as pay her child's school fees and medical insurance and to buy new clothes for her children. Over the next five years, as her business continues to grow, Consolee hopes to earn enough money to educate all her children.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of beans and resale.

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: Guadalupe es una señora trabajadora de 61 años de edad, casada, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 15 años, una de sus hijas le ayuda en el negocio entregando los encargos solicitados por sus clientes, es el crédito número catorce que solicita en ADIM, para la compra de camisas, pantalones, licras y faldas. Cabe destacar que ella ha mostrado ser una mujer responsable y puntual con los pagos, con las ganancias de los créditos anteriores logro comprar un televisor y una máquina de carpintería.
texts.en: Guadalupe is a hardworking, 61-year-old woman. She is married and has made a living selling clothing for 15 years. One of her daughters helps her with her business, delivering her customers' orders. This is Guadalupe's fourteenth loan from ADIM. It will allow her to buy shirts, pants, Spandex, and skirts. It is worth noting that she has proven to be a responsible woman who is punctual with her payments. With her earnings from her previous loans, she was able to buy a television and machine for carpentry.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, Spandex, and skirts.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 41 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. Her business is a retail shop. She has been in the business for 15 years. She earns a monthly income of thirty thousand Kenya shillings. 


This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, bread, detergents, rice, maize flour etc. for the shop. She will use the profits from expanded business to take care of family school fees and health needs. Her hopes and dreams are to be a large scale farmer.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, bread, detergents, rice, maize flour etc. for the shop.

loans.name: Yamid Elias

texts.es: Yamid es un emprendedor que decidió unir sinergias con su cónyuge quien durante años estuvo laborando en el comercio de prendas de vestir femeninas y que contaba con una excelente trayectoria. Tras su asociación, obtuvieron mejores resultados que el que hubieran podido esperar trabajando independientemente es por eso que para ellos es muy importante el trabajo en equipo y estar siempre fusionados en pro de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, principalmente de sus hijos de 12 y 17 años.  En la actualidad ofrecen una variada gama de prendas de vestir unisex, las cuales promocionan en su local comercial entre sus amigos, vecinos y familiares,  a quienes les gusta lucir prendas de calidad y diseños modernos. Ellos desean incrementar sus utilidades y consideran que surtir con más variedad en la temporada que se avecina seria propicio para cumplir con su meta, es por ello que está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y comprar principalmente ropa para dama; short, blusas, jeans y vestidos.  Su meta a futuro es adquirir su propio local y costearles la educación profesional a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Yamid is an entrepreneur who decided to join synergies with his spouse, who for years worked in the women's clothing trade and who had an excellent track record. Through this partnership, they obtained better results than if they had been working independently. This is why, for them, it is very important to work as a team and always fused towards improving their family's quality of life, especially their sons who are 12 and 17 years old.

Currently, they offer a range of unisex clothing which they promote in their shop among their friends, neighbors, and family members who like to wear quality garments and modern designs. They want to increase their profits and think that stocking with more variety in the coming season would be suitable to reach their goal. This is why they are requesting their first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy mainly women's clothing such as shorts, blouses, jeans, and dresses. His future goal is to acquire his own shop and pay for his children's professional education.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing such as shorts, blouses, jeans, and dresses.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is 25 years old and lives in Dairalla. Most of her daily income is ‎from selling blankets and she is still happy to be doing this business, ‎she is mother of two little kids and she wants to provide them a good ‎life. She sells blankets and woven blankets and other items.‎
She requested loan to have more working capital to buy more ‎blankets. And she wants to manage her business well, and improve ‎the standards of living for her family.‎
Amal is very happy of feeling a productive woman, and she needs ‎your support.‎

loans.use: to have more working capital to buy more ‎blankets.

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en: Bahaa is 18 year old single man. He is living with his parents in ‎Jarash. His father is the main income source for the family in order to ‎satisfy their needs. Due to the hard financial situation, today, he is ‎asking to take a loan to pay the first installment of his educational ‎fees in IT. In the future, he plans to take new Kiva loans and keep on ‎covering his study fees.‎

loans.use: to pay for his university fees in IT.

loans.name: Silvia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Silvia, de 29 años de edad, se dedica al comercio de ropa en el cantón donde reside y de lunes a viernes ella sale a vender este producto a los vecinos, está acompañada y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad.

Silvia, se dedica a la venta de ropa por menor en su cantón y comunidades aledañas todo mundo la conoce y le encargan ropa cuando necesitan de este tipo.

Silvia, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa para la venta y poder comerciarla en las comunidades aledaña de la zona.

Silvia, sueña con mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Silvia is 29 years old. She works selling clothing in the canton where she lives. From Monday to Friday she sells clothing to her neighbors. She is in a relationship and has a 3-year-old child.

Silvia sells clothes retail in her canton and in neighboring communities. Everyone knows her and they order from her when they need clothing.

Silvia needs a loan to buy clothing to sell and also to be able to sell in the area's neighboring communities.

Silvia dreams of improving her home.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Thelma Rubídia

texts.es:
Thelma, de 49 años de edad, es viuda, su esposo falleció en un accidente automovilístico y desde ese momento tuvo que criar sola a sus dos hijos, los cuales estaban pequeños. 

Thelma, se dedica a la elaboración de coronas y ramos de flores para todo tipo de ocasión, por lo que esto ha significado su fuente principal de ingresos.

Thelma, necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales para elaborar más arreglos para vender el día de los santos difuntos y para tener arreglos para el día de los enamorados y otras ocasiones, ella cuenta con un gran número de clientes que le compran su mercancía por ser de buen precio y de buena calidad.

Thelma, sueña con tener un local estable para vender sus arreglos e incrementar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Thelma, 49, is a widow. Her husband died in an automobile accident, and from this moment she had to raise her two children alone, who were small at the time. She is engaged in making floral wreathes and bouquets for any occasion, so this has meant her only source of income.

Thelma needs the loan to purchase materials to create more arrangements to sell on the Day of the Dead, and to have arrangements for Valentine’s Day, and other occasions. She has a great number of customers that purchase her merchandise because of the good price and high quality. She dreams of having a fixed local to sell her arrangements, and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase materials to create more arrangements to sell on the Day of the Dead,

loans.name: Karina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Karina, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada, es madre de 1 niña de 6 años de edad, su pareja trabaja de cobrador de buses y viven en casa de su mamá.

Karina, se dedica a la venta de ropa y a la elaboración de arreglos florales desde hace 5 años y todo lo que sabe lo aprendió gracias a su madre. 

Karina, necesita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor y para comprar papel para la elaboración de arreglos florales, ya que por medio de estas actividades obtiene ingresos para el sustento de su familia.

El sueño de Karina, es seguir trabajando para hacer crecer su negocio y obtener mejores ingresos para hacer su casa propia y darle a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Karina is 25 years old and studied up to Grade 7. She is in a relationship and is the mother of a six year old daughter. Her partner works as a bus conductor and they live in his mother's house.

Karina has worked selling clothing and making floral arrangements for five years. She learned all she knows from her mother.

Karina needs the loan to buy clothing wholesale and buy paper to make floral arrangements as it is through these activities that she makes income to sustain the family.

Karina's dream is to continue to work and grow her businesses so she can make her own house and provide her daughter with a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale and buy paper to make floral arrangements.

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
Eleuteria, de 63 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, porque desde pequeña tenía que trabajar porque sus padres eran de escasos recursos, está soltera pero es madre de 7 hijos de los cuales, solo 1 vive con ella y su compañero de vida murió hace 11 años y ella está yendo a la escuela nocturna para aprender a leer, escribir y firmar.

Eleuteria, cuenta con mucha experiencia en la elaboración de petates, también en hacer pitas hacer hamacas, a la elaboración de petates y pitas; todas estas artesanías las aprendió desde que era una niña y fue gracias a sus padres.

El préstamo para comprar material para la elaboración de hamacas, porque siempre ha trabajado para otras personas, pero esta vez quiere trabajar en lo propio para mejorar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Eleuteria, es construir su casa de bloque, porque la casa que tiene ahorita es de bahareque y cuando llueve se moja adentro de la casa.
texts.en:
