Eleuteria is 63 years old and wasn't able to go to school because her parents had scarce resources and she had to work. She is single but has seven children, only one of whom lives with her. Her life partner passed away eleven years ago and she is attending night school in order to learn how to read, write, and sign her name.

Eleuteria has lots of experience making mats, as well as pita (agave fiber) and hammocks. She learned all of these crafts from her parents as a child.

She will use this loan to buy materials for making hammocks. She has always worked for others, but this time she wants to work on her own in order to improve her income.

Eleuteria's dream is to rebuild her home with blocks, because she currently lives in a waddle and daub home and, when it rains, water leaks into it.

loans.use: to buy materials to make hammocks.

loans.name: Beloved Group

texts.en:
Lydia, in her first cycle of loan is a single parent with three children, who is a very hardworking, dedicated and a committed woman who lives in Agege in the greater Accra region of Ghana.
She sells general food stuffs in a very busy area with four other colleagues in the Beloved Group.
In order to attend to the demands of her buyers and boost the financial standard of her business, she wish to take a loan through Id-Ghana to attain such purpose.
Lydia is located in front of her colleagues wearing a blue top.

loans.use: to attend to the demands of her buyers and boost the financial standard of her business.

loans.name: Today's Vision Group

texts.en:
Tapiwa is a mother to two children, a boy and a girl. She has teamed up with her husband and provide food, shelter, clothes and school fees for them. That is when she felt the need of starting an income generating activity. With her yard availing her opportunities in form of unused space, she decided to build a fowl run and start a poultry business. She consulted some “chicken guru’s “for advice and know-how on rearing chickens. Armed with the knowledge and financial support from her husband she started earning money. She keeps chickens in batches of a hundred, having two batches in different stages at any given time.

She heard about Thrive Microfinance. She was interested in what Thrive had to offer and teamed up with other hardworking women in her neighbourhood. They formed the group Today’s Vision. The group religiously attended training offered at Thrive. They have already started noticing significant change in their business, as they are now able to track and account for each and every cent in the business from the record keeping training they attended.

Whilst she earns money after every six weeks, she saw the need to venture into a profit that gave her daily sales. It dawned on her that she could extend her chicken business by adding layer chickens so that she can get eggs that she can sell daily around her neighbourhood. She is already in the process of extending her fowl run to accommodate the layer chickens. Tapiwa has applied for a $350 loan. Her husband and group members have also supported her idea of venturing into the egg business as they have seen her good progress with the broiler business.

loans.use: to extend her fowl run and purchase layers to go into egg production.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel,51, is married and a mother to 1 girl and 3 boys. 2 of her children are still in school and her husband is retired thus making her the family's breadwinner. She has worked hard to build a steady sewing business and has even managed to save her earnings and open a small tuck shop selling groceries and household items.

She is requesting for a loan to buy knitting sets, a new sewing machine and groceries for her shop. She has trained and employed one person, hence the need for a second machine. "With someone to help me, we will do more work and meet the orders" says Mabel. More stock for her shop will mean more variety hence increase sales.

Her ambition is to grow her business and leave her children with better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy knitting sets and a new sewing machine and to buy grocery stock for her shop.

loans.name: Hussein Raul Khaled

texts.es:
Hussein, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañado, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando y su pareja tiene un comedor desde hace 10 años.

Hussein, se dedicaba antes a la construcción, pero tuvo que dejar ese trabajo porque viajaban muy lejos y no le dedicaba mucho tiempo a su familia, fue por esa razón que decidió apoyar a su pareja con el comedor; ambos tienen que viajar 4 kilómetros de distancia y es por eso que necesitan reparar su vehículo.

Hussein, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos para el negocio y para reparar su vehículo, porque la demanda de clientes es mayor y necesita incrementar su inventario para complacer a sus clientes.

Hussein, sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y puedan generar sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Hussein is 33 years old and has a high school education. He lives with his girlfriend, who has been running a diner for ten years, and their two children, who are both in school.

Hussein used to work in construction, but he had to quit that line of work because he had to travel far and couldn't spend time with his family. That is why he decided to start working with his girlfriend at the diner. They both have to travel 2.5 miles to work, which is why they must also repair their vehicle.

As well as to pay for these repairs, Hussein will use this loan to buy supplies for their business, because they have more demand and he needs to increase his inventory in order to keep his customers satisfied.

Hussein's dream is for his children to build a career so they can earn their own income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his business and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Karen Yelitza

texts.es: Karen de 30 años es una emprendedora confeccionista del municipio de Barranquilla que organizó su propio proyecto de negocio hace 10 años, iniciativa que hoy le permite tener un mejor estilo de vida y garantizarle un ingreso seguro a su familia.  Para ella la costura fue una profesión heredada por tradición familiar; su madre siempre se dedicó a esta labor, sin embargo las habilidades para las ventas le permitieron a Karen ser mucho más diligente y lograr consolidarse rápidamente en el sector de la confección por volúmenes y concluir contratos con colegios para elaborar uniformes escolares, así como particulares a quienes confecciona vestidos, blusas, faldas, pantalones, todo un ajuar femenino. Actualmente está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que proyecta invertir en la compra materias primas como telas, hilos, y accesorios, para atender la demanda que genera la temporada de fin de año. Su principal reto es tener ampliar su gama de productos, con el propósito devengar mayores ingresos para el beneficio económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Karen is 30 years old and is an enterprising dressmaker in the city of Barranquilla. She started her own business 10 years ago, an initiative that today allows her to have a better lifestyle and that guarantees a secure income for her family. For her, sewing was a profession inherited by family tradition. Her mother always did this work. However, her selling skills allowed Karen to be much more diligent and to establish herself quickly in the dressmaking area by volume. She has completed contracts with schools to make school uniforms and also works with individuals for whom she makes dresses, blouses, skirts, pants, and entire women's outfits.

She is currently requesting her first loan with Kiva through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to invest these resources in buying raw materials such as fabrics, threads, and accessories to meet the demand that the year-end season generates. Her main challenge is to expand her range of products in order to earn a higher income for the economic benefit of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as fabric, thread, and accessories.

loans.name: Bibiana Isabel

texts.es: Bibiana es una microempresaria residenciada en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, ella está comprometida con su cónyuge y es madre de tres hijos, de los cuales solo uno es aún menor de edad. Ella tomó la decisión de iniciar una Miscelánea en su vivienda al considerar que su experiencia le permitiría tener un manejo óptimo de su negocio; ella laboró durante años en almacenes del centro de la ciudad en donde logró conocer a un buen grupo de proveedores y mayoristas de ropa. Su cónyuge le suministró el capital necesario para emprender su proyecto de negocio en el que lleva de estar funcionando dos años con óptimos resultados.  Todos los días de la semana a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. está dispuesta a recibir a sus clientes y promoverles un gran surtido de artículos que vende al contado o con facilidades de pago. En la actualidad desea aprovechar la temporada decembrina para incrementar sus ventas y garantizar excelentes resultados, es por ello que realizó una solicitud de crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, su primer credikiva que invertirá en nuevo surtido de prendas de vestir; bermudas, blusas, pantalones, vestidos entre otros. Su meta a futuro es continuar ampliando su negocio y seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Bibiana is a micro-entrepreneur who lives in a neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla. She is engaged to her partner and she is the mother three children, of which only one is still a minor. She decided to start general store in her home after determining that her experience would allow her to have optimal management of her business. For several years she worked in warehouses in the center of the city where she met a good number of suppliers and clothing wholesalers.

Her partner provided the capital necessary to undertake this business project where she has worked for two years with optimal results. Every day of the week from 8am until 7pm she is available to receive her customers and provide them a great assortment of items which she sells for cash or in easy payments.

Currently, she wishes to take advantage of the holiday season to increase her sales and guarantee excellent results. This is why she is requesting a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, this will be her first Kiva loan. She will invest this loan in a new assortment of clothing like shorts, blouses, pants, dresses, and other items. Her future goal is to continue expanding her business and to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of clothing such as shorts, blouses, pants, dresses, and other items.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en:
Saratu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Saratu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Saratu would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Saratu can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Saratu will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Saratu is thankful that she now has the opportunity to to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Virgillo

texts.es:
Virgilio con 52 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rústico,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus tres hijos, en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Virgilio cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Virgilio se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo café, de la variedad Catimor,sembrando 1 hectárea de café de su propiedad,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 15 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno y cultivo de productos de pan llevar.El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de dicho cultivo, con ello obtendrá buen rendimiento y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Virgilio es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en: Virgilio is 52 years old. He lives in common-law marriage in his own house of rustic material. He lives with his partner and their three children in the district of Santo Tomas, province of Cutervo, department of Cajamarca in Peru. Virgilio has good personal references as well as work references from the inhabitants of the area. This town's inhabitants work mainly in agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry. Virgilio works in agriculture, specifically cultivating coffee of the Catimor variety. He grows a hectare of coffee in his property. He has 15 years of experience in this business. Additionally, he works raising and selling cattle and cultivating basic staples. He will use the loan to maintain his crops. With this, he will get good yield and bigger earnings so he will be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family. Virgilio is a recurrent member of Edypme Alternativa.

loans.use: to maintain his cultivation.

loans.name: Maria Fidencia

texts.es:
María, de 49 años de edad, no estudio, está casada y tiene 4 hijos. 

María, se dedicaba a la venta de tortillas y a comercializar ropa, pero tuvo que salirse de donde vivía y ahora se dedica al destazo de cerdos, porque en la zona donde vive había poca competencia y el negocio es rentable y cuidar a su madre quien ha tenido una enfermedad desde hace 13 años.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar cerdos para el destazo, porque ella mantiene algunos para venderlos vivos y los que son para destazo los compra ya grandes.

Ella sueña con tener buenos activos para cuando envejezca tener para alguna necesidad o emergencia.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old, married, and has four children. She did not attend school.

She used to sell tortillas and also clothing, but she had to leave the place where she was living. Now her occupation is butchering pigs which she does because there is very little competition where she lives and it is a profitable business. She also cares for her her mother who has been ill for 13 years.

Maria needs the loan so that she can buy pigs for slaughter because she keeps some to sell live, and those that are for butchering are purchased when they are already big.

She dreams of accumulating assets so that when she gets old she will have resources for any necessity or emergency.

loans.use: to buy pigs for butchering.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es: Doña María Luisa es una mujer muy esforzada que solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡1 000 000) para la compra de materiales de construcción necesarios para realizar las reparaciones necesarias en su vivienda. De esta forma logrará mejorar las condiciones de seguridad y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Maria Luisa is a very hardworking woman who is requesting a loan of a million colones (₡1 000 000) to buy the needed building materials to make repairs to her house. In this way, she will be able to improve safety conditions and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials to make repairs to her house.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 41 years old, married and has four children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Remedios has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Julibee

texts.en:
Julibee is 27 years old and married.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Julibee is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins.

Julibee has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Shehu

texts.en:
Shehu is a maize farmer from Kofar Barauki village. As a member of Babban Gona, Shehu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer.

With Babban Gona’s support, he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Shehu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Shehu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Shehu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to start a business.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Baptista

texts.en:
Baptista is a 49 year-old married father of 2 children. He is a teacher and his wife is a housewife. He works hard to support his family. Although the family works very hard, it is not enough for them to support the cost of their son's education.

This loan of $ 1,000 will allow Baptista to help his son's desire to register in the university. He will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks and school supplies.

In the future, Baptista hopes that his children are well-educated and knowledgeable.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks and school supplies.

loans.name: Yenyen

texts.en:
Yenyen is 27 years old, married, and has one child who is still in school.

Yenyen is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Yenyen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 46 years old and single with two children who are currently in school. Amelita works very hard to provide for them.

Amelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and other personal care items.

She has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Amelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods and personal care products.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Juliet works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Juliet is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her business.

Juliet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 55 years old, married and has seven children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

She has been in this business for 4 years now and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Yolanda sigue dedicándose  a la venta de materiales de escritorio, pero su deseo es ampliar su negocio y para ello necesita un capital que le permita diversificar su oferta  a los clientes, ella necesita para la compra de  libros, lapiceros, folderes y demás útiles de escritorio.
La socia es muy trabajadora, emprendedora y sobre todo responsable,  ya que así puede sacar adelante a su familia que depende en gran parte de ella y su creciente negocio.
texts.en:
Group member Yolanda continues to sell writing materials, but she wants to expand her store and for this she needs working capital which will allow her to diversify the products on offer to her customers. Yolanda needs to buy books, pencils, folders and other writing supplies.

This member is very hardworking, enterprising and above all, responsible. She has been able to bring up her family who depend greatly on her and her growing business.

loans.use: to buy books, pencils, folders and other writing supplies

loans.name: Lodith

texts.en:
Lodith is 37 years old and married with four children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles and soap, etc. to sell.

Lodith has been in this business for 10 years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, noodles and soap, etc.

loans.name: Gaymarlou

texts.en:
Gaymarlou is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her local market.

Gaymarlou has been in this business for 13 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her local market.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo, de 54 años de edad, solo estudio hasta segundo grado, está viudo desde hace nueve años y se quedó con dos hijos de seis y dos años de edad.

Reynaldo, se dedicaba a hacer pozos artesanales y pagaba quien cuidara a sus hijos, ahora que están de nueve y diez ellos estudian y él descansa un poco más.- Ahora se dedica a la agricultura y a otros trabajos que se de en la zona rural, para obtener ingresos para  mantener a su familia.

Reynaldo, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono y pesticidas para limpiar sus cultivos.

A futuro desea darles estudio a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y puedan tener una vida diferente con más oportunidades.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 54 years old. He went to school up to the second grade. He has been a widower for nine years and was left with two children, 6 and 2 years of age.

Reynaldo was working doing artesian wells and paying someone to take care of his children. Now they are in school from nine and ten in the morning and he can rest a bit more. Now he is working in agriculture and doing other jobs in the rural area in order to earn the income to support his family.

Reynaldo needs the loan to buy manure and pesticides to prepare the land for planting.

In the future he wishes to be able to provide schooling for his children so that they can become professionals and be able to have a different life with more opportunities.

loans.use: to buy manure and pesticides to prepare the land for planting

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a woman with one child whom in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ruth is 35 years old now.

Ruth has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ruth requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Ruth has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Ruth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Marta Lidia

texts.es:
Marta, de 55 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, estudio hasta sexto grado, pues sus padres le inculcaron que era mejor trabajar, está felizmente casada, su esposo se dedica a la venta de hamacas en diferentes cantones del país y viven solo los dos porque sus hijos ya han formado sus respectivos hogares.

Marta, desde pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en el campo, sin embargo con el pasar de los años fue adquiriendo otras habilidades y fue así como después de haber contraído matrimonio y haber criado a sus hijos, decidió emprender su propio negocio, el cual consiste en la venta de tortillas, este es un alimento básico e indispensable en la dieta de los salvadoreños, para hacer las tortillas le ayudan sus dos hijas y una nuera que desde tempranas horas de la mañana llegan a trabajar.

Marta, necesita el préstamo para compra de insumos para la elaboración de las tortillas, pues ya se acerca la época de la cosecha y quiere aprovechar los precios bajos, para comprar maíz y así tenerlo almacenados en graneros.

Marta, sueña con seguir trabajando y ahorrar para comprar un terreno propio, donde pueda hacer su casa.
texts.en:
Marta is 55 years old and a very hardworking woman. She studied up to Grade 6 because her parents taught her that it was better to work. She is happily married and her husband sells hammocks in different areas of the country. They live alone because their children have already made their own homes for themselves.

Since she was little Marta's parents taught her to work on the land. However, as the years have passed she has picked up other skills and so, after marrying and raising her children, Marta decided to open her own business selling tortillas, a basic yet indispensable part of the Salvadoran diet. Her two daughters and her daughter-in-law come in the early hours of the morning to help her to make tortillas.

Marta needs this loan to buy ingredients to make tortillas. As harvest time is coming up she wants to take advantage of the low prices to buy corn so she could store it in barns.

Marta dreams of continuing to work and save up to buy her own land when she can build a home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make tortillas

loans.name: Gulkayir

texts.en:
Gulkayir is 18 years old freshman in the International and Comparative Politics Program at AUCA. Like almost for everyone, education has a special value for Gulkaiyr in her life. She doesn’t want to lose a chance to get higher education as her elder siblings, so applying to Kiva loan in order to be able to get a good education in the high ranked university of Central Asia.

She has a big family of 8: parents, three elder sisters, herself and two younger brothers. They had a simple life without luxury, even time to time it was really hard to supply a family with food as parents had health problems and weren’t able to work. Gulkayir’s all three sisters are married and now the left three siblings are struggling to be educated. Gulkayir studied well at school, learned English and got good AUCA admission scores, what allowed her to get financial aid.

She says that even left part of tuition fee is a huge sum for her family and she really needs a Kiva loan. Gulkayir believes that great opportunities come to all, but many of people will not be aware of them. She says that a Kiva loan is her great opportunity, as it will let her go to the educated world and be one of its citizens.
Kiva lenders have supported more than 300 students of AUCA during 3 years of collaboration with this university.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education  fees in International and Comparative Politics at the AUCA.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Garba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Garba has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Garba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Garba can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Garba will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Garba is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 28 years old. He is married and blessed with one child. His business is a cyber (Internet) cafe. He has been in the business for 3 years. He earns a monthly income of twenty six thousand Kenya shillings. This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

He will use the loan to purchase another printer for the cyber cafe. He will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for his child. His hopes and dreams are to open other branches of cyber cafes in different places.

loans.use: to purchase another printer for his cyber cafe.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza  is a 37-year-old woman who does domestic work for a living. She engages in food vending business. She sold banana cue(deep fried mid ripe banana with caramelized sugar), ice candy and camote cue( sweet potato,deep fried with caramelized sugar on top).
She is married woman and has five children. Four of which are still attending school. Her husband's way of earning is by being a driver. His income could be a great help to cater the needs of his family. 

Riza has requested a loan to buy more supplies like banana, sweet potato, edible oil, sugar and bamboo skewers. With these, she could have prepared and sold variety of snack foods.  Here income will slowly improve. Enabling her to provide the basic necessities of her family and start to handle her finances wisely.

Riza is hopeful that she could able to improve her livelihood and also continue support the schooling of her children for brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy more supplies  like banana, sweet potato, edible oil, sugar and bamboo skewers

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 46 years old and married with seven children. Gemma works very hard to provide for them.

Gemma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, spices, home product care, and other groceries.

Gemma has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, spices, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: María Amalia

texts.es: María es una confeccionista que desde pequeña descubrió su vocación; sintió gran inclinación por la modistería y aprendió este arte empíricamente, ella dedicaba horas al aprendizaje mediante pequeños proyectos de costura que lograba sacar adelante con el apoyo de revistas que le sugerían distintos cortes, acabados y técnicas.  Estando María casada recibió apoyo de su cónyuge para llevar a cabo su negocio de confecciones en el que lleva 40 años de funcionamiento y es un taller muy tradicional que se encuentra ubicado en un barrio al sur de Barranquilla.  María de 64 años de edad y es una mujer muy activa a pesar de su avanzada edad, ella desea continuar apoyando a su familia con los recursos que le provee su negocio, es por ello que está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para realizarle mantenimiento a sus máquinas y comprar telas de gran demanda para la temporada que se avecina, la cual genera un incremento en sus utilidades.
texts.en: María is a seamstress who discovered her vocation at a young age; she felt a great inclination for fashion design and learned this art empirically. She dedicated hours to learning through small sewing projects that she was able to do with the support of magazines that suggested different cuts, finishes and techniques. Since María is married, she received support from her partner to run her sewing business, which has been functioning for 40 years and is a very traditional workshop located in a neighborhood of southern Barranquilla. María is 64 years old and she is a very active woman in spite of her advanced age. She wants to continue supporting her family with the resources provided by her business. This is why she is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to do maintenance on her machines and to buy fabrics that are in great demand for the coming season, thus generating an increase in her profits.

loans.use: to maintain her machines and to buy fabrics that are in great demand for the coming season

loans.name: Johnson Elvin

texts.es:
Johnson con 25 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge y su menor hijo de 03 años, en el distrito de Pimpingos,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Johnson cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura al cultivo de café, cría-engorde de ganado vacuno, cría de animales menores y cultivo de productos de pan llevar.

Johnson se dedica a la agricultura,al cultivo de café, de variedad Catimor,contando a la fecha con 2 hectáreas,resistente a enfermedades y plagas, plantación está en su segundo año de producción, tiene entre dos y tres años de edad, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 4 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca).El destino del crédito sera para mantenimiento y cultivo de 2 hectáreas de café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida de él y de su familia.

Johnson es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Johnson is 25 years of age, married, and lives in his own house, made of rustic materials, with his wife and his little three-year-old son in Pimpingos district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department in Peru. Johnson can count on very good personal and labor references from residence of the zone. The inhabitants of this locality are, in the majority, involved in agriculture, cultivating coffee, fattening cattle, raising small farm animals, and cultivating cassava and plantains.

Johnson works in agriculture too, cultivating coffee of the Catimor variety. At present, he has two hectares free of plant illnesses and plagues. His plantation is in its second year of production, and it is between two and three years old, and Johnson has some four years of experience in this field. In addition, he raises small farm animals (hens, guinea pigs, and other types) and cultivates products such as cassava and plantains.

The purpose of the loan will be to maintain and cultivate his two hectares of coffee now in production, assuring a good harvest for the 2016 season, reflected in a larger sales volume. As a result, Johnson will earn greater income and, thus, be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Johnson is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to maintain and cultivate two hectares of coffee in production.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es: José de 49 años está soltero,  vive solo en el campo, carece de algunos servicios básicos es muy responsable hace más de 35 años atrás tiene conocimiento de agricultura empezó a trabajar al jornal luego toda esta experiencia forjo en un sembrío de papas  todos los días desde las seis de la mañana cuida sus plantas,  da riego, quita la yerba permitiéndoles crecer y dar fruto para luego ir a venderles al mercado más cercano. El necesita el dinero para comprar abono, calcio, palas, bomba para fumigar  sus cultivos permitiéndole así obtener ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y a futuro desea comprar un terreno propio.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old, and lives alone in the country. He lacks certain basic services. He is very responsible. For more than 35 years he has had farming knowledge. He began to work as a day laborer. Later all his experience merged into a potato crop. He cares for his plants every day from six in the morning. He waters them, and removes the weeds, permitting them to grow and produce fruit, to later sell in the closest market.

He needs the money to buy fertilizer, calcium, shovels, and a pump sprayer to fumigate his crops. This will permit him to obtain income to cover his basic needs. In the future he would like to buy his own land.

loans.use: to buy a pump sprayer for fumigation, shovels, fertilizer and calcium for his crops.

loans.name: Oimer

texts.es:
Oimer con 28 años de edad, de estado civil soltero,vive junto a sus padres, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú, en una zona rural. Oimer cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican básicamente a la agricultura cultivo de café, cría y venta de animales menores (cuyes, gallinas, cerdos) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar.

Oimer se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1,5 hectáreas de variedad Catimor resistente a enfermedades y plagas, plantación está en segundo año de producción,cultivo de café lo realiza en terreno propio, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 04 años. Adicionalmente se dedica a la cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, cerdo) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca) siendo estos tres últimos para su consumo y en ocaciones para la venta. Así mismo trabaja como peón agrícola en los caseríos aledaños.El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento y cultivo de 1 hectárea de café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2016, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por consiguiente obtendrá mayores ingresos para de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Oimer es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Oimer is 28 years old, single and lives with his parents in a rural area of the Santo Tomás district located in the Cutervo province of Cajamarca, Peru. Oimer has very good work and personal references from the locals in the area. The local population work primarily in farming, growing coffee, raising and selling small animals (guinea pigs, chickens and pigs) and growing staple crops.

Oimer works as a farmer growing coffee. At the moment he has 1.5 hectares of the Catimor variety which is resistant to disease and plagues. This is his second year growing this plantation. Oimer grows coffee on his own land and has four years of experience in this field. He also raises small animals (chickens, guineas pigs, and pigs) and grows staple crops (cassava, plantains and the root vegetable vituca) since they are the three latest crops which he eats and occasionally sells. He also works as a labourer for neighbouring hamlets.

This loan will go towards maintaining and growing a hectare of coffee to ensure Oimer has a good crop in the 2016 season. This will be reflected by a high volume of sales and as a consequence he will obtain a higher income and improve his quality of life.

Oimer is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to plow, maintain and cultivate a hectare of coffee to ensure he has a good crop for the 2016 season.

loans.name: Guillermo Angel

texts.es: Guillermo es un hombre trabajador de 70 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en la localidad rural de Ataspaya, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Él se dedica a la agricultura desde hace más de 21 años, poniendo mucha atención en cumplir con prácticas amigables con el medio ambiente para obtener productos orgánicos de calidad. Actualmente gusta de sembrar papa y orégano orgánicos. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar semilla orgánica de papa y abonos orgánicos para poder preparar el terreno agrícola donde planea sembrarla. En el futuro Guillermo desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, pero sobre todo contar con buena salud para acompañar a su esposa por más tiempo, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a hardworking 70 year old man. He lives with his wife in the rural town of Ataspaya, which is in Moquegua. He has worked in agriculture for more than 21 years. He pays a good deal of attention tp complying with practices that are friendly to the environment, in order to obtain organic products of good quality. Currently he is growing potatoes and organic oregano.

He seeks a micro loan to be able to buy organic potato seed and organic fertilizers in order to be able to prepare the agricultural land where he plans to plant. In the future Guillermo wants to better the living conditions of his family, but above all, he wants to stay in good health to accompany his wife longer. This is why he's betting on organic.

loans.use: to buy organic potato seed and organic fertilizers to plant potatoes.

loans.name: José Del Carmen

texts.es: José es un experimentado microempresario residente en Cartagena de Indias, que emprendió su taller de Ornamentaciones motivado por su experiencia en la metalmecánica y soldadura, él laboró en una empresa del sector privado durante treinta años consecutivos y posteriormente decidió independizarse e iniciar su propio taller. José fabrica: puertas, portones, cerramientos, protectores, rejas y estructuras que sus clientes le soliciten a todo costo, por ello debe mantener un stock de productos que le garanticen disponibilidad de materiales al momento de acordar un contrato, es por ello que está  tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que proyecta invertir en hierro, tornillos, bisagras y demás. José está muy comprometido con su negocio que es el generador de recursos para su familia conformada por dos hijos y su cónyuge, a quienes ofrece bienestar con el fruto de su trabajo.  A futuro desea organizarse mejor y continuar apoyando a la familia de sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is an experienced micro-business owner who lives in Cartagena de Indias. His experience in metallurgy and welding motivated him to open his adornments workshop. He worked for a private sector company for thirty consecutive years and later decided to become independent and opened his own workshop.

José makes doors, gates, enclosures, protectors, grilles, and other structures that his customers request. Because of this, he needs to maintain a stock of products that guarantee the availability of materials from the moment a contract is made.

This is why he is applying for his first Credikiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will be able to buy iron, screws, hinges, etc.

José is very committed to his business, which generates income for his family. His family consists of his two children and his wife. He is able to ensure their well-being with the fruits of his labor. For the future he hopes to become better organized and continue to support his family.

loans.use: to buy iron, screws, hinges, etc.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña María es una señora laboriosa, tiene la edad de 59 años, casada, propietaria de una pulpería por más de diez años, con la ayuda de su esposo quien atiende a los clientes, solicita por quinto ciclo el financiamiento en la institución, Uno de sus proyectos es aumentar las ventas con la oferta de productos, por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles y pan. Con las ganancias del crédito anterior compró una vitrina donde exhibe y guarda las prendas, así mismo aumentar la clientela del negocio.
texts.en:
María is a hardworking woman. She is 59 years old, married, and the owner of a corner store for more than ten years. With the help of her spouse who attends to the customers, she seeks a fifth round of financing from the institution.

One of her projects is increasing sales with the offer of products. For that reason she seeks a loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans and bread. With the earnings from her prior loan, she bought a glass case in which she exhibits and safeguards items. In this way she has increased the clientele of her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans and bread.

loans.name: Fernanda Marisol

texts.es: Marisol optimista y trabajadora tiene 26 años esta soltera, vive con sus padres que trabajan como jornaleros en el campo y 3 hermanos Jose de 15, Juan de 13, Carlos de 10,  ella les aporta económicamente para que sigan estudiando en unidades educativas del sector. Marisol empezó su negocio hace seis años atrás un pequeño salón de belleza en el campo  un lugar alejado de la ciudad donde este servicio es necesario. Ella requiere el dinero para poder comprar espejos, sillas, maquinaria de belleza facilitando su servicio obteniendo mayores ingresos ayudando a cubrir los gastos del hogar ya que el dinero en la familia es muy escaso.
texts.en:
Marisol is an optimistic and hardworking 26 year old. She is single and lives with her parents, who work as day laborers in the country, and her 3 brothers: Jose who is 15, Juan who is 13, and Carlos who is 10. She supports them economically so they can continue studying at the education entities in their sector.

Marisol began her business six years ago. It is a small beauty salon in the country, in a place far from the city where such a service is necessary. She needs the money to be able to buy mirrors, chairs, and equipment for the salon, to facilitate her services, obtain greater income, and help cover the household expenses, since money in her family is scarce.

loans.use: to buy equipment and furniture for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Yajayda

texts.es:
La socia Yajayda sigue siendo docente de un colegio, sus horarios laborales le permiten ejercer otras actividades, por eso quiere aprovechar sus ratos libres y las vacaciones escolares para dedicarse a un negocio de temporada navideña que le permita obtener mas ingresos de los que ella posee y así conseguir sus sueños que es abrir un colegio, ya que su pasión es enseñar. Ella necesita capital para comprar ropa, juguetes y adornos navideños, que necesitara para estas épocas de fin de año.
Yajayda está contenta y satisfecha por el préstamo que se le dará por así está avanzando a su gran meta que es abrir su propio colegio, ella como docente es muy responsable y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Yajayda is still a high school teacher; her work hours allow her to do other activities. For this reason she wants to take advantage of her free time and the school holidays to dedicate herself to a Christmas-season business that will allow her to earn more income than she does. In this way she will be able to achieve her dream, which is to open a high school, since her passion is teaching. She needs capital to buy clothing, toys and Christmas ornaments, which she will need for the holiday season at the end of the year. 

Yajayda is happy and satisfied with the loan she will be given, since this is how she will reach her great goal of opening her own high school. As a teacher, she is very responsible and promises to make her payments in a punctual manner.

loans.use: to buy clothing, toys and Christmas ornaments

loans.name: Grupo Las Cerezas Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Las Cerezas está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, coordinado por Ada de 41 años de edad, Madre soltera de dos hijos  de 11 y 2 años quienes son su mayor motivación para salir adelante, ella se dedica la venta de cosméticos y ropa interior desde hace siete años, una de sus metas esseguir creciendo, por esta razón solicita por quinta vez el crédito para la compra de maquillaje, labiales, perfumes y crema. Con los créditos anteriores logro la compra de una mantenedora y una cocina, la segunda socia es María de 55 años quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes, la tercer socia es Melba de 47 años quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes y ropa.
texts.en:
The solidarity group “Las Cerezas” (The Cherries) consists of three business women, and is coordinated by Ada. Ada is a 41 year old single mother of two children, ages 11 and 2, who are her main motivation to succeed. She has been engaged in the business of selling cosmetics and lingerie for seven years. One of her goals is to continue growing, and therefore she is asking a fifth loan to buy makeup, lipstick, perfume and creams. With her previous loans she was able to buy a refrigerator and a kitchen.

The second group member is Mary, who is 55 years old and sells perfume. The third group member is Melba, who is 47 years old and sells perfume and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase makeup, lipstick, fragrances and creams.

loans.name: Luis Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer tiene 40 años, está soltero, vive en el campo con sus padres de avanzada edad es su responsabilidad  cuidarlos, empezó su vida de agricultor a los doce años, siembra papas, habas, cebada,   su pasión por el trabajo fue convertida en una fuente de ingresos que le ayudado a pagar alimentación y las medicinas de sus padres. Wilmer requiere el dinero para comprar calcio y abono mejorando el  crecimiento de sus plantas, aumentando su producción, obteniendo mayores ganancias para poder seguir costeando los gastos de él y sus padres.
texts.en:
Wilmer is 40 years old, single and lives in the country with his elderly parents. It is his responsibility to take care of them. He began his life as a farmer at 12 years old growing potatoes, beans and barley. His passion for his work turned into a source of income which helped him to pay for food and medicine for his parents.

Wilmer needs a loan to buy calcium and fertiliser to improve his plants' growth, increase his production and obtain a higher income to continue paying for his and his parents' bills.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser and calcium to plant crops.

loans.name: Grupo R De La Soledad Group

texts.es:
En la comunidad donde viven los integrantes del grupo las principales actividades económicas son el comercio, la crianza de animales y el cultivo de productos como maíz, fríjol, haba y avena. 
Martín es el más joven de la asociación, apenas cuenta con 20 años, pero ya tiene 2 años de experiencia manejando su propio negocio de venta de dulces. A pesar de ser originario de un lugar muy pacífico, está muy acostumbrado a vender en la ciudad más grande del mundo. En la vía pública, justo a la salida de una estación de metro, se puede ver a Martín de lunes a viernes en un pequeño puesto donde exhibe paletas, chicles, gomitas, entre otros. “Me gusta el movimiento del DF, además se vende mejor” comenta el joven quien únicamente regresa a casa los fines de semana. 
Los dos días que permanece en casa, Martín aprovecha para disfrutar no sólo de sus padres sino de sus dos pequeños hermanos quienes todavía están cursando la primaria y a quiénes apoya con algunos gastos. 
Afortunadamente la época de lluvias en la Ciudad de México está por terminar, temporada en la cual Martín tiene más dificultades para recuperar su inversión y es por eso que quiere aprovechar para solicitar un préstamo y comprar más dulces. Poco a poco, este joven responsable se prepara para hacer sus sueños realidad y es que en un futuro no muy lejano, le gustaría ser dueño de un local y vender otros productos en mayor volumen. 
Los demás integrantes son María Guadalupe, Angelina y Ma Concepción quienes invertirán en borregos y Alfredo en su tienda de abarrotes. 

*E nla imagen aparecen todos los integrantes del grupo en la plaza central del municipio donde viven. Martín es el más joven y viste una sudadera gris.
texts.en:
In the community where the members of the group live, the main jobs are commerce, raising animals, and cultivating crops such as corn, beans, and oats.

Martín is the youngest of the association, he is just 20 years old, but he already has two years of experience managing his own business of selling candy.  Despite being from a very calm area, he is comfortable selling in one of the biggest cities in the world.  On the street, just off of the exit from the metro station, you can see Martín Monday through Friday in a small stall where he shows off ice pops, chewing gum, jelly beans, among other things.  "I like the movement of the Federal District, also one can sell better," says the young man who only returns home on the weekend.  

The two days that he is at home, Martín takes advantage not only of enjoying his parents but also of his two younger sister who are still in elementary school and whom he supports with the some of the costs.

Fortunately, the rainy season in Mexico City is about to end, the season in which Martín has the most difficulty recuperating his investments, and that is why he wants to take advantage of requesting a loan to buy more sweets.  Little by little, this young, responsible man prepares to make his dreams a reality, and, in the near future, he would like to be an owner of a shop and sell other products in bigger volume.   

The other members are María Guadalupe, Angelina, and Ma Concepción who invest in sheep, and Alfredo who has a grocery store.

*In the image appear all of the members of the group in the central plaza in the town where they live.  Martín is the youngest and is wearing a gray sweatshirt.

loans.use: To buy more candy.

location.town: Ejido la Soledad, San Jose del Rincon

loans.name: Farzana Bibi

texts.en:
Farzana bibi is the age of 35, living with her husband in Multan,Pakistan. Her husband is a catering services provider for ceremonies and has a 20 years long work experience. He provides the decoration lights, wedding tents for weddings, birthday and engagement ceremonies. Her husband doesn't considers it a very profitable business because this is a seasonal. Now the marriage season is going to its peak but his tents have worn out due to lack of usage for a long time. He wants to buy new wedding tents to provide the better services to his customers.

Therefore, she has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new tents and decoration lights to provide the decoration services.
Farzana bibi thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's catering business.

loans.name: Firdous Bibi

texts.en:
Firdous Bibi is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is 42 years old woman. She lives with her three children and husband in Multan, Pakistan. Her son has been running a mobile phone shop for the past two years. He sells new mobiles, mobiles accessories; such as chargers, batteries, hand-frees, blue tooth devices, etc in his shop. Due to his good service, he has built up very good relation with his customers.

Therefore Firdous Bibi requested for a loan, so that her son would be able to buy more stock of new mobiles as well as accessories such as batteries, chargers, hand-frees, blue tooth devices for increase his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Firdous Bibi has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan her son would be able to purchase the relevant items so that he can earn more profitable income
Firdous Bibi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones for her son's shop	.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is 48 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Gaudiosa works very hard to provide for them.

Gaudiosa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries. Gaudiosa has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Gaudiosa would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
The stiff competition in the variety store business forces many store owners to find alternative sources of income. Marichu, 49, from Fatima, General Santos City, South Cotabato runs a variety store that sells toiletries, repacked condiments, snack items, canned goods, eggs, and many other items. She finds extra income from load retailing or e-loading for cellphones. This business is very popular now in the Philippines, because most cellphone owners use a prepaid plan and only a few subscribe to a postpaid plan. In a prepaid arrangement, a person can budget his load usage because he can buy as little as a 10-peso load. It is indeed a good business to combine with a variety store. Basically Marichu’s income helps provide for her family’s daily needs. But her forward-looking mindset drives her to improve her business in order to save better for her children’s education.

Marichu would like to obtain additional capital worth PHP 50,000 that she can use to buy more products for her store and a load wallet for cellphone e-loading. The earnings that she can derive from this will add up to the regular wage of her husband, Martin, a merchandiser. Furthermore, the couple plans to invest in a motorcycle for rent to increase the family's resources. They aim to continually provide for the needs of their family and the schooling of their two children in college and high school. Both of them want to see their children finish their college degrees and acquire stable jobs someday.

Marichu gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their lives and businesses and draw strength from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store and a load wallet for cellphone e-loading.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is a married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jonah is 48 years old.

Jonah has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Jonah requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Jonah has been in this business for five years. In the future, Jonah would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Andy Steveen

texts.es: Andy tiene 20 años de edad, tiene un hijo, el pequeño Bryan de un años de edad, Andy es de estado civil soltero, es un padre responsable pues trabaja muy duro para darle lo necesario a su niño. Se dedica a la compra y venta de papas, tiene como experiencia en este duro trabajo desde sus doce años, solicita el crédito para la compra y venta de papas y así obtener ganancias para seguir cumpliendo con su responsabilidad de padre.
texts.en:
Andy is 20 years old.  He has a son; little Bryan is one year old.  Andy is single.  He is a responsible father, and he works very hard to give what is necessary to his son.  He works buying and selling potatoes.  He has had experience in this tough job since he was 12 years old.  

He is requesting the loan to buy and sell potatoes and thus obtain earnings to continue fulfilling his responsibilities as a father.

loans.use: To buy and sell potatoes.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Fedelina works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Fedelina is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business. Fedelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money in order to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 38 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by poultry in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens.

Teresita has been poultry for 6 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Severina is 55 years old now.

Severina has a fruits vending business in the Philippines. Severina requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fruits to sell.

Severina has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Severina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy variety of fruits to sell

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 40 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan and she is the mother of 4 children. Razia has been doing her business of cloth selling for past 20 years and contributes her income with her husband to manage the house hold.

Razia needs to buy different types of cloth for reselling purpose but due to insufficient financial means she is not in the position to buy this cloth. She has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she can purchase the clothes easily, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

On this financial assistance Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her cloth business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married woman with three children; one child is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lolita is 59 years old.

Lolita has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients, such as meat and spices.

Lolita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as meat and spices

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Elena tiene 30 años, esta casada su esposo es jornalero, tiene tres hijos Jessica de 11, Wladimir de 10 años de edad ellos estudian en una escuela del sector, Fernando tiene 4 años  de edad está enfermo en constante tratamiento, permanece junto a su madre, Viven en el campo no tienen casa propia carecen de algunos servicios básicos, Elena hace 12 años atrás compra terneros recién nacidos los alimenta, cuida cuando crecen los vende obteniendo ingresos para ayudar a solventar los gastos del hogar. Ella necesita el dinero para comprar dos terneros, sal, alimento los vendería luego que crezcan así obtendría ingresos para poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de alimentación, salud y educación de sus pequeños.
texts.en:
Elena is 30 years old.  She is married; her husband is a day workers.  She has three children Jessica is 11 and Wladimir is 10; they study in a school in the town.  Fernando is 4 years old; he is constantly sick and stays with his mother.  They live in the country.  They do have have their own house and they lack some basic services.

Twelve years ago, Elena bought recently born calves.  She feeds them and cares for them.  When they grow, she sells them, obtaining income to help meet the costs of the home.

She is requesting the loan to buy two calves, salt, and food.  She will sell them once they have grown to obtain income to be able to help her husband with the costs of food, health, and education of their little ones.

loans.use: To buy two recently born calves, food, and salt.

loans.name: Georgete

texts.en:
Georgete is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Georgete is 54 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Georgete has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines. Georgete requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell like eggplant, beans and squash.

Georgete has been in this business for 12 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell like egg plant, beans and squash

loans.name: Nancy Maria

texts.es: Nancy  tiene 31 años, esta soltera vive con su madre de avanzada edad, se dedica a la crianza de pollos hace 15 años atrás este pequeño negocio ha sido la base de subsistencia de ella y su madre, compra pollos pequeños los cuida,alimenta luego los vende en su barrio para el consumo por libras. Nancy requiere el dinero para comprar pollos, alimento y vitaminas conseguiría más ingresos para cubrir los gastos de alimentación y alquiler de vivienda de  su madre y  ella,  a futuro  quiere ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nancy is 31 years old, single, and lives with her elderly mother.

Her occupation is raising chickens. She started this small business 15 years ago, and it has been the source of her and her mother's survival. She buys young chicks, cares for and feeds them, then she sells them for eating by the pound in her neighborhood.

Nancy needs the money so she can buy chickens, feed, and vitamins. This will enable her to earn more income to cover the costs of food and housing for her and her mother. In the future she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Mercy Omaira

texts.es: Mercy tiene 32 años de edad, ella esa madre soltera, tiene tres hijos Juan Carlos de 11 años,Cristian de 9 años y Fernando de 7 años, para sacar adelante a sus tres niños ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, Mercy vive en el sector rural, por este motivo solicita el dinero del crédito para invertirlos en la compra de pollos pequeños, la aspiración de Mercy es seguir apoyándoles con el estudio a sus hijos y seguir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en: Mercy, 32, is a single mother of three sons: Juan Carlos, 11, Cristian, 9, and Fernando, 7. In order to provide for her three sons, she works raising and selling chickens. Mercy lives in a rural area. For this reason, she is requesting the loan to invest the money in buying chicks.  Mercy aspires to continue supporting her children's schooling and succeed with her business.

loans.use: to buy and sell chickens.

loans.name: Anshar

texts.en:
Anshar is a 27-year-old lady and a responsible mother of one son. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own auto repair business for past 10 years. Anshar's husband needs to purchase tools, spare parts, machinery, etc. for his business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase these merchandises. 

To fulfill the need of her husband, Anshar has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband buy this merchandise for business purpose. That will be good for him to earn more income, and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs.

Anshar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for her husband's auto repair shop.

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Alhaji has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Alhaji can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Alhaji is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a better house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 30 years old woman, and mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is fruit seller by profession and sells fruits like apples, bananas, grapes etc.

Nasreen's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purpose so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position her husband is not in condition to purchase them.

Therefore Nasreen has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruits her husband for fruit mandi.

loans.name: Midhat

texts.en:
Midhat is a 40-year-old married man from Rafah city, located in the Gaza Strip. His father works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. However, Midhat wants to improve his family standard of living help them live more comfortably.
 
Midhat took a USD loan from FATEN in order to buy water  solar system for heating water for the family house. By taking this loan, Midhat will be able heat water more efficiently, enable the family to take warm showers, while also decreasing the electricity expenses.
 
Midhat appears in the photo.

loans.use: in order to buy water  solar system for heating water for the family house.

loans.name: Marmyl Joy

texts.en:
Marmyl Joy  is a 30-year-old woman with two children. Two years ago,  she started selling snack food like banana cue (deep-fried mid ripe banana with caramelized sugar), ice candy and bread, to help her partner in covering the needs and expenses of their children. 

She has requested a loan to buy more ingredients like banana, edible oil, sugar, and ice  flavored juices. With these, she could  able to prepare more variety of snack food to be sold.  With these, she could attract more customers and continue support the needs of her growing children. Slowly, her income will improve and start to expand.


Marmyl Joy is determined that someday she could able to open up a restaurant to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like banana, edible oil, sugar,  and ice  flavored juices

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зульфия, 27 лет, не замужем, детей нет, живет с родителями. Зульфия ответственная и трудолюбивая. Образование среднее, на протяжении 5 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Зульфии, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется корова с теленком. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зульфия обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетели. Зульфия планирует доходы от кредита вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на улучшение жилищных условий ее семьи.
texts.en: Zulfiya is 27 years old and unmarried. She does not have any children and lives with her parents. Zulfiya is responsible and hardworking. She has a secondary education. For the past 5 years she has been practicing agriculture. Thanks to Zulfiya's hard work, she currently has one cow and a calf on her farm For the further development of her business, Zulfiya turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a heifer. Zulfiya plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business so that she can save money to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy one heifer to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en:
Leonita is a resident in the town of Maribojoc, Bohol. She earns a living by engaging in preparing snack food. She sold hotcake and bud-bud (sticky or glutinous) rice, mixed with coconut milk, sugar and a bit of salt. 
She is 40-years old married woman and has two children, and still attending school.  Her husband is a carpenter. 
She would like to improve her livelihood by acquiring additional funds to finance her current source of living.


Leonita  has requested a loan to buy ingredients to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, glutinous rice and edible oil. These are vital in her day to day livelihood activity. These could help boost her income and continue improve to become productive. Thus, she could able to support her family and continue finance the schooling of her children.

With her previous loan, she has successfully repaid , and now she would like to continue expand her business to become progressive.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, glutinous rice and edible oil

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан, 62 года, замужем, мать 3 детей, есть 2 внука. Бурулкан ответственная, жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая. Образование среднее, она на пенсии, с 1973 года занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Бурулкан, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 3 коровы и 10 овец. Выращивает ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Прибыль от ведения бизнеса составляет 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурулкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы. Бурулкан планирует доходы от кредита вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на постройку дома для ее семьи.
texts.en: Burulkan is 62 years old and married. She is a mother to three children and a grandmother to two grandsons. Burulkan is responsible, joyful and hardworking. She has a secondary education and is retired. Since 1973, she has practiced agriculture. Thanks to Burulkan's hard work, she currently has 3 cows and 10 sheep on her farm. She also grows barley for use on her farm and for sale. The income from this business is 10,000 som (KGS) per month. For the further development of her business, Burulkan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow. Burulkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business so that she can save money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy one cow to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Joey

texts.en:
Joey is a native from the town of Dauis, Bohol. He owns a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities ranging from biscuits to edible oil, coffee, sugar, canned goods, soap and liquor. 

He is a 30-year-old married man and has two school-aged children. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, he has operated a sari-sari (variety) store, serving neighbors in his place. 

Joey decided to join CEVI to access loans and boost his business. With the 3,000 PHP, he wants to buy groceries, food and drinks. These are vital in running his business. He will have more to display and adequate supplies of stocks. In that way, he can accommodate most of his customers' orders. Thus, he can now handle his finances wisely and provide the needs of his family too. 

He dreams of expanding his business to become more sustainable in the years to come.

loans.use: to buy groceries, food and drinks.

loans.name: Yahuza

texts.en:
Yahuza is a Babban Gona farmer.  Yahuza is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Yahuza would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. 

With this loan Yahuza can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Yahuza has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

 Yahuza is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to repair his house or move into a bigger home and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz is responsible mother of 4 children.and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for twenty years. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Gulnaz has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Gulnaz's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Gulnaz also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Gulnaz is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley continúa con su negocio de venta de comida típica. El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizo comprando un refrigerador, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual. Actualmente su negocio funciona todos los días de la semana, los clientes se vuelven más continuos y las ventas mejoran porque cuenta con alimentos frescos, su próxima meta es comprar mobiliario para vender comida en la puerta de su casa, “voy mejorando la cocina y tengo nuevos clientes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que tiene nuevos y más clientes, la desventaja es la falta de muebles para atenderlos. Su sueño es tener un restaurante, ella desea comprar mesas y sillas plásticas para vender comida en la puerta de su casa. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en dos años que viene realizando este negocio. 
Es por esos motivos que Shirley solicita un préstamo para comprar mesas y sillas para vender comida en la puerta de su casa.
texts.en:
Shirley continues her business of selling typical food.  She used the last loan that she obtained to buy a refrigerator.  The payment of the loan was punctual.  Now her business is open everyday of the week.  The customers return more often and the sales improve on account of the fresh foods.  Her next goal to to buy furniture to sell food from the door of her house.  "I continue to improve the kitchen and I have new customers," she says.
