The advantage of her business is that she has new and more customers.  The disadvantage is that she doesn't have the furniture to attend to them.  Her goal is to have a restaurant.  She wants to buy tables and plastic chair to sell food from the door of her house.  This is the 2nd sequence of loans with the institution in the two years that she has had this business.

It is for these reasons that Shirley is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs to sell food from the door of her house.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs to sell food from the door of her house.

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.ru: Мухабат 37 летняя женщина. Она замуж за дехканина. Мухабат имеет большое поле. На поле она выращивает скота. Мухат идет по стопам отца 8 лет. Она любить доить коров и обеспечить семью с молочными продуктами. У Мухабат была мечта построить дом во дворе. Вот и она построила желаемый дом. Только осталось построить крышу, сделать штукатурку и покрасить дверей и окон.  Ей не хватала денег для купли стройматериалы. Из-за нехватки средств Мухабат просит кредит. Ей очень нужно Ваша поддержка. Ваша поддержка поможет ей завершить ремонт.
texts.en: Muhabat is a 37-year-old woman. She is married to a farmer. Muhabat has a large field on which she raises cattle. Muhabat has followed in her father's footsteps for the past 8 years. She loves to milk cows and provide her family with dairy products. Muhabat has a dream to build a house on her yard so she built her desired home. The only things left are to build the roof, finish up the plaster and paint the doors and windows. She does not have enough money to buy building materials. Due to the shortage of funds, Muhabat is requesting a loan. She really needs your support. Your support will help her complete her repairs.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Honestidad Group

texts.es:
Existe una comunidad veracruzana conocida como “la novia del sol” ya que los poetas deducen que sus elevadas temperaturas se deben a una relación amorosa con el sol. En dicha región se formó un grupo para solicitar apoyos con VFMéxico cuyos integrantes decidieron  nombrarlo Honestidad debido a que es uno de los valores primordiales para el ser humano. 
   Actualmente el grupo lo integran: Francisca quien vende tacos y artesanías; Irma, queso; Sofía, cosméticos, carne y tamales; Patricia, cosméticos; Angélica, postres y Sessy, ropa y calzado. 
   Doña Irma es una mujer comprometida con su familia y con su actividad económica. Desde hace más de seis años decidió emplear su tiempo en algo productivo lo que la llevó a dedicarse a la cría y venta de cerdos. No obstante para obtener mejores ganancias optó por vender queso de casa en casa, motivada por su esposo y su hijo quienes decidieron apoyar directamente a dicha actividad. Hoy en día la familia se encuentra muy feliz pues no sólo es un medio para obtener ingresos sino que es una forma de unirlos de manera especial.
   Todos los días, desde muy temprano, inician con el proceso de elaboración de queso; cada producto conlleva una preparación diferente pero todos contienen el mismo toque de amor con que los realizan. Cabe mencionar que cada queso tiene un tiempo estimado de elaboración por lo que la organización es muy importante. “Además de ser un negocio familiar otorgamos empleo a cuatro jóvenes quienes se encargan de distribuir la mercancía a bordo de una motocicleta en diferentes comunidades” expresó contenta Irma. Las ganancias le han permitido remodelar su casa, ampliar el espacio de trabajo y, en fin, cumplir con cada una de sus responsabilidades.  
   Por otro lado, se siente orgullosa con el avance y resultado de su dedicación y la de su familia quienes han sido favorecidos  con los préstamos que VFMéxico otorga. Su inversión recae en la compra de  leche, cuajo, calcio, sal, bolsas, tanques y gas.
   Finalmente, las palabras de los integrantes fueron que “Dios bendiga a cada una de las personas que hacen posible realizar nuestros sueños”.
*Ellas son el grupo Honestidad; la fotografía fue tomada  en “La novia del sol”, doña Irma es quien viste playera negra y pantalón azul.
texts.en:
There is a Veracruz community known as "bride of the sun" since the poets deduced that its elevated temperatures were due to a love affair with the sun. In this region, a group was formed to request loans through VFMexico. The members of this group decided to name themselves "Honestidad" [Honesty], since honesty is one of the core values for human beings.

Currently, the group is made up of: Francisca, who sells tacos and crafts; Irma, who sells cheese; Sofia, who sells cosmetics, meat, and tamales; Patricia, who sells cosmetics; Angelica, who sells desserts; and Sessy, who sells clothes and shoes.

Irma is a woman committed to her family and their financial situation. More than six years ago, she decided to use her time in something productive, which led her to the raising and selling of pigs. However, in order to obtain better profits, she opted to sell cheese door-to-door. She was motivated by her husband and son who decided to help directly with this occupation. Today, the family is very happy because not only is this a means of obtaining income, but also a way to unite them in a special way.

Every day, from very early, they begin the process of making cheese. Each product requires a different preparation, but all contain the same touch of love that made them. It is worth mentioning that each cheese has a different estimated production time, and as a result organization is very important. "In addition to being a family business, we can provide employment to four young people who are in charge of distributing the merchandise by motorcycle in different communities," a satisfied Irma expressed. The profits have enabled them to remodel their home, expand their work space, and finally, meet every one of their responsibilities.

On the other hand, she is proud of the progress and the result of her dedication and that of her family. They have been fortunate with the loans provided by VFMexico. Their investment is in the purchase of milk, rennet, calcium, salt, bags, tanks, and gas.

Finally, the words of the members were: "God bless every person who makes it possible to achieve our dreams."

*The women in the picture form the group Honestidad. The photograph was taken in "the bride of the sun". Irma is wearing a black shirt and blue pants.

loans.use: to buy milk, rennet, calcium, salt, bags, tanks, and gas.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 33 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 12 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable business and family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 34 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. His business is motorcycle taxi and farming. He has been in the business for 12 years. He earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings.

This is his third term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his farming business.He will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for his child.

His hopes and dreams are have a better business and a health, educated family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his farming business.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 41 years old. She is married and blessed with 6 children. She does farming and livestock keeping selling milk and cash crops, a business she has been doing 20 years. 

This is her 4th loan term with VisionFund Kenya and has paid her previous loan amounts successfully. She will use the loan to buy animal feeds so as to get more milk for sell and make more income to pay school fees for her children. 

She will use the generated profits to buy more farm inputs and grow more cash crops for sell. Her future hopes and dreams are to have more dairy cows and grow more cash crops for sell and have a successful business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds so as to get more milk for sale and have income to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is 36 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. Her business is farming and livestock keeping. She has been in the business for 20 years. She earns a monthly income of twenty thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy animal feeds and farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer.

She will use the profits from expanded business to service the loan and increase her savings. Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business and be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds and farm inputs of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en:
Sadia is a 37-year-old lady and a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own school for past 12 years. Sadia's husband needs to purchase different types of merchandise (e.g. chairs, tables, and other accessories, etc.) for his business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to purchase this merchandise. 

To fulfill the need of her husband, Sadia has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will help her husband buy this merchandise for business purpose. That will be good for him to earn more income, and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs.

Sadia is very Thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her husband's school.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 61 years old and married with nine children. Norma works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care and other groceries.

Norma has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Norma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: This zeinab's second loan from Kiva. She, previously, requested 1000 EGP and successfully repaid it on due dates. She used the loan to buy birds such as chickens ducks and geese to start the project. She says' This 1000 EGP loan changed my life, now I have a source of income; I started to have hopes and dreams that I could not have imagined before getting the loan''. She is requesting 2000 EGP loan to expand her project.

loans.use: to buy birds such as chicken, ducks, and geese.

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en:
Majeedan is 39 years old woman, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her 5 children.
Majeedan is also providing sewing services and earn the income to contribute with her husband to manage the house hold. She is needs different kinds of goods e.g needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil etc for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories.

Therefore she has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Majeedan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her tailoring business.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 61 years old. He is married and blessed with three children. His business is farming. He has been in the business for 11 years. He earns a monthly income of fifty thousand Kenya shillings.

This is his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to plant in October season. He will use the profits from expanded business to educate his children.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his farm and improve his farming skills.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for use on his farm.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 40 years old. She is single and blessed with four children. Her business is retail shop. She has been in the business for five years. She earns a monthly income of nine thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of sugar, soap, milk, bread, maize flour, matches, etc. for sale.

She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children and meet family basic needs. Her hopes and dreams are to make her family’s future bright.

loans.use: to buy stock of sugar, soap, milk, bread, maize flour, matches, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.en:
Pascaline is 46 years old. She is married and blessed with 3 children. She sells cereals and also does farming. She has been in the business for 10 years and it has been profitable. This is her 4th loan term with VisionFund Kenya and has successfully paid her previous loans.

She will use the loan to buy stock of maize, beans, cow peas, green grams and beans and hopes this will enable her to sell to more customers and get more income. She will use the generated profits to buy more stock of cereals for sell. Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her business and open another grocery store and become a major supplier of cereals in the area.

loans.use: to buy stock of maize, beans, cow peas, green grams and beans and hopes this will enable her to sell to more customers and get more income.

loans.name: Williams Alexander

texts.es:
Willians, de 29 años de edad, está soltero, estudio hasta bachillerato y vive solo en su casa.

Willians, trabaja como promotor de alfabetización desde hace 7 años, pero además de eso también trabaja en la agricultura.

Willians, necesita el préstamo para comprar 1 vaca, abono y pesticidas para la milpa.

El sueño de Willians, es seguir trabajando para hacer una casa de ladrillo, porque la que tiene ahorita es de bahareque, también quiere mejorar sus ingresos para ahorrar.
texts.en:
Williams is 29 years old, he is single, he studied through high school, and he lives alone in his house. Williams has worked as a literacy developer for seven years, but in addition to this, he also works in agriculture.

Williams is requesting a loan to buy one cow, fertilizer, and pesticides for the cornfield. Williams' dream is to keep working in order to build a brick house because the one he has now is made of mud and wood. He also wants to improve his earnings in order to save.

loans.use: to buy one cow, fertilizer, and pesticides for the cornfield.

loans.name: Ana Angélica

texts.es: Ana es habitante de Arjona  un municipio de Bolívar en donde reside con su pequeño hijo de siete años de edad, ella es una mujer emprendedora y capaz de sobreponerse a las adversidades de la vida, y con su carácter valeroso llevó a cabo su propio negocio de artesanías, oficio que aprendió en el seno de su hogar materno, puesto que la elaboración de artesanías es una tradición para su familia.  Ana se dedica exclusivamente elabora bisutería; collares, pulseras y aretes en diversas piedras, entre ellas concha de nácar, canutillo, perlas, cristal de murano y madera, las cuales adquiere en almacenes especializados ubicados en el mercado de Bazurto en Cartagena de Indias. Ana ha logrado sostener sus gastos en el hogar y los de su hijo con su negocio y al no contar con un cónyuge que la respalde, su compromiso es inmenso pues de este depende su ingreso, es por ello que diariamente promueve ventas entre sus conocidos; amigos, vecinos, compañeros de estudio y de trabajo, ofreciéndoles directamente los accesorio o masivamente por las redes sociales. Alterno a su actividad principal, Ana labora en un hotel por turnos lo que hace que su ingreso sea mucho mayor.  En la actualidad está  tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que proyecta invertir en pedrería, herrajes y nylon, con la finalidad de tener una amplia variedad y ahorrar en desplazamientos.  Su meta de negocio es tener una marca reconocida y patentadas,  y en lo personal desea terminar su carrera profesional y garantizarle una excelente educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ana lives in Arjona, a municipality of Bolívar, with her seven-year-old little boy. She is an enterprising woman who is capable of overcoming adversity in life. With her courageous spirit, she started her own small handicrafts business. She learned this trade in her mother's home, since making handicrafts is a family tradition.

Ana specializes in making fashion jewelry. She crafts necklaces, bracelets, and earrings from a variety of materials, including mother-of-pearl, bugle beads, pearls, Murano glass, and wood. She acquires the materials from specialized stores located in the Bazurto market in Cartagena de Indias.

Through her business, Ana has been able to cover the expenses of her household and child. Since she does not have a spouse to support her and her income depends on her business, her commitment to it is very strong. That is why she promotes sales on a daily basis among her acquaintances: friends, neighbors, classmates, and colleagues. She offers the accessories directly to individuals or publicizes them on social media. Besides her primary business, Ana also works shifts in a hotel, which makes her income much higher.

Ana is currently applying for her first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to invest the funds in stones, nylon, and metal jewelry components. She wants to have a wide variety and save some trips. Her business goal is to have a recognized, trademarked brand. A personal goal is to finish her professional degree and guarantee her son an excellent education.

loans.use: to invest in stones, nylon, and metal jewelry components.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Kenneth, 31 years old, married and father of 2 children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2012.

He does livestock selling business. He has benefited much from hand in hand eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management that has helped him in budgeting and record keeping. He is borrowing from Kiva to buy more goats for sale. This will boost his income that will go a long way in ensuring he caters for the family needs with ease.
He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more goats for sale thus more income.

loans.name: Umoja Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Zipporah, a member of Umoja Women Group. She is 41 years old, married and has five children. 

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management. 

Her economic activity is selling vegetables. She is borrowing from Kiva to add stocks to her vegetable business. This will increase her level of income, thus be in a position to cater to family's basic needs.

Zipporah is grateful to Kiva and it's lenders for the support, and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of vegetables that will boost her business, thus have more income.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok and wife (both in the picture, standing in front of their house) work as farmers living in Kampong Basrov Village. Sok's wife sells some snack to kids around this area. Everyday Sok needs to get up early to do farming while his wife prepares snacks to sell. They need a reliable power source to run a business and also for family usage.

However, their current energy is not reliable. Sometime the battery runs out without notice. He has no choice but to stay in pitch black for 1 night until morning, which disturbs not only his living lifestyle but also his business.

Therefore, he is applying for a Kiva loan to buy a solar home system for his business’s energy usage and also his family usage. With solar home systems, he doesn’t have to be concerned about sudden power loss anymore.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Kampong Basrov Village, Chhulsa Commune, Chhulkiri

loans.name: El Porvenir De Huyro Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal EL PORVENIR DE HUYRO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huayopata , provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Doris    alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose al negocio de restaurante, la socia  tiene 53 años de edad  es soltera  y tiene 5 hijos, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de eta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros.
Los socios en generala agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
The member Doris belongs to the communal bank "El Porvenir de Huyro" (The Future of Huyro).  The bank is located in the district of Huayopata, province of La Convención, in the department of Cusco.

Doris runs a restaurant.  She is 53 years old, she is single, and she has five children.  Doris gets along well in her business which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  She wants to be able to continue working so that in this ways she continues to support her family.

Doris is requesting the loan to buy stock such as rice, sugar, and milk among other things.

The members are grateful for the loan granted to them and promise to fulfill the payments.

The person with the blanked out face does not belong to the communal bank.

loans.use: To buy stock such as rice, sugar, and milk among other things.

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
Marialyn is 44 years old and has six children. Marialyn is married and has six children currently in school.

Marialyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Marialyn requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Marialyn has been in this business for 10 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marialyn would like to save enough money so she cam afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rhea is 29 years old and has one child in school.

Rhea has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rhea requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Rhea has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Rhea would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Dilma Yolanda

texts.es: Dilma tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, ella es madre de 3 hijos, una niña, Carla de 3 años de edad, y dos niño, Luis de 5 y Rodrigo de 8 años,gracias al duro trabajo de su madre pueden estudiar. Dilma vive en el sector rural y comenta que sus ingresos los obtiene de la crianza y venta de chanchos, Dilma va a invertir el crédito en la compra de mas chanchos,para incrementar su negocio al que se dedica hace dos años, su aspiración es lograr que sus hijs tengan una buena educación y puedan sacar un título profesional, y así seguir  luchando por el bienestar de su  familia.
texts.en:
Dilma is 32 year old.  She is single.  She is the mother of three children: a daughter, Carla, is 3 years old; and two sons, Luis is 5 and Rodrigo is 8.  Thanks to the hard work that their mother does, they can go to school.  Dilma lives in a rural sector, and she says that she gets her income from raising and selling pigs.

Dilma is requesting a loan to invest in buying more pigs, to increase her business that she has been doing to two years.  Her aspirations are that her children have a good education and can get a professional title, and thus continue striving for the well being of her family.

loans.use: To buy and sell pigs.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Hellen. She is 55 years old and blessed with 5 children.
She practices maize and beans farming and runs a retail shop. Having undergone hand in hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise development, she has been able to expand her businesses. She is borrowing a loan from Kiva to purchase additional stock of rice, sugar and flour for her shop that will boost sales thus more income. This will enable her support basic family needs with ease.


Hellen is grateful to Kiva and hand in hand Eastern Africa for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of rice, sugar and flour that will help in improving sales thus more income.

loans.name: Deth

texts.en:
Living in Prey Sampov village from generation, Deth has positive view for his future business. He wants to expand business start from small to bigger and bigger business. With the help of wife and support from children, X never loses hope and hard work willing. Currently his business improving dramatically. He owns 6 hectares land and a feeding farm. He needs to get up early morning to feed the pigs and go back late to spend more time on farming; however, it is a challenge for him because his house doesn’t have enough energy to generate light.

He has to get up when the sun raises high enough to see thing clearly and go back home early before the road is too dark to see. As a result, he decided to apply for Kiva to buy a solar home systems. He believes he will have enough energy for his family usage and also improve his working hours.

loans.use: to pay for a solar home system.

location.town: Prey Sampov Village, Pro Snoeb Commune, Rolea Pe E

loans.name: Mastona

texts.ru: Мастона 25 летняя молодая дехканка. Она начала свою деятельность, когда ей было 20 лет. Мастона трудолюбивая и энергичная девушка. Она без труда не может жить. Мастона заниматься животноводством у себя во дворе. Она замужем и имеет детей. Мастона проживает вместе с отцом, матерью, мужем и детьми. Масто решила вместе с мужем отремонтировать дом, и улучшить жилищные условия семьи.  Для купли стройматериалы у Мастоны нет денег, по этой причине она запрашивает кредит.
texts.en:
Mastona is a 25-year-old young farmer. She started her business when she was 20. She is a hardworking and energetic young woman who cannot live without work. She works in animal husbandry on her own land and is married with children. She lives with her parents, her husband and her children.

Mastona and her husband have decided to renovate their house and improve their family's living conditions but she doesn't have the money to buy building materials. For this reason she is requesting a loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es: Jessica tiene 32 años de edad es conviviente con dos hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas agua gaseosas frugos golosinas y galletas. Años atrás se dedicaba a su hogar. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una exhibidora para mostrar sus productos. El grupo “LA AMISTAD” agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Jessica es la primera del lado izquierdo viste polera negra.
texts.en:
Jessica is 32 years old.  She is married with two dependent children.  She works selling, drinks, water, sodas, fruit juices, candies, and cookies.  Years ago she started this in her home.

She will invest the loan to buy a display case to display her products.

The group "La Amistad" (The Friendship) is grateful for the loans that the Kiva investors provide.  Jessica is the first on the left side wearing a black sweatshirt.

loans.use: To buy a display case.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 41 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Rosana works very hard to provide for them.

Rosana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, home product care, and other groceries.

Rosana has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Rosana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Jeison

texts.es: Jeison es un joven muy trabajador que se dedica a la producción de tomate. Solicita un préstamo de quinientos mil colones (₡ 500 000) para la compra de insumos agrícolas necesarios para el crecimiento y buen desarrollo de este cultivo. De esta forma logrará incrementar los ingresos familiares que dependen de esta actividad.
texts.en:
Jeison is a very hard working young man who works in the production of tomatoes.

He is requesting a loan of five hundred thousand colones (₡ 500,000) to buy agricultural input necessary for growth and good development of his crop.  In this way he will increase his family income that depends on this job.

loans.use: To buy agricultural input to cultivate tomatoes.

loans.name: Mwamko Mpya Community Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Lucy, a member of Mwamko Mpya Community Group. She is 57 years old, married and blessed with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in year 2014.

She does maize and potatoes farming. She has benefited much from HiH EA training on enterprise and financial management, which has enabled her to manage her farming business well. 

She is borrowing from Kiva to purchase seeds and fertilizer that will enable her to increase her income. This will enable her to cater to the family needs, such as food and paying school fees for her children.
 
She is grateful to Kiva and its' lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer that will enable her to increase her income.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es: Angélica tiene 22 años, de estado civil casada su esposo es jornalero, tiene una hija de cinco años Kelly estudia en una escuela del sector, no tiene casa propia carece de algunos servicios básicos, hace dos años  se dedica a la crianza de ovejas, los críos son vendidos generando ingreso para ayudar a su esposo con la alimentación, educación de su hija, la ventaja de este pequeño negocio es que puede estar con su niña  y a la vez pastorear sus ovejas. Angélica necesita el dinero para comprar tres ovejas así ganaría un poco más de dinero con la venta de los críos ayudando con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Angelica is 22 years old and married; her husband is a day laborer. She has a 5-year-old daughter, Kelly, who studies at a school of the sector. Angelica has no house of her own; she is lacking some basic services. She has been making a living breeding sheep for two years now. The offspring is sold, generating income to help her husband with food and her daughter's education. The advantage of this small business is that she can be with her daughter and at the same time shepherd her sheep.

Angelica needs the money to buy three sheep, This way, she would earn a little more money with the offspring sales, thus helping with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy three sheep.

loans.name: Rosa Marilu

texts.es:
Rosa con 43 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa familiar,de material noble junto a su cónyuge y su hijo, en el distrito de Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú, en una zona rural. Rosa cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales.Los habitantes de esta localidad dedican en su mayoría a la cría-engorde de ganado vacuno, cría de animales menores y cultivo de productos como (papa, alberjas, maíz).

Rosa se dedica a la cría y venta de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos).Dicho comercio lo realiza en diferentes restaurantes del distrito, contando con 20 años de experiencia en este rubro. Adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola, dicha actividad lo realiza en diferentes caseríos, cercanos al distrito de Santo Tomas. El destino del crédito será para la compra de animales menores y alimento de los mismos, para luego comercializarlos, y de esta manera generar mas ingresos, para beneficio propio y de su familia.

Rosa es socia nueva para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She lives in the family house which is made out of solid materials together with her spouse and her child. They live in a rural area of the district of Santo Tomás, Cutervo province, in the department of Cajamarca, Perú. Rosa has very good work and personal references. The inhabitants of this place work mainly in raising and fattening livestock, raising small animals and growing products like potatoes, peas and corn.

Rosa works raising and selling small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, pigs). She does her business with different restaurants in the district and she has 20 years of experience in this field. She also works as agricultural labor which she does in a number of villages close to the district of Santo Tomás.

The loan will be used to buy small animals and feed for them which she will later sell. In this way she will generate more income for her benefit and that of her family.

Rosa is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy small animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Bukaluba Sibutankdikeko Group

texts.en:
The group is located in a rural area and the current members include: Hanifah, Joseph, Gonzaga, Aisha, Juliet, Hawa and Agnes carrying out different activities which include: farming, trading and local brewing among others
Gonzaga is a married man aged 45 with 5 children of whom 2 are attending different schools in different areas. He deals in local brewing and also farming as his side business. He started his business in 1993. He works 6 days in a week and 10 hours per day and started his business to improve on his income and to get food for the family. He acquired this loan to boost in local brewing business.
His future hope is to educate his children and the challenge he faces is limited market and he describes himself as honest and hardworking man and he also appreciates the services offered.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for farming and brewing.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en:
Alpha is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Alpha has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of Maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alpha would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Alpha can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Alpha will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Alpha is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina who is in her mid-30s is married with twins, who are still at school. She has been running a grocery store for five years now. She works from 8 am to midnight daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Amina's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy fast-selling drinks for her grocery store and will start selling these goods in her grocery store. She dreams of expanding her grocery store into a supermarket.

Amina will be accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy fast-selling drinks for her grocery store and will start selling these goods in her grocery store.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is 51 years old, married and lives in Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is known in their place for her sari-sari store (convenience store) business. She accessed her initial capitalization of her business from Paglaum MPC and had successfully expanded her business from time to time. Recently, she availed of a loan to restock her store with consumable items such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, confectioneries and condiments.

loans.use: to restock her store with consumable items such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, confectioneries and condiments.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic owns and operates a retail store in Lower Langcangan, Oroquieta City. She is 55 years old and married with adult age children. She is an active member of Paglaum MPC and has availed loan products already. Now, she asks as loan to restock her store with consumable goods. Marivic would like to take advantage having enough inventory to not miss sales.

loans.use: to restock her store with consumable goods

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, John has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, John would have had to sell his maize during harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, John can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, John will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare.

John is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices during harvest.

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Haruna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Haruna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Haruna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Haruna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sani is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Sani would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sani will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.


With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Sani now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Ayuba has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Ayuba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Ayuba can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Ayuba will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Ayuba is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: Saídu

texts.en:
Saídu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Saídu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Saídu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Saídu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Saídu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Saídu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 53 years old, married and has four children.

Lucita is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lucita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Lucita has been in this business for 6 years and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ailyn is 40 years old and has three children are still in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices, and other materials for her food vending.

Ailyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, spices, and other materials for her food vending.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 43 years old and married with six children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines, and is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Melanie has been in this business for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 33 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Margarita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 59 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods, and other items.

Marilyn has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods, and other items.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 46 years old and married with three children, one of whom is still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods, and other items.

Marjorie has been in this business for three years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods, and other items.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional household goods to sell like milk, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

Melanie has been in this business for 10 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell like milk, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 59 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods, and items for a personal collection.

Julita has been in this business for five years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, sugar, soap, shampoo, snack foods, and items for a  personal collection.

loans.name: Ma. Haydee

texts.en:
Ma. Haydee is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Haydee is 44 years old and has one child still in school.

She has a buy-and-sell personal collection business in the Philippines. Ma. Haydee requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional products of a personal collection like body lotion, perfume, deodorant, beauty soap, lipstick, and other personal care products.

Ma. Haydee has been in this business for two years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional products of a personal collection like body lotion, perfume, deodorant, beauty soap, lipstick, and other personal care products.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 49 years old and married with one child. Annie works very hard to provide for the family.

Annie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

Annie has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Annie would like to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Santas

texts.en:
Santas is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Santas is 59 years old now.

Santas has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Santas requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials such as foam, thread, etc., to use in her business.

Santas has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Santas would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials such as foam, thread, etc., to use in her business.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 32 years old and has one child still in school.

She has a pottery making business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like sand, cement, and other materials.

Jocelyn has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like sand, cement, and other materials.

loans.name: Teofreda

texts.en:
Teofreda is a 55-year-old woman. She lives with her family in a town of Tubigon, Bohol. She earns a living by running a sari-sari (variety) store business while her husband is driving a “habal-habal” (a motorcycle with an extended seat to accommodate more passengers).

Teofreda sells varieties of goods such as toiletries, foods, canned goods and drinks. Aside from her sari-sari store business, she is also engaged in “buri” (the largest palm in the Philippines) weaving.

For this, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy grocery items such as soft drinks, eggs, spices, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, chips, candies, biscuits, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, and chocolate milk. In the future, Teofreda wishes to improve her business for their sustainability.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, spices, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, cooking oil, chips, candies, biscuits, laundry soap, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, and chocolate milk.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 40 years old and married with four children.

Arlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

Arlyn has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from farming rice.

Arlyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 56 years old and married with 11 children. With one child still in school, Cristita works very hard to provide for them.

Cristita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

Cristita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Cristita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, bread, snack foods and other personal care products.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. Maria is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Maria has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a married woman and has three grown children. She caters home meals to the neighbors and local dwellers in her place. She is a 58-year-old, married woman and a resident in the town of Dauis, Bohol.

Her husband works in a private company.

For the past five years, she has owned and sold home meals like fish soup, fried chicken, stewed vegetables and other native menus. Her regular customers are very fond of her recipes.

She would like to improve the quality of her business and is happy to serve her customers.

She has requested a loan to purchase supplies like meat, fish and vegetables. In that way, Angelita could be able to do bulk purchases and prepare a variety of meals.

In the future, Angelita dreams of putting up a "carenderia," also known as an eatery, for her business to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like meat, fish and vegetables.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 51 years old, married and has two children.

Leonisa is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Leonisa requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Leonisa has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Leonisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 56 years old and has eight children. Ma. Luz is married, and one of her children is still in school.

Ma. Luz is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Luz requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

She supplements this income with earnings from buying and selling charcoal.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Maricel dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Indira

texts.ru: Индира, 41 год, не замужем, есть 2 детей. У Индиры средне-специальное образование, она швея. С 2003 года она занимается пошивом и реализацией головных уборов и сувенирной продукции (игрушек) на продажу. Ежемесячно ездит в город Бишкек за фурнитурой и материалами. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она готовит национальные блюда на продажу. Швейное дело, это и основной источник доходов для Индиры и ее любимое дело. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет всего около 9,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, этих средств не хватает на достойное содержание семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Индира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку ткани и фурнитуры для пошива головных уборов. Доходы Индира планирует и дальше вкладывать в расширение ее бизнеса и образование детей.
texts.en:
Indira is 41, single, and the mother of two children.  She has a specialized secondary education and she works as a seamstress.  She has been sewing and selling hats and souvenir items (toys) since 2003.  She goes to Bishkek every month to buy supplies and materials.  As an additional source of income for her family, she prepares and sells traditional Kyrgyz dishes, but it is her sewing activity that constitutes the main source of income for Indira and her dear children.  She makes a monthly income of only 9,000 som (KGS), which is not sufficient for a decent standard of living.

Eager to further grow her business, Indira has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy fabrics and supplies in order to sew hats.  She is planning to use her earnings to further expand her business and to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and supplies in order to sew hats and boost her income.

loans.name: Jose David

texts.es: José tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil casado, vive con su esposa y su pequeña hija Paola de 1 año de edad,es un padre responsable y muy trabajador, viven en el sector rural, José dedica a la agricultura hace 15 años, solicita el crédito para la siembra y cultivo de papas y así obtener ganancias para seguir cumpliendo con su responsabilidad de padre.
texts.en: José is 42-years old. He is married and lives with his wife and little 1-year old daughter, Paola. He is a responsible father and very hard-working. They live in the rural area. José has worked in agriculture for 15 years. He is asking for a loan to plant and grow potatoes, and thus get earnings to keep fulfilling his responsibility as a father.

loans.use: to plant and grow potatoes.

loans.name: Caridad Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Veracruz se puede apreciar una comunidad que, al adentrarse en el camino que conduce al “jícaro”, se pueden apreciar diferentes paisajes ofrecidos por la naturaleza y algunos más por la mano del hombre. Una edificación importante es la vidriera donde se elaboran todo tipo de botellas. En una de las localidades cercanas se  integró un grupo el cual lleva por nombre Caridad pues las integrantes se identifican con esta cualidad ya que es la virtud de amar a los demás como a ellas mismas.
   Las integrantes de caridad son: Alejandra quien vende cosméticos y zapatos por catálogo; Cristina, ovejas y cerdos; Amalia, comida; Karla, cosméticos y queso; Luz, cerdo y zapatos; María, comida y pollo; Susana, cosméticos y zapatos artesanales; Edith, ropa y cerdos; Isabel, comida, pan y dulces mientras que Mariana se dedica a la cría de cerdos.
   Doña Isabel es una mujer muy trabajadora quien desde hace 20 años formó una familia unida con su esposo Apolinar y sus tres hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de la pareja pues aún continúan estudiando. La mayoría la conoce como Chabe y, con el firme propósito de ofrecerle lo mejor a sus hijos, decidió continuar con la actividad que desempeña al lado de su madre: la venta de tamales, chiles rellenos, dulces de leche, ajonjolí, coco, naranja, limón, entre otras delicias típicas del país. “Mis hijos son lo más importante; son la fuente de inspiración para dar lo mejor de mí día con día” expresa alegre. Atribuye su éxito a la sazón que adquieren sus alimentos con en la leña, sus precios por debajo de los de la competencia y su atención a los clientes quienes acuden pues gustosos día con día. 
   Las ganancias obtenidas durante todos sus años de experiencia le han permitido apoyara a su esposo con  los gastos del hogar e iniciar con nuevas actividades. El préstamo que ha solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, chile, carne, aceite, manteca, leña y pan, de tal manera que gradualmente consolida un patrimonio para sus hijos. 
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de Karla, doña Chabe es quien viste short gris y está al lado de doña Susana quien viste playera roja.
texts.en:
In the state of Veracruz, you can see a community where, upon entering on the road that leads to the "jícaro (gourd)," you can see different landscapes offered by nature and others which are manmade. An important building is the showcase where they make all types of bottles. In one of the nearby towns, a group was formed which has the name of "Caridad (Charity)" since the members identify themselves with this quality because it is the virtue of loving others as you love yourself.

The members of Caridad are: Alejandra who sells cosmetics and shoes through a catalog, Cristina sells sheep and pigs, Amalia sells food, Karla sells cosmetics and cheese, Luz sells pigs and shoes, María sells food and chicken, Susana sells cosmetics and craft shoes, Edith sells clothing and pigs, Isabel sells food, bread and sweets, and Mariana raises pigs.

Isabel is a very hard-working woman who, 20 years ago, formed a united family with her husband, Apolinar, and her three children who economically depend on them because they are still in school. Most people know her as "Chabe" and, with the firm intention of offering her children the best, she decided to continue with the job that she does alongside her mother: selling tamales, stuffed chilies, caramels, sesame, coconut, orange, lemon and other typical delicacies of the country.

"My children are the most important thing. They are the source of inspiration for me to give my best day after day," she says happily. She attributes her success to the flavor that her foods get from the firewood, her prices which are below her competitors, and the attention she gives her customers who willingly come every day. The earnings that she has gotten during all her years of experience have allowed her to support her husband with the household expenses and to start new jobs.

The loan that she has asked for will be invested into buying corn, chiles, meat, oil, butter, firewood and bread, so that she gradually consolidates assets for her children.

*The photo was taken on Karla's patio. Chabe is dressed in grey shorts and is next to Susana who is dressed in a red t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy corn, chiles, meat, oil, butter, firewood and bread.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 120,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. She hopes that in the future, she will own a wholesale shop. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish.

loans.name: St. John Kyotera School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is John. He is the Head teacher of St. John Primary School Kyotera, a mixed school in the urban area of Masaka with 450 students. St. John Primary School Kyotera has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

St. John Primary School Kyotera School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. John ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki, who is 53 years old, from village Maghlaki, lives with his wife and 2 unemployed sons. To take care of his family's increased needs Akaki engaged in cattle breeding. He takes care with 5 cattle and gets small income from agribusiness. However, the income is insignificant to meet all daily expenses and make financial stability. Akaki wants to trade with fruits and vegetables and started seek for the credit among local financial institutions. His request was approved several times for his family's poor living condition.

A loan of 4000 GEL will be a great support to this hard-working man and his family, enabling him to purchase a car and start selling fruits and vegetables through the district. He will be able to increase the productivity and make better style of life for his sons.
Akaki and his family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will highly appreciate their support.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start trading with fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Richard Wilfrido

texts.es: Richard tiene 43 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, el tiene 4 hijos, vive en el sector rural con su madre y comenta que sus ingresos los obtiene de la compra y venta de leche, Richard va a invertir el crédito en el incremento de mas litros de leche para aumentar su negocio al que se dedica 10 años, su aspiración es lograr que sus hijos tengan una educación de calidad y puedan ser unos buenos profesionales, y así seguir  luchando por el bienestar de el y de su familia.
texts.en: Richard is 43 years old, single with four children. He lives in a rural area with his mother and remarks that his income comes from buying and selling milk. Richard has been in this business for ten years. He will use the loan to buy more litres of milk to grow his business . His ambition is that his children get a decent education allowing them to become solid professionals. This will allow him to continue to fight for the well being of his family.

loans.use: to buy and sell milk.

loans.name: Victoria Rossana

texts.es:
Victoria continúa con su negocio de venta de dulces y comida. El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó comprando golosinas  y refrescos por mayor para abastecer su snack, el pago de sus cuotas fue continuo y normal porque su negocio funciona correctamente. Actualmente su negocio funciona a diario y la temporada de clases llega a su fin, por lo que sus principales clientes descansarán hasta el próximo año, “estoy tomando las previsiones para no cerrar mi negocio en época de vacaciones…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los estudiantes son buenos consumidores, la desventaja es la falta de un refrigerador para la venta de helados y otros alimentos congelado. Su sueño es aumentar sus ventas, ella desea comprar un refrigerador para vender helados y otros alimentos frescos en época de vacaciones para no cerrar su negocio. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Victoria solicita un préstamo para comprar un refrigerador para vender helados y otros alimentos frescos en época de vacaciones para no cerrar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria continues with her business selling candies and food. She used the loan she obtained to buy snacks and drinks wholesale to stock her snack stand. Her payments were made continuously and normally because her business functioned properly. Right now she runs her business every day and the school year is ending, so her main customers will be gone until next year. “I'm taking steps to not close my business during the vacation season”, she remarks. The advantage of her business is that the students are good consumers. The disadvantage is alack of a refrigerator to sell ice cream and other frozen food. Her dream is to increase her sales. She wants to buy a refrigerator to sell ice cream and other fresh food during the vacation season so she won't close her business. This is her 2nd loan cycle with the institution during the 3 years she has been doing this activity.

It is for these reasons that Victoria is asking for a loan to buy a refrigerator to sell ice cream and other fresh food during the vacation season so she won't close her business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to sell ice cream and other fresh food during the vacation season so she won't close her business.

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es: Lisbeth es una joven que se dedica a realizar trabajos digitales desde su hogar, actualmente tiene varios clientes a los que pretende darle este servicio, por lo cual necesita comprar  equipo de cómputo para realizar esta actividad, Está solicitando un préstamo de un millón de colones (₡ 1 000 000) para realizar dicha compra.
texts.en: Lisbeth is a young woman who does digital work from home. Right now, she has several customers for whom she intends to provide this service. To do that, she needs to buy a computer to do this activity. She is asking for a loan of a million Colones (₡ 1 000 000) to make this purchase.

loans.use: to buy a computer and office equipment.

loans.name: Los Artesanos De Santa Ana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS ARTESANOS DE SANTA ANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Teresa ella es viuda  y tiene 62 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras en uno de los mercados de la zona, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar mercadería como verduras.
Los demás socios en general agraden el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
These are the members of the community bank "LOS ARTESANOS DE SANTA ANA" which is located in the district of Santa Ana in the province of La Convención, department of Cusco.

One of the members, Teresa, is a widow and 62 years old. Her business is selling vegetables at one of the markets in the area. She has been working in this sector for quite some time and it is going well for her because of the hard work she puts into it every day. She is a responsible, determined person who wants to continue working to support her family.

She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise such as vegetables.

The members, in general, are grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as vegetables.

loans.name: El Diamante 13 Group

texts.es:
El recorrido para llegar a cierta comunidad veracruzana ofrece hermosos paisajes, de los cuales destacan los sembradíos de caña de azúcar, los extensos potreros y una laguna cristalina. Cerca del rio tonto acuden muchos habitantes a refrescarse  y practicar la pesca, misma que se ha convertido en una actividad económica productiva. En dicha comunidad se formó un grupo integrado por 13 personas el cual lleva por nombre El Diamante 13 ya que cada “diamante” debe cumplir sus metas para lograr un objetivo total. Sus integrantes son: Jorge quien vende abarrotes y maneja un taxi; María R., abarrotes; María L., comida; Olga, ropa; Iris, calzado por catálogo; Patricia y María M., pollos; Flora, pan y sandalias; Lirio, artesanías; Francisca y Marbella, cosméticos; Angélica, recipientes plásticos y Angélica R., caña de azúcar. 
   Doña Flora es una mujer muy trabajadora a quien todos le conocen simplemente como  Flor. Desde hace más de ocho años se ha dedicado a la venta de pan en tanto en su casa como en otras localidades. En un inicio vendía 300 piezas a la semana en promedio, hoy en día alcanza la cantidad de 1500 piezas por lo que integró la venta de volovanes que han tenido un gran éxito. Todos los clientes le mencionan que su producto tiene un sabor único ya que es cocido con leña y dentro de un horno de piedra. Su hijo mayor la apoya por las tarde pues recorre las comunidades ofreciendo el pan recién salido del horno.
   Las ganancias obtenidas le han permitido iniciar con la venta de sandalias de tal manera que han aumentado sus ingresos. De igual forma, desde hace 6 meses inició con la cría de cerdos como actividad secundaría.
   El préstamo que se le ha otorgado lo invertiría en la compra de pan de diversas presentaciones y sandalias de diferentes modelos y  números. “Gracias a Dios y a cada una de las personas que han hecho posible los beneficios pues cada uno de nosotros hemos mejorado nuestras actividades” expresó como agradecimiento.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de doña Flor quien viste playera blanca y está al lado de doña Olga quien viste playera verde.
texts.en:
The route to arrive at a certain Veracruz community offers beautiful landscapes, which include fields of sugar cane, extensive pastures, and a crystalline lagoon. Near the Tonto River, many residents come to cool off and practice fishing, which has become a productive economic activity. In said community, a group was formed of 13 members, and is named "El Diamante 13" because every "diamante (diamond)" must meet their goals to achieve the total goal. The members are: Jorge who sells grocery items and drives a taxi, María R. who sells grocery times, Olga who sells clothing, Iris who sells shoes from a catalog, Patricia and María M., who sell chickens, Flora who sells bread and sandals, Lirio who sells crafts, Francisca and Marbella who sell cosmetics, Angélica who sells plastic containers, and Angélica R, who sells sugar cane.

Flora is a very hard-working woman, who everyone knows simply as Flor. For more than 8 years she has worked selling bread in her house as well as other locations. At the start, she used to sell 300 pieces a week on average. Today she reaches the quantity of 1500 pieces so she joined the "volovan (Veracruz empanadas)" sales and has had a lot of success. All of the customers tell her that her product has a unique flavor because it is cooked with firewood in a stone oven.

Her older son helps her in the afternoon and travels around the communities offering the freshly baked bread. The earnings that she gets have allowed her to start selling sandals which has increased her income. At the same time, 6 months ago, she started raising pigs as a secondary job.

The loan that she has requested will be invested into buying different styles of bread, and different styles and sizes of sandals. "Thanks to God and to every one of the people who have enabled the benefits because each one of us have improved our jobs," she expressed as gratitude.

*The photo was taken on Flor's patio and she is dressed in a white t-shirt and is beside Olga who has on a green t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy bread and sandals.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan tiene 40 años de edad,es de estado civil soltero,tiene una hija Melany de 7 años de edad, es un padre responsable pues trabaja muy duro para darle lo necesario a su niña. Se dedica a la pintura hace 20 años de edad, solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales que utiliza en esta dificil actividad y asi poder obtener mas ganancias para seguir cumpliendo con su responsabilidad de padre.
texts.en:
Juan, 40, is single and has a daughter, Melany, who is seven years old. He is a responsible father who works very hard to provide everything his daughter needs. For 20 years he has worked in painting.

The loan he is requesting is to buy materials to use in this difficult activity so he can earn more and meet his responsibilities as a father.

loans.use: to buy materials to use in his decorations.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor De Habaspata Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “DIOS ES AMOR DE HABASPATA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Vilcabamba, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Luzmila ella es soltera  y tiene 34 años de edad y tiene 02 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia cría a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica a la agricultura , la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abono entre otros.
Los demás socios en general agraden el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
These members belong to the community bank "DIOS ES AMOR DE HABASPATA" which is located in the district of Vilcabamba in the province of La Convencion, department of Cusco.

One of the members is Luzmila. She is 34 years old and has two children, and alternates her daily activities with her business raising small animals which she sells to customers on an order basis.

For quite some time the member has been in business thanks to the hard work she dedicates to it every day. She also works in agriculture and wants to continue working to support her family.

Luzmila is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other goods.

The members, in general, are grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

The person whose face is covered does not belong to the community bank.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other goods.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Carmen

texts.es: Mercedes es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 28 años de edad se dedica a prestar sus servicios en un proyecto comunal, lo que le permite brindar lo necesario a su familia. Mercedes es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su pequeño hijo de 5 años de edad al que siempre trata de brindar lo mejor. Mercedes siempre buscando la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo ha decidido iniciar con la venta de prendas de vestir, actividad que cuenta con mucha demanda en esta temporada que se acerca, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisetas, entre otros productos, además utilizara una parte para reparar la pared, por lo que espera contar con este apoyo para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 28, is a hard-working woman who offers her services at a community project which allows her to cover her family's needs.

A single mother, Mercedes lives in her own home with her 5-year-old son, always trying hard to give him the best she can. In an effort to enjoy a better quality of life she decided to sell clothing, which is a business with much demand for the upcoming season. Therefore she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy pants, skirts, blouses, t-shirts and other products. She also will use part of the loan to repair a wall. She trusts she will receive this support to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy pants, skirts, blouses, t-shirts and other products, as well as to repair a wall.

loans.name: Anonymous
