loans.use: to buy more merchandise to be able to increase her sales and earnings.

loans.name: Mario Tobias

texts.es: Don Mario se dedica a la venta de alimentos al por mayor. Él solicita un préstamo de quinientos setenta mil colones (₡ 570 000), dinero que usará para la compra de alimentos, esto con el fin de aumentar su volumen de inventario y poder incrementar las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en: Mario sells wholesale foods and is requesting a loan in the amount of 570,000 CRC to buy goods.  This is to increase his inventory and boost sales.

loans.use: to buy foods to sell wholesale.

loans.name: Yuris Del Carmen

texts.es: Yuris es habitante de Cartagena de Indias y reside en compañía de su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en una vivienda ubicada en este municipio. Su idea de negocio surgió por su vocación; desde niña su gusto por la belleza y la estética se hizo notar y en cuanto entró a la etapa de la adolescencia empíricamente arreglaba el cabello de sus primas, les realizaba tratamientos capilares y posteriormente les cepillaba el cabello.  En cuanto tuvo la oportunidad de capacitarse, tomó clases que le permitieron abrir su salón de Belleza, en el que cuenta con 15 años de experiencia, ofreciendo cortes de cabello unisex, tratamientos capilares a la vanguardia y arreglo de uñas.  Yuris abre su salón de belleza de martes a domingo a partir de las 11 a.m. en jornada continua hasta las 9 p.m. y sus principales clientes se encuentran en la periferia del sector.  Sus compras las realiza en el mercado de Bazurto en casas de belleza y como se está aproximando la temporada decembrina, sus clientes se interesan mucho más en mejorar su apariencia es por ello que necesita invertir en productos de peluquería; keratina, blondor, masajes capilares y shampoo, para ello está aplicando a una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Su meta a futuro es mejorar la apariencia del local y tener un salón más atractivo, en lo personal desea que sus hijos puedan tener acceso a estudios profesionales y que su trabajo le provea de los recursos necesarios.
texts.en: Yuris is a resident of Cartagena de Indias. She lives with her spouse and their three children in a home located in this city. Her business idea started from a vocation. Since she was a little girl, she liked beauty and esthetics. This was noticed when she became a teenager and on her own started fixing her cousins' hair. She would give them hair treatments and later brush their hair. As soon as she had the chance to get trained, she took classes that allowed her to open her beauty salon. She now has 15 years experience with it, offering unisex haircuts, cutting edge hair treatments and nail services. Yuris opens her salon from Tuesday through Sunday, starting at 11 a.m. and continuing until 9 p.m. Her main customers are from the edge of the neighborhood. She makes her purchases in the Bazurto market. Since the December season is coming,  her customers are much more interested in improving their appearance. That is why she needs to invest in hair products: keratin, hair lightener, hair massages, and shampoo. To do that, she is applying for a loan, her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Her goal for the future is to improve the appearance of her locale and have a more attractive salon. Her personal goal is for her children to be able to get a college education and for her work to provide the necessary resources.

loans.use: to invest in hair products: keratin, hair lightener, hair massgers and shampoo

loans.name: Jessica Paola

texts.es: Jessica es una tendera reconocida en San Jacinto un municipio de Bolívar en donde reside en compañía de su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, esta actividad la inició con la ayuda de un familiar que tenía experiencia en esta labor y su principal motivación para involucrarse en este negocio fue la oportunidad de generar ingresos adicionales para su hogar, así como continuar velando por el cuidado de sus dos pequeños hijos y las labores en el hogar. Su idea de negoció surgió al considera que el punto donde se aperturó la tienda estaba cotizado y manejaba gran afluencia de clientes, sin lugar a la duda la intuición de Jessica no le falló y ha obtenido excelentes resultados.  Actualmente en su tienda ofrece víveres y abarrotes, sin embargo desea incorporar nuevos productos a su oferta entre ellos; prendas de vestir y bisutería, lo que le garantizaría incrementar sus ingresos, es por ello que está aplicando a una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para llevar a cabo este proyecto. Su meta de negocio es convertirse en una distribuidora de tiendas de barrio y en lo personal desea educar muy bien a sus hijos y garantizarles estudios de calidad.
texts.en:
Jessica is a well-known shopkeeper in San Jacinto, a town of Bolivar where she lives with her partner and her two children. This job was started with the help of a family member who had experience in this field. Her main motivation to get involved in this business was the opportunity to get additional income for her home, and ensuring continuing care for her two young children and the household jobs.

Her business idea came about when she was considering how the place where she opened the store was sought after and drove in a large number of customers. Without a doubt, Jessica's intuition did not fail her and she has received excellent results. Currently in her store she offers provisions and grocery items. However, she wants to incorporate new products to offer such as items of clothing and jewelry, which will guarantee an increase in her income. For that reason, she is applying for a loan, her first Credikiva with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to carry out this project.

Her business goal is to become a distributor of neighborhood stores, and her personal goal is that she wants to educate her children really well and guarantee them a quality education.

loans.use: to incorporate new products to offer, such as items of clothing and jewelry.

loans.name: Matumaini Group

texts.fr: Elizabeth est commerçante, trésorière de la banque villageoise «Matumaini», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un cambiste, âgée de 39 ans, mère de 6 enfants scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un  marché secondaire de la ville depuis 10 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en six sacs de manioc. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler qu'une cliente est avec son bébé.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a retailer, a customer of the MFI Hekima, and the treasurer of the Matumaini "banc villageois". She is married to a trader, 39 years old, and the mother of 6 children who attend school.

She has been selling food products at a secondary market in town for 10 years. She is going to buy 6 bags of cassava. She started her business with funds she received from her husband. She would like to ensure that her children get an education. Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support its gives to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

Please note that one customer is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to buy 6 bags of cassava.

loans.name: Salama Group

texts.fr: Kalume est commerçante, présidente du groupe de crédits «Salama», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 32  ans, mère de 5 enfants dont 4 scolarisés et 1 n’étudie pas. Elle est vendeuse d’haricots dans le marché de la ville depuis 12 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 180kg d’haricots. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité et scolariser ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kalume is a retailer, a customer of MFI Hekima, and the leader of the Salama loan group. She is married, 32 years old, and the mother of 5 children, 4 of whom go to school and one of whom does not.

She has been selling beans at the town market for 12 years. She will buy 180 kilos of beans. She started her business with funds she received from her husband. She would like to grow her business and ensure that her children get an education. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the support it gives to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 180 kilos of beans.

loans.name: Ishara Group

texts.fr: Neema est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Ishara», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 34 ans, mère de 4 enfants dont 3 scolarisés et 1 n’étudie pas. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires dans un dépôt du centre commercial depuis 3 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 5 sacs de maïs et 5 sacs d’haricots. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité et scolariser ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Neema is a retailer, a customer of the MFI Hekima and a member of the Ishara community bank. She is married, 34 years old, and the mother of 4 children, three of whom go to school and one of whom does not.

She has been selling food products in a warehouse in the town's commercial centre for 3 years. She will buy 5 bags of maize and 5 bags of beans. She started her business with funds she received from her husband. She would like to grow her business and ensure that her children get an education. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for the support it gives to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of maize and 5 bags of beans.

loans.name: Christanie

texts.fr: Christanie, 27 ans, est marié et mère d’un enfant qui va à l’école. Pour prendre soin de son enfant et couvrir sa scolarité, elle revend des produits alimentaires à domicile. Sur son stand de marchandises, elle range des paquets de spaghetti, des petits bidons d’huile, des sacs de chips, des épices, etc. Face aux difficultés qu’elle rencontre, elle travaille très dur pour assurer la pérennité de son commerce. Elle cherche du financement pour augmenter son stock de riz jaune.
texts.en:
27-year-old Christanie is married and the mother of one child who goes to school.

In order to be able to take care of her child and cover her child's educational expenses, she sells food products from her home. She displays items like packets of spaghetti, small cans of oil, packets of crisps, and spices on her stall. She works very hard to ensure that her business is sustainable despite the difficulties that she encounters.

She is looking for financing in order to increase her inventory of yellow rice.

loans.use: to buy bags of yellow rice.
